Even if neither of these things transpired, and the police decided to find the car, it struck me as unlikely that they would. The vehicle was surely hidden at this point, if not actually destroyed. It could be almost anywhere in either Austria or Switzerland. And the chances that it still carried its original license plates were surely nearly nonexistent.

总体而言，政治风险相当大，而实际收益似乎也并不大。

On balance, the political risks would be substantial and the practical benefits seemed at best modest.

因子人已经逃离了我们。

Factor Man had escaped us.

因子人

Factor Man

2018 年 6 月 11 日

June 11, 2018

我从苏黎世下了飞机，就收到了一封电子邮件。（虽然我很喜欢 TOR，但在飞机上查看 Factor Man 的电子邮件似乎有点不合时宜。）

I got off the plane from Zurich to be greeted by an email. (Much as I loved TOR, checking the Factor Man email from a plane seemed to be pushing my luck.)

发件人：Robert Hasday (rjhasday@duanemorris.com)

From: Robert Hasday (rjhasday@duanemorris.com)

收件人：Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

To: Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

回复：新客户？

Re: new client?

快递员已将包裹送达我们维也纳办公室，并指示将资金存入我们办公室。

Courier has package, instructed deposit funds our Vienna office.

但愿维也纳之旅现在已彻底成为我的过去。

Vienna was hopefully now well and truly behind me.

8

8

哈德森

Hudson

2018 年 6 月 11 日

June 11, 2018

年代o：Factor Man 有一名律师。

So: Factor Man had a lawyer.

纽约的大型律师事务所以强硬著称，他们的业务往往取决于这种声誉。我以为 Hasday 和其他 Duane Morris 律师会比谷歌更不合作，至少一开始是这样。但他们没有让人失望。

Big New York law firms have a reputation for being tough, and their business often depends on that reputation. I expected Hasday and the other Duane Morris attorneys to be even less cooperative than Google had been, at least initially. They did not disappoint.

不，他们不会向我提供 Hasday 的客户名单。

No, they would not provide me with a list of Hasday’s clients.

不，他们不在乎国家安全是否受到威胁。不，他们不在乎是否有法律先例表明客户的简单姓名不受律师-客户特权的保护。如果联邦调查局或任何其他人想要一份客户名单，他们必须获得搜查令。

No, they did not care that national security was at risk. No, they didn’t care that there was legal precedent to the effect that the simple name of a client was not protected by attorney-client privilege. If the FBI or anyone else wanted a client list, they would have to get a warrant.

我拿到了搜查令。

I got a warrant.

杜安莫里斯提出上诉。

Duane Morris appealed.

我们辩称，迫在眉睫的恐怖主义威胁意味着杜安莫里斯应该在上诉解决期间移交客户名单。

We argued that an imminent terrorist threat meant that Duane Morris should turn over the client list while the appeal was resolved.

杜安·莫里斯辩称，没有任何证据表明 Factor Man 是恐怖分子，而且有大量证据表明，他在博客上提出分解 255 位数字之前不打算做任何事情。距离分解 255 位数字还有几个月的时间，因此很难看出他有任何紧迫感。

Duane Morris argued that there was no evidence of any kind that Factor Man was a terrorist, and there was plenty of evidence that he didn’t intend to do anything until he had factored 255-bit numbers on the blog. That was still months away, so it was hard to see any sense of imminence in any case.

法官同意了他们的观点。

The judge agreed with them.

我们开始跟踪 Hasday。Duane Morris 威胁要对我们提起骚扰诉讼，于是我们便停止了。

We started following Hasday. Duane Morris threatened us with a harassment suit, and we stopped.

Hasday 的办公室位于百老汇 1540 号，这是纽约的一座大型办公楼。（还有其他类型的办公楼吗？）我们最终尝试联系该大楼的安保公司，并要求查看自 Factor Man 博客开始前六个月以来的所有安保视频。

Hasday’s office was at 1540 Broadway, a big New York office building. (Is there any other kind?) We eventually tried reaching out to the building’s security firm and asking to see all of the security video since six months before the Factor Man blog began.

杜安·莫里斯 (Duane Morris) 毫不介意与联邦政府针锋相对。中城办公室安保公司 (Midtown Office Security) 则容易对付得多；没有一家安保公司愿意激怒执法部门。每周左右回收磁带的日子已经一去不复返了；安保视频被永久保存。中城办公室安保公司非常愿意分享这些视频。我们将视频发送给了美国国家安全局 (NSA) 进行分析。

Duane Morris had no problem going toe to toe with the federal government. Midtown Office Security was a lot easier to deal with; no security firm wants to aggravate law enforcement. Gone are the days when the tapes were recycled every week or so; security video was stored forever. And Midtown Office Security was quite willing to share it. We sent the video to the NSA for analysis.

美国国家安全局拥有最先进的面部识别软件，他们几乎掌握了每个人的照片。比如说，如果你有驾照，美国国家安全局就知道你长什么样。如果你有护照，他们就知道你长什么样。如果你在过去十五年内合法访问过美国，他们也知道你长什么样。

The NSA has better than state-of-the-art facial recognition software, and they have a picture of virtually everyone. Let’s just say that if you have a driver’s license, the NSA knows what you look like. They know what you look like if you’ve got a passport. And they know what you look like if you’ve visited the United States legally in the past fifteen years.

七名特工检查了去过杜安莫里斯大楼的所有人的名单，特别是那些从哈斯戴所在楼层的电梯出来的人的名单。

Seven agents checked the list of names of everyone who had been to the Duane Morris building, especially those who had gotten off the elevator on Hasday’s floor.

我们找到了 Brian Finn，他是 Hasday 的客户，我们不知道的是，他曾向 Factor Man 推荐 Hasday。Finn 拜访过 Duane Morris，这一点我们并不在意；他在华尔街相当出名，所以在名单上看到他一点也不奇怪。

We found Brian Finn, who was a Hasday client and who, unbeknownst to us, had recommended Hasday to Factor Man. We thought nothing of the fact that Finn had visited Duane Morris; he was reasonably well known on Wall Street and it was in no way surprising to see him on the list.

我们还发现了一名叫 Janet Liu 的女性，这很奇怪，原因有二。

And we also found a woman named Janet Liu, which was odd for two reasons.

首先，美国国家安全局强烈怀疑刘晓波是中国特工。他们时不时地监视她，但从未试图窃听她的电话，因为她从不值得关注。现在情况发生了变化。

First, the NSA had a strong suspicion that Liu was in fact a Chinese operative. They had her under intermittent surveillance, but had never sought to tap any of her phones because she had never merited the attention. That now changed.

第二，刘先生的到访发生在正常工作时间。但几天后的一个晚上，另一名中国人到访了该办公室，显然是清洁人员。然而，第二名中国人仅在一周前进入该国。这是巧合，这有点牵强。

Second, Liu’s visit had occurred during normal working hours. But a few nights later, another Chinese national had visited the office, apparently as part of a cleaning crew. The second Chinese national had entered the country only a week earlier, however. That this was a coincidence was quite a stretch.

* * *

* * *

当我们再次与 Hasday 会面时，他并不高兴，但他还是接受了会面。我猜他（正确地）认为这次会面比拒绝要花的时间短。

Hasday was not thrilled when we showed up to meet with him yet again, but took the meeting. My guess is that he decided (rightly) that the meeting would take less time than a refusal.

我和罗恩·利文斯通一起进去，他几个星期前曾陪我去过伯克特的公寓。大部分谈话都是我讲的。

I went in with Ron Livingstone, who had accompanied me to Burkett’s apartment a few weeks previously. I did most of the talking.

“我们有一些令人不安的消息，”我开口道，并继续解释说，杜安莫里斯公司可能发生了入室盗窃，我们担心哈斯德的一些文件已被泄露。

“We have some disturbing news,” I began, and continued to explain that there had likely been a break-in at Duane Morris and that we were concerned that some of Hasday’s files had been compromised.

“哪些文件？”哈斯戴问道。

“Which files?” Hasday asked.

我并没有声称知道。

I didn’t claim to know.

哈斯戴也不知道，尽管他看上去有怀疑。但他肯定不会告诉我们这个怀疑。

Hasday didn’t know either, although he looked like he had a suspicion. It was a suspicion that he certainly wasn’t going to share with us.

通常情况下，我们处理这种情况的方式是等待。被询问的人往往觉得有必要填补空白，提供他们原本不愿意放弃的信息。

Normally, we deal with situations like this by simply waiting. The person being questioned often feels a need to fill the gap, providing information they otherwise would have been unwilling to relinquish.

可悲的是，哈斯戴看过的证词和我看过的调查一样多。他已经学会了永远不要向对手或潜在对手提供信息，除非你需要。那些无论是否在说话都能拿到每小时 1000 美元报酬的人比几个 GS-14 更善于耐心等待。

Sadly, Hasday had seen as many depositions as I had seen investigations. He had learned to never provide information to an adversary, or to a potential adversary, unless you needed to. People who get paid $1000 an hour whether they’re talking or not are better at waiting patiently than a couple of GS-14’s.

罗恩终于打破了沉默。“我们拿到了我们认为可能是闯入者的照片。你愿意看一下吗？”

Ron eventually broke the silence. “We’ve got pictures of the group that we believe may have been responsible for the break-in. Are you willing to take a look?”

Hasday 看到了 Janet Liu 的照片。“你认识这个女人吗？”

Hasday was, and was shown a picture of Janet Liu. “Do you recognize this woman?”

哈斯戴什么也没透露。“她是谁？”

Hasday revealed nothing. “Who is she?”

“这正是我们希望您能告诉我们的。”

“That’s what we were hoping you could tell us.”

哈斯戴把照片推回了桌子对面。“对不起。”他只说了这么一句话。

Hasday pushed the picture back across the table. “I’m sorry,” was all he said.

接下来是中国清洁工的照片。哈斯戴也做出了类似的回应，但我怀疑他这次是认真的。

Next came the picture of the Chinese cleaner. Hasday responded similarly, but I suspected he actually meant it this time.

我和利文斯通互相看了一眼，思考了这个问题。也许呼吁哈斯戴的爱国主义精神会奏效。

Livingstone and I considered this and looked at each other. Maybe an appeal to Hasday’s patriotism would work.

“这些人疑似是中国特工，”利文斯通说。“我们认为中国人可能对你的一份或多份文件感兴趣。”

“These people are suspected Chinese agents,” Livingstone said. “We believe that the Chinese may have taken an interest in one or more of your files.”

“除非你能告诉我是哪个文件，否则我很难帮助你。”

“Unless you can tell me which file, it will be difficult for me to help you.”

“哈斯戴先生，我们来这里的目的是想了解您的一些客户的身份。”

“The reason we’re here, Mr. Hasday, is that we would like to know the identities of some of your clients.”

哈斯戴站了起来。“很抱歉，”他说。“我们似乎陷入了僵局。如果你能更具体地说明你的担忧，也许我可以提供帮助。”

Hasday stood. “I’m sorry,” he said. “We appear to be at an impasse. Perhaps if you can be more specific about your concerns, I will be able to help.”

我怀疑那句话没有一句话是真的。

I suspected that not a word of that was true.

因子人

Factor Man

2018 年 7 月 25 日

July 25, 2018

发件人：Robert Hasday (rjhasday@duanemorris.com)

From: Robert Hasday (rjhasday@duanemorris.com)

收件人：Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

To: Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

回复：新客户？

Re: new client?

FBI 来访。中国人可能已经侵入了你的文件。你觉得呢？

FBI visited. Chinese may have broken into your file. Thoughts?

我笑了。哈斯戴似乎认为短消息比长消息更安全。也许我的阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦消息的简洁性说服了他。

I smiled. Hasday appeared to believe that shorter messages were more secure than longer ones. Perhaps the terseness of my Albert Einstein message had convinced him.

Factor Man：没必要说得这么简短；我们的信息要么被监视，要么没有。信息本身不太可能被阅读，尽管人们看到信息经过（但无法阅读）的可能性很大。

Factor Man: No need to be so brief; either our messages are being watched, or they aren’t. It’s unlikely that the messages themselves are being read, although it is reasonably likely that people see them go by (but can’t read them).

首先，请看一下我的原信。你知道那些电影里有人在纸上写东西，然后男主角用铅笔摩擦下面的纸，看看他们写了什么吗？我寄给你的信的右下角应该写着“FM”。是吗？

First, please find my original letter. You know those movies where someone writes something on a piece of paper and the hero then rubs a pencil over the piece of paper under it to see what they wrote? The letter I sent you should have “FM” written that way in the lower right corner. Is it?

Hasday： 没有，只​​有原始信件。

Hasday: No. Just the original letter.

调查员：只是原信的复印件。为什么 FBI 认为是中国人干的？

Factor Man: Just a copy of the original letter. Why does the FBI think it’s the Chinese?

Hasday：他们有从大楼入口处的安全摄像头拍摄的照片。

Hasday: They have pictures from the security camera at the entrance to the building.

Factor Man：应该没问题。谢谢提醒。

Factor Man: Should be fine. Thanks for the heads up.

这些都不是好消息，但我也不确定这是否是坏消息。事实上，这可能根本不是新闻。

None of this could be good news, but I wasn’t sure that it was such bad news, either. In fact, it might not be news at all.

显然，当我把钱存入斯巴达保险箱时，有人跟踪了我。如果真是这样，那么有人可能已经找到了写给哈斯戴的原信，入室盗窃对我来说就不是什么意外了。事实上，唯一让我惊讶的是，我得知了是中国人干的。

It certainly appeared that someone had followed me when I dropped the money at Sparta Safes. If that happened, then someone had presumably found the original letter to Hasday and the break-in shouldn’t even surprise me. All that had happened, really, was that I had learned that it was the Chinese.

然而，这对我所希望的安静和匿名性来说又是一次致命的打击。

Another nail in the coffin of my hoped-for quiet and anonymity, though.

我不认为这封信会伤害到我。我在 Kinko's 打印了这封信，肯定无法追踪。信封上的标签也是在同一家店打印的。我在出差途经盐湖城转机时寄出了这封信，并且一直小心翼翼地不碰任何东西。我甚至没有想到我的指纹还在盐湖城机场的邮箱上，尽管现在它们肯定已经被擦掉了。

I didn’t think that the letter could hurt me. I had printed it off at a Kinko’s, which was surely untraceable. The label on the envelope had been printed at the same shop. I had mailed the letter while changing planes on a business trip through Salt Lake City, and had been careful never to touch anything. I didn’t even think my prints were on the mailbox in the Salt Lake airport, although they were surely rubbed off by now in any case.

时间流逝。中国人一定意识到他们在苏黎世失去了我，但那并没有带来什么明显的后果。

Time passed. The Chinese must have realized that they had lost me in Zurich, but there were no apparent consequences of that.

2019 年 2 月 15 日

February 15, 2019

2019 年初，情况发生了变化。我离开 Sparta Safes 的视频出现在互联网上。有人猜测那就是我，并向任何能认出照片中人的人提供 50 万美元的奖金。

In early 2019, that changed. Video of me leaving Sparta Safes appeared on the Internet. Someone speculated that it was I, and a prize of half a million dollars was offered to anyone who could identify the fellow in the picture.

它会起作用吗？我当然不希望如此。在视频中，我留着长发，蓄着胡子，戴着太阳镜。而且我走路一瘸一拐，因为一个人的步态几乎和他的指纹一样独特。在大学期间，我打排球时膝盖受伤，拄着拐杖一瘸一拐地走了六个星期，我想我给人留下了相当好的印象。（我不知道为什么计算机科学家如此频繁地喜欢排球，但他们确实如此。）

Would it work? I certainly hoped not. In the video, I had long hair. I had a beard. I had sunglasses. And I had a limp, because a person’s gait is almost as distinctive as his fingerprints. I had spent six weeks hobbling around with a cane in college after a knee injury playing volleyball, and figured I had given a pretty good impression. (I have no idea why computer scientists have such a frequent affinity for volleyball, but they do.)

但看到别人在看我，我非常生气。我不太能应付这种事。

But it ticked me off that people were looking. I don’t deal well with that.

匿名者是一群激进分子/黑客，也被称为“黑客行动主义者”。他们声称具有社会良知，例如，在克利夫兰 12 岁男孩塔米尔·赖斯被警察杀害后，他们关闭了克利夫兰市网站。

Anonymous is a group of activist/hackers, also known as “hacktivists.” They claim to have a social conscience and, for example, shut down the Cleveland city web site after a twelve-year-old Cleveland boy named Tamir Rice was killed by a policeman.

匿名者在很多方面都和我一样。他们拥有相当高的公众知名度，但本质上却极其神秘。他们确实偶尔出现在公众面前，通常戴着盖伊·福克斯面具，就像电影《V 字仇杀队》中那样。至少，有人自称是匿名者的成员，并戴着面具；无法确定。

In many ways, Anonymous is like me. They have a fairly high public profile, but are fundamentally incredibly secretive. They do appear in public on relatively rare occasions, generally wearing Guy Fawkes masks as in the film V for Vendetta. At least, people claim to be members of Anonymous and wear the masks; it’s impossible to tell for sure.

匿名者甚至有一个网站，anonhq.com。他们有一个联系地址，即 contact@anonhq.com。

Anonymous even has a web site, anonhq.com. They have a contact address, which is contact@anonhq.com.

发件人：Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

From: Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

收件人：contact@anonhq.com

To: contact@anonhq.com

主题： 援助？

Subject: assistance?

我需要一些帮助。有兴趣吗？

I could use some help. Interested?

调频

FM

回复大约需要一个小时。

The reply took about an hour.

来自：联系方式（contact@anonhq.com）

From: Contact (contact@anonhq.com)

收件人：Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

To: Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

回复：协助？

Re: assistance?

ftp.anonhq.com

ftp.anonhq.com

用户因素

user factorman

密码是

The password is the smaller factor of

31901077902561505296729874728386769785784457264035505043881415529088564608023。

31901077902561505296729874728386769785784457264035505043881415529088564608023.

我已经喜欢上这些家伙了。

I liked these guys already.

* * *

* * *

在 Internet 浏览器（如 Explorer 和 Safari）出现之前，人们通过向对方发送文件进行通信。他们使用一种称为文件传输协议 (FTP) 的东西。现在很少有人使用它，但它仍然有效。

Back before there were Internet browsers like Explorer and Safari, people communicated by sending files to one another. They used something called the File Transfer Protocol, or FTP. Not many people used it any more, but it still worked.

匿名者在他们的一台计算机上设置了一个用户，我可以通过 FTP 访问该用户。他们给了我用户名，并给了我足够的提示，如果我有我声称的能力，我就可以生成密码。

The Anonymous guys had set up a user on one of their computers that I could access using FTP. They had given me the user name, and given me enough of a hint that if I had the abilities I claimed, I could generate the password.

密码是 97552088883039660558320728539627925591。他们好心地使用了较小的因子，为我节省了一位数字的输入时间。

The password was 97552088883039660558320728539627925591. Kind of them to use the smaller factor, saving me one digit of typing.

我登录了他们创建的账户，浏览了一下。那里有一个文件，名为 README.txt。我将其复制回自己的机器并打开它。

I logged into the account they had created, and looked around. There was one file there, called README.txt. I copied it back to my own machine and opened it.

我们能为您做什么？

What can we do for you?

我又创建了一个名为 answer.txt 的小文件。（一般来说，README 文件的标题要大写，其他部分则不用大写，除非您是 90 年代的 AOL 客户。）

I made another little file called answer.txt. (There is a general convention that README files have their titles capitalized but little else does, unless you’re an AOL customer from the 90’s.)

那得看情况。首先，你能追踪到那个声称是我拍的视频的来源吗？

That depends. For a start, can you trace the origin of the video that claims to be me?

答复在answer2.txt中，而且速度出奇的快。

The response was in answer2.txt and was surprisingly quick.

我们认为您可能会问这个问题。:)中国。

We thought you might ask that. :) China.

他们对这个问题并不感到惊讶，我对这个答案也不感到惊讶。

They weren’t surprised by the question, and I wasn’t surprised by the answer.

因素人：如果我为您提供大约 15 个盒子的 IP 地址和 root 密码，您能将它们拿下来吗？

Factor Man: If I get you IP addresses and root passwords for about fifteen boxes, can you bring them down?

匿名：我们当然需要识别这些盒子。但我们喜欢它，是的，我们可以做到这一点。

Anonymous: We would obviously need to identify the boxes. But we like it and yes, we can do that.

“盒子” 是某处计算机的俚语。

A “box” is slang for a computer somewhere.

Factor Man 博客

The Factor Man blog

428635295576070528272261220629701017899307217608798582035889331=30082458936825333241804437780869×14248678822307247709240 790275799

428635295576070528272261220629701017899307217608798582035889331 = 30082458936825333241804437780869 × 14248678822307247709240790275799

（由 Sam Elliot 请求）

(requested by Sam Elliot)

430115888144930284802219293192354725350626714793856754010763359=29063712193015234867377390669941×14799069206592897220875 257111299

（应西尔维斯特·史泰龙要求）

(requested by Sylvester Stallone)

473190972979958543270703882276405044511057969972897659957191553=25840493192203617980667629148067×18311994645780439247389 331806859

473190972979958543270703882276405044511057969972897659957191553 = 25840493192203617980667629148067 × 18311994645780439247389331806859

（应吉米·法伦要求）

(requested by Jimmy Fallon)

486302771593855890657898732624588219991234832797752236098430989 = 35376519511547264992777585564559×13746484343524003067180 162884771

486302771593855890657898732624588219991234832797752236098430989 = 35376519511547264992777585564559 × 13746484343524003067180162884771

（应马特·达蒙要求）

(requested by Matt Damon)

537249849502555999666691683357255892646249596667512018032738769=27858426320756570381508439025951×19285003514439918916438 647080719

537249849502555999666691683357255892646249596667512018032738769 = 27858426320756570381508439025951 × 19285003514439918916438647080719

（应 John Hennessy 要求）

(requested by John Hennessy)

210 位数字需要两天时间才能分解完成。

210-bit numbers will be factored in two days.

当我开始写这个博客时，我就明确表示我希望保持匿名。这仍然是我的愿望。

When I began this blog, I made it clear that I wished to remain anonymous. That is still my wish.

一些受中国政府委托的人员在互联网上发布了声称是我的视频，并向能辨认出视频中人物的人提供奖励。

Certain individuals working on behalf of the Chinese government have posted video purporting to be of me on the Internet, and a reward has been offered to anyone identifying the figure in that video.

如果您认识此人，我强烈建议您不要泄露该信息。

If you know the individual in question, I encourage you in the strongest possible terms to keep that information to yourself.

中国对隐私（和知识产权）的态度令人无法接受。我是一名非中国公民，不愿我的隐私受到这种挑战。我在中国境外所做的事情根本不关中国的事。

China’s attitude toward privacy (and intellectual property) is unacceptable. I am a private non-Chinese citizen and am not willing to have my privacy challenged in this fashion. What I do outside of China is simply none of China’s business.

因此，我向中国政府提出以下要求：

I therefore have the following demands of the Chinese government:

  1. 你必须撤回因确定我的身份而获得的奖品。
  2. You are to withdraw the prize for determining my identity.
  3. 你必须立即停止一切网络间谍行为。
  4. You are to immediately cease all acts of cyber espionage.
  5. 你必须归还从我纽约市律师办公室偷走的材料。
  6. You are to return the material that was stolen from my attorney’s office in New York City.

您有三天时间来遵守。

You have three days to comply.

该网站已被访问 103,298,817,326 次。

This web site has been visited 103,298,817,326 times.

* * *

* * *

如果你拿起电话拨通伦敦的电话，电话会通过大西洋海底为数不多的几条电缆之一进行传输。这些电缆都有起点和终点，每个终点都由计算机监控。

If you pick up the phone and call London, the call is routed over one of a relative handful of cables running under the Atlantic Ocean. Those cables all need to begin and end somewhere, and each of the terminations is monitored by a computer.

互联网的情况也类似，从国际层面来看，互联网其实非常稀疏。任何特定地理区域通常都通过少数几个点与世界其他地区相连。中国尤其如此，因为它严格监控与外界的所有互联网流量。

The Internet is similar and at the international level, it is actually remarkably sparse. Any particular geographic region is generally connected to the rest of the world at a handful of points. This is especially true for China, which carefully monitors all of its Internet traffic with the outside world.

所有中国互联网流量都要经过 14 台计算机。如果你知道密码，显然可以远程访问这些计算机。计算机有超级用户，他们有权对相关机器做任何他们想做的事情 - 重新启动它们、关闭它们、删除所有文件，等等。这些超级用户在计算机界通常被称为“root”，因此如果你知道某个计算机的 root 密码，你就可以让它崩溃。

There are fourteen computers through which all Chinese Internet traffic has to pass. Each of those computers could obviously be accessed remotely, if you knew the password. Computers have super-users, who have the privileges to do whatever they want to the machines in question – reboot them, shut them down, delete all the files, you name it. These superusers are typically called “root” in the computing world, so if you know the root password to a box, you can crash it.

上述博文发表后的第二天，中国官方新闻机构新华社的所有报纸都刊登了回应。总共有 20 家中文、英文和其他 6 种语言的报纸刊登了该回应。

The day after the above blog post, a response appeared in every paper published by Xinhua News, which is China’s official press agency. All told, it appeared in twenty newspapers in Chinese, English and six other languages.

这位自称“Factor Man”的恐怖分子昨天对中华人民共和国提出了一些毫无根据的指控。他指责中国政府从事间谍活动和盗窃。他要求政府向纽约的一名律师提供一些未透露姓名的文件，并要求政府撤回一项因识别特定视频中个人而颁发的奖金。

The terrorist calling himself Factor Man yesterday made certain groundless claims against the People’s Republic of China. He accused the People’s government of espionage and of theft. He demanded that the government provide certain unnamed documents to an attorney in New York, and that they withdraw a prize for identifying the individual in a particular video.

这些指控令人反感，毫无根据。所有现有证据表明，中国遵守了国际法和其加入的条约。中国还遵守了奥巴马总统和习近平主席于 ​​2015 年 9 月达成的有关网络活动的具体协议。

The accusations are offensive and without merit. All available evidence indicates that China has abided by both international law and those treaties to which it is a party. China has also abided by the specific agreement regarding cyber activities that was made by Presidents Obama and Xi in September of 2015.

个人威胁一个国家或干涉一个国家的事务是不恰当的。个人在互联网提供的匿名面具后面这样做尤其不恰当。我们敦促控制此人互联网访问权限的各方终止此类访问权限。言论自由不应与干涉国际事务的自由混为一谈。

It is not appropriate for an individual to threaten a state, or to interfere in the affairs of a state. It is especially inappropriate for an individual to do so while hiding behind the mask of anonymity that the Internet can provide. We urge the parties who control this individual’s access to the Internet to terminate such access. Freedom of speech should not be confused with freedom to meddle in international affairs.

我们不指望中国政府遵守这些要求。一个独立国家不必担心有人弄丢了与律师交换的材料。但如果有人试图干涉该国奖励协助反恐努力的第三方的愿望，一个独立国家就应该担心。

We do not expect the Chinese government to comply with these demands. An independent state need not be concerned if someone has misplaced materials exchanged with an attorney. But an independent state should be concerned if an attempt is made to interfere with that state’s desire to reward a third party that has assisted in anti-terrorism efforts.

一切形式的恐怖主义都是现代文明社会的祸害。我们鼓励各国团结起来，坚决消灭恐怖主义。

Terrorism, in all of its forms, is an anathema to modern civilized society. We encourage all nations to join together in a determined effort to eliminate it.

9

9

伯克特

Burkett

2019 年 3 月 6 日

March 6, 2019

电视套用莎士比亚的话来说，有些人天生就适合从事调查性报道，而有些人则是被迫从事调查性报道。

To paraphrase Shakespeare, some people are born to investigative reporting, and others have investigative reporting thrust upon them.

我绝对是属于第二组。

I was definitely in the second group.

可以肯定地说，当 Factor Man（或任何人）的视频在互联网上传播后，我的生活并没有改善。所有曾经骚扰过我的人继续骚扰我，但更加热情。还有一些新人加入进来。每个人似乎都认为我应该认出视频中的那个人，但我并不认识。

It was safe to say that my life didn’t improve when the video of Factor Man (or whomever) hit the Internet. All the people who had been bothering me continued to bother me, but with greater fervor. They were joined by some new ones. Everyone seemed to think that I should recognize the guy in the video, which I didn’t.

所以我决定自己去弄清楚。我没有计划去弄清楚，尤其是没有计划弄清楚之后要做什么。但知识就是力量，我当然可以利用其中的一部分。计划以后再制定。

So I decided I would figure it out. I didn’t have a plan for figuring it out, and I especially didn’t have a plan for what I would do if I did figure it out. But knowledge is power, and I could certainly use some of that. Plans would come later.

于是我宣布自己是一名调查记者。但在我开始调查之前，一切都变得一团糟。

So I declared myself to be an investigative reporter. But before I could start investigating, all hell broke loose.

中国陷入黑暗——短暂

China Goes Dark – Briefly

威廉·伯克特，《纽约时报》

William Burkett, The New York Times

昨晚东部标准时间 11:58，中国从互联网上消失了。这发生在被称为 Factor Man 的人向中国政府发出三天最后通牒但中国政府置之不理的三天后。

At 11:58 Eastern Standard Time last night, China disappeared from the Internet. That was three days to the minute after the individual known as Factor Man gave the Chinese government a three-day ultimatum that the Chinese government ignored.

中国时间上午 11:58 分，中国断网七秒。（中国面积虽大，但只有一个时区，即“人民时区”。）

China was off the Internet for seven seconds at 11:58AM Chinese time. (In spite of its size, there is only one time zone – the “People’s time” – in China.)

中国境内的互联网流量并未中断。上海和恒生市场继续照常交易，尽管在发现中断后，它们均下跌了约 5%。

Internet traffic internal to China was not disrupted. The Shanghai and Hang Seng markets continued trading as usual, although they both dropped approximately 5% after the outage was discovered.

黑客组织“匿名者”声称对这次攻击负责，这次攻击似乎只是重启了所有连接中国互联网和外界的电脑。人们普遍认为，“人形杀手”提供了关键信息，让“匿名者”能够访问构成中国网关的机器。“匿名者”过去曾对各种互联网攻击负责，包括对加拿大和突尼斯政府电脑的攻击。

The hacking group Anonymous has taken credit for the attack, which appears to have simply rebooted every computer connecting China’s Internet to the outside world. It is generally assumed that Factor Man provided crucial information that allowed Anonymous access to the machines that make up the Chinese gateway. Anonymous has taken credit for a variety of Internet attacks in the past, including attacks on government computers in Canada and Tunisia.

据传，北京和白宫之间进行了极其紧张的谈判，中方要求美国政府采取措施防止未来再发生混乱，而美国政府告诉中国，他们很乐意采取中方提出的任何具体措施。白宫内部消息人士称，官方回应的严肃性可能并不反映政府的实际态度。

Extremely tense discussions are rumored to have taken place between Beijing and the White House, with the Chinese demanding that the US government take steps to prevent future disruptions and the US government telling China that they will be happy to take any specific steps that China is able to suggest. Sources inside the White House report that the somberness of the official response may not reflect the government’s actual attitude.

刘

Liu

2019 年 3 月 8 日

March 8, 2019

前两天过得并不愉快。

The previous two days had been anything but pleasant.

几个月前，赵将军得知杜安莫里斯的入侵事件并未被察觉，十分不安。他更关心的是直接了解到中国与世界其他国家的通信能力显然十分脆弱。

General Zhao had been extremely disquieted to learn, months previously, that the break-in at Duane Morris had not gone undetected. He had been more concerned still to learn firsthand of the apparent vulnerability of China’s ability to communicate with the rest of the world.

由于性别原因，我在第四部门的地位不可避免地很不稳定，自从杜安·莫里斯事件发生后，我的地位就更加岌岌可危了。没有人能够确定入侵是如何被发现的，但大家一致认为责任在我。互联网中断进一步加剧了这种情况。

My position in the Fourth Department, inevitably tenuous because of my gender, had been more precarious still since the Duane Morris incident. No one was able to ascertain the method by which the break-in had been detected, but there was a clear and justified consensus that the responsibility was mine. The Internet disruption exacerbated the situation further.

第四部门无意缩减其重要的网络安全相关活动的范围，但还是不情愿地撤回了识别视频中人物的奖励。剩下的任务是将原件“因素人”信件送回杜安·莫里斯办公室，而荣誉要求我亲自履行这一责任。

The Fourth Department had no intention of reducing the breadth of its important cyber-security related activities, but did reluctantly withdraw the prize for identifying the figure in the video. The responsibility for the remaining task of returning the original Factor Man letter to the Duane Morris offices fell to me, and honor required that I discharge that responsibility personally.

我从时代广场地铁站出来时，纽约的天空阴云密布，地铁站位于杜安莫里斯大楼西南三个街区。我走到杜安莫里斯大楼，来到哈斯戴所在的楼层，告诉他的接待员我想见他。然后，我愉快地等了将近一个小时，才被领进哈斯戴的办公室。

The New York skies were overcast as I emerged from the Times Square subway station, three blocks southwest of the Duane Morris building. I made my way to the Duane Morris building and to Hasday’s floor, where I told his receptionist that I wished to see him. I then had the pleasure of waiting for nearly an hour before being shown into Hasday’s office.

“下午好，刘女士，”哈斯戴说道。“我必须承认再次见到您我有点惊讶。我以为您已经决定去别处做生意了。”

“Good afternoon, Ms. Liu,” Hasday said. “I must confess to being somewhat surprised to see you again. I thought you had decided to take your business elsewhere.”

“我只是带来了你要求的文件。”是 Factor Man 提出了请求，但我认为没有必要这么说。

“I simply brought the paperwork that you requested.” It was Factor Man who had made the request, but I saw no reason to say so.

“你真的这么做了吗？”我把一封装有 Factor Man 原信的信封递给了 Duane Morris。Hasday 看了看信封，确认里面确实有信。“真是太客气了。”

“Did you, indeed?” I handed over an envelope containing Factor Man’s original letter to Duane Morris. Hasday looked inside and confirmed its presence. “How very kind.”

我等着他表示我们的交易已经结束，但他没有表示任何让步。“谢谢，”我最终说道。

I waited for him to indicate that our business was now concluded, but no such concession was forthcoming. “Thank you,” I eventually said.

“没关系。”他继续等着。最后，我干脆告辞离开了。

“Not at all.” He continued to wait. Eventually, I simply excused myself and left.

美国人很没有礼貌。

Americans are mannerless.

* * *

* * *

不过，我参与 Factor Man 事件并非一无所获。虽然我们没能在维也纳找到他，但我们确实有视频。视频中的人就是 Factor Man，这一点似乎从他的反应中得到了证实。

My involvement in the Factor Man matter had not been completely without success, however. Although we had not managed to identify him in Vienna, we did have video. That the person in the video was Factor Man seemed to be confirmed by his reaction.

视频中，一名男子留着胡子，一头长长的黑发，跛行。他戴着太阳镜，头发遮住了耳朵，这很不巧。胡子、头发和跛行可能都是某种人工制品。不过，有些事情我们还是知道的。

The video showed a man with a beard, long dark hair, and a limp. The sunglasses were unfortunate, as was the fact that his hair had covered his ears. The beard, hair and limp might all be artifacts of one sort or another. Nevertheless, there were certain things we knew.

因素男确实是男性。无论伪装机制如何，他都不可能比视频中的男人高。事实上，视频显示他的鞋子没有增高，所以我们要找的是一个白人男性，身高大约 180 厘米。

Factor Man was indeed male. Whatever the mechanism of disguise, he could never be taller than the man in the video. In fact, the video showed that there were no lifts in his shoes, so we were looking for a Caucasian male, approximately 180cm in height.

他的衣服是在美国制造的。这也有点可惜。一个国家的衣服和另一个国家的服装风格略有不同；如果他的衣服是（例如）法国的，我们的搜索范围就会大大缩小。虽然监控摄像头在美国相当普遍，但在欧洲更为普遍，尤其是在我们通常可以获得访问权限的国家层面。

His clothes were made in America. That, too, was something of a pity. There are slight stylistic differences between clothing in one country and in another; had his clothing been (for example) French, our search would have been significantly reduced. And while surveillance cameras are reasonably prevalent in the United States, they are far more prevalent in Europe, especially at the national level to which we can generally obtain access.

他的体重不超过 82 公斤，在过度放纵的美国社会中，对于他这样身高的人来说，这是令人惊讶的。

He weighed no more than 82kg which, in America’s overindulgent society, was surprising for someone of his height.

但最重要的是视频本身。中国拥有世界上最好的面部识别软件。它融合了其他地方开发的技术以及在中国开发但未进一步传播的方法。该软件使中国当局能够维持所有中国公民都受益的社会结构。

Most important, however, was the video itself. China has the best facial recognition software in the world. It is an amalgam of techniques developed elsewhere, and methods developed in China and not distributed further. The software allows Chinese authorities to maintain the societal structure from which all Chinese citizens benefit.

在维也纳的美国人会有护照。和美国间谍机器一样，我们也能获取美国护照上的照片。由于某些特征可能被遮盖，通过相关软件查看这些特征可能比平时花费更长的时间。但这肯定还是有可能的。

An American in Vienna would have a passport. And like the American spy machine, we also had access to the photographs that American passports contained. Because of the likelihood that some of the features had been obscured, running them through the relevant software might take longer than usual. But it was certainly still possible.

伯克特

Burkett

2019 年 3 月 26 日

March 26, 2019

一次长达七秒的互联网中断导致我们所有人都屏住呼吸大约两周。

A seven-second Internet disruption caused all of us to hold our breaths for about two weeks.

中国当局继续坚称“人质”是恐怖分子。他们宣称，正如美国似乎乐于轻而易举地消灭恐怖分子一样，如果他们能找到他，他们也会毫不犹豫地采取类似行动。美国的反应同样强烈，简要地告诉中国人，如果“人质”是美国公民，他将有权获得正当程序和美国政府的全面保护。

The Chinese authorities continued to maintain that Factor Man was a terrorist. They announced that just as America seemed to delight in wiping out terrorists with the touch of a button, they would have no qualms about acting similarly if they could locate him. The United States responded just as strongly, tersely informing the Chinese that should Factor Man turn out to be an American citizen, he would be entitled to both due process and the full protection of the American government while he got it.

当然，每个人都是两面派。美国人似乎对他们用无人机瞄准的人的正当程序不感兴趣，而中国人则威胁要进行国家支持的暗杀，以报复七秒的互联网中断，如果博客可信的话，无论如何，这是对 Factor Man 律师盗窃的报复。

Everyone was being totally two-faced, of course. The Americans seemed to have little interest in due process for the people they targeted with drones, and the Chinese were threatening a state-sponsored assassination as retribution for a seven-second Internet outage that was, if the blog was to be believed, retribution for a theft from Factor Man’s attorney in any case.

至少在美国，公众的同情似乎主要集中在“人”的身上。常规民意调查显示，83% 的美国公众希望“人”是美国人，并支持他所做的事情，而常规评论家们也对洋基人的聪明才智、特立独行、狂野西部和外交的重要性发表了常规评论。

In the States, at least, public sympathy seemed to be mostly with Factor Man. The usual polls found that 83% of the American public hoped Factor Man was an American and supported what he was doing, and the usual pundits made the usual comments about Yankee ingenuity, mavericks, the Wild West, and the importance of diplomacy.

如果赌注不是那么高的话，它可能会很有趣。

It might have been entertaining, had the stakes not been so high.

几周后，世界恢复了正常，我准备开始我作为一名优秀调查记者的新职业。我决定首先拜访复杂性理论家斯科特·阿伦森，你可能还记得，他从麻省理工学院跳槽到德克萨斯大学奥斯汀分校工作。我的行程巧妙地伪装成拜访我研究生时代的老朋友。我想，联邦调查局仍在跟踪我，据我所知，中国人现在也在跟踪我。我向艾玛告别，保证会小心，然后出发了。

After a couple weeks, the world settled back to somewhat normal, and I prepared to begin my new career as a crack investigative reporter. I decided that I would start with a visit to complexity theorist Scott Aaronson, who you may recall jumped ship from MIT to work at UT Austin. My trip would be cleverly disguised as a visit to old friends from my graduate school days. The FBI was still following me, I figured, and for all I knew, the Chinese now were as well. I bid Emma farewell, promised to be careful, and off I went.

* * *

* * *

奥斯汀和我记忆中的一样，是右翼疯狂的自由堡垒，通常被称为德克萨斯州。三月可以说是一年中最愉快的时光；当全国其他地方的冰雪慢慢融化时，奥斯汀的最高温度通常在 70 度左右，最低温度则低 20 度左右。五月即将开始的雨季尚未到来。

Austin was much as I remembered it, a liberal bastion in the right-wing insanity that is generally referred to as Texas. March is arguably the most pleasant time of year; while the rest of the country slowly thaws, the Austin highs are generally around 70 and the lows about twenty degrees cooler. The rains that will begin in May have not yet arrived.

我漫步走进校园，拜访了我的论文导师和几个我认识的经济学系同学，然后去了计算机科学系。这是我失去想象中的尾巴的技巧：我漫无目的地游荡。我想，我希望他们只是失去兴趣。当然，实际上我并不真正知道自己在做什么，但我想不出调查性新闻应该与其他一切如此不同的理由。

I wandered onto campus and did indeed visit my thesis advisor and a couple of other folks I knew in economics before drifting over to the computer science department. This was my technique for losing a notional tail: I drifted aimlessly. My hope, I guess, was that they would simply lose interest. In actuality, of course, I had no real idea what I was doing, but I couldn’t think of a reason that investigative journalism should be so different from everything else.

阿伦森教授复杂性理论。这并不奇怪。课程在周二和周四上午 10:30 上课，我聪明地在周二下午到达，因为我甚至没有制定通过互联网查看课程表的最低计划。我花了一天时间才了解到重返研究生院有多么困难。我所有的朋友显然都转行了，我唯一认识的人是教职员工，他们一般都很高兴见到我，但时间有限。他们都问了关于 Factor Man 的相同问题，然后谈话很快就结束了。

Aaronson taught complexity theory. No surprise there. The class met Tuesday and Thursday mornings at 10:30 and I cleverly arrived on a Tuesday afternoon because I hadn’t formed even the minimal plan of checking course schedules via the Internet. I spent a day learning just how hard it is to return to graduate school. All of my friends had obviously moved on to other things, and the only people I knew were faculty who were in general pleased to see me but only for a limited amount of time. They all asked identical questions about Factor Man and then the conversations faded quickly.

终于到了周四早上，我得知 Aaronson 的课是由一名研究生讲授的，而英语显然不是他的母语。下课后我找到他，他解释说 Aaronson 教授被叫走了，他将在教授回来之前继续讲课。他不知道 Aaronson 在哪里，也不知道他缺席的原因。

Thursday morning eventually arrived, and I learned that Aaronson’s class was being taught by a graduate student for whom English was clearly not a native language. I approached him after class and he explained that Professor Aaronson had been called away, and that he would be teaching the class until the professor returned. He had no idea where Aaronson was, or the reason for his absence.

我觉得调查性报道也许并不难。然后我试图弄清楚下一步该怎么做，最后得出结论：也许那是错的。

I figured that maybe this investigative reporting stuff wasn’t so hard after all. Then I tried to figure out what to do next, and concluded that maybe that was wrong.

* * *

* * *

在这种情况下，顶尖调查记者的做法是找别人麻烦。我决定去麻烦奥斯汀计算机科学系主任布鲁斯·波特。

What crack investigative reporters do in situations like this is find someone else to bother. I decided to bother Bruce Porter, the chairman of Austin’s Computer Science Department.

学术界以外的人可能认为担任系主任是一件好事。地位、向上的职业流动性，诸如此类。

People outside of academics probably believe that being the head of a department is a good thing. Status, upward career mobility, like that.

他们错了。

They’re wrong.

学者们讨厌当系主任。医学院是唯一的例外。首先，没有任何地位。学术界的地位很大程度上取决于你的出版记录的实力，而系主任通常要处理太多政治废话，以至于他们在担任系主任期间根本无法进行任何研究。

Academics hate being department chairs. Schools of medicine are the only exception. First off, there isn’t any status. Status in academics is pretty much a matter of the strength of your publication record, and department heads generally have so much political crap to deal with that they don’t manage to do any research at all during their time as head.

学者们通常对职业晋升不感兴趣。他们认为，他们有一份完美的工作，做研究，或许还能教书，只要他们不和学生上床，终身职位就能给他们带来终身工作的承诺。

Academics generally aren’t interested in upward career mobility, either. They have what they view as the perfect job, doing research and perhaps teaching, with tenure offering them the promise of a job for life as long as they don’t sleep with any of their students.

这听起来很划算，而且确实划算。对于那些只想早上起床解决智力难题，偶尔被学生或讲座打扰的人来说，这尤其划算。

It sounds like a sweet deal, and it is a sweet deal. It’s especially sweet for someone who wants nothing more out of life than to get up in the morning and try to solve hard intellectual problems, interrupted only by the occasional student or lecture.

担任主席会打破这一切。例如，波特的网页上列出了他在人工智能领域撰写的论文，而他担任主席后，这些论文的发表几乎就停止了。

Being chair disrupts all of that. As an example, Porter’s web page included a list of papers he had written in artificial intelligence, and the publications pretty much stopped at the time he became chair.

人工智能。该领域的一位创始人曾将其描述为“试图让机器做人类擅长的事情”。人工智能如今受到媒体的广泛关注，机器学习让亚马逊比我们更了解我们的购买偏好，机器视觉让特斯拉可以载着我们四处游玩，杀死我们的次数比我们自杀的次数略少。

Artificial intelligence. A field that has been described by one of its founders as, “An attempt to get machines to do badly what people do well.” AI gets a ton of press these days, what with machine learning allowing Amazon to know our buying preferences better than we do, and machine vision allowing Teslas to drive us around, killing us slightly less frequently than we manage to kill ourselves.

人工智能和复杂性理论是姊妹学科。当你看到像亚马逊（或谷歌）维护的我们所有人的数据库一样大的数据库时，让算法运行得更快就很重要了。如果你的目标是让程序做一些真正智能的事情——比如写一首交响乐——那么经典的 P 与 NP 问题，即创作一件伟大的艺术作品是否像识别一件伟大的艺术作品一样容易，显然确实很重要。

Artificial intelligence and complexity theory are sister disciplines. Making algorithms run faster matters when you’re looking at databases as big as the one Amazon (or Google) maintains on all of us. And if your goal is for a program to do something truly intelligent – write a symphony, say – then the classic P vs. NP question of whether creating a great work of art is as easy as recognizing one is obviously relevant indeed.

因此，可以合理地预期，波特至少对复杂性理论有所了解。除了了解阿伦森之外，他可能还对斯科特如何融入整个因子人的故事有一些看法。

So it was fair to expect that Porter would have at least a passing acquaintance with complexity theory. In addition to knowing Aaronson, he would probably also have some view about how Scott might fit into the whole Factor Man story.

波特也很忙，但他的管理员说他可以在几个小时内安排我。我决定把这几个小时花在德州咖啡店，这是一家校园咖啡店，我在德州大学读研究生期间在那里待了太多时间。

Porter was also busy, but his admin said that he could fit me into his schedule in a couple of hours. I decided to spend those hours at Texas Coffee Traders, an on-campus coffee shop where I had spent far too many hours during my years as a UT graduate student.

TCT 基本上和我学生时代没什么不同，不过我不得不承认，那里的女性看起来比那时要有魅力得多。其中一位给我留下了特别深刻的印象，她独自喝着饮料，读着一本书。啊，年轻了几岁，而且没有伴侣。

TCT was essentially unchanged from my student days, although I have to confess that the women appeared considerably more attractive than they had back then. One struck me as particularly stunning, drinking her drink by herself and reading a book. Ah, to be a few years younger and unattached.

我喝了咖啡，在网上闲逛了一个半小时，然后又回去学习计算机科学。

I drank my coffee and wandered the web for an hour and a half, and then headed back over to computer science.

* * *

* * *

波特原来是个好人，带着计算机科学家常见的怪癖。他大概 50 多岁，笑容可掬，穿着休闲装，脚上穿的是运动鞋而不是皮鞋。他的办公室角落里放着一把网球拍，但似乎大部分时间都在积灰。他的办公室本身就是典型的学术办公室，书柜里堆满了书，每个表面都摆满了书籍或研究论文。白板上画满了带箭头的图表，右上角写着“请勿擦除”。调查记者会注意到这些。

Porter turned out to be a genuinely nice guy, in the geeky way that is common to computer scientists. Mid- to late-fifties, welcoming smile, casually dressed with sneakers instead of shoes. A tennis racket was in the corner of his office but seemed mostly to be gathering dust. The office itself was a typical academic’s, with cases full of books, and every surface covered in books or research papers. Diagrams with arrows covered the whiteboard, which had “DO NOT ERASE” written in the top right corner. Investigative reporters notice this stuff.

波特握了握我的手，请我坐下。“威廉·伯克特，”他说。“奥斯汀的博士生，他向世界介绍了 Factor Man。我能为您做些什么？”

Porter shook my hand and invited me to sit. “William Burkett,” he said. “Austin Ph.D. student who introduced Factor Man to the world. What can I do for you?”

“我觉得我更喜欢别人只把我看作一名经济学研究生，”我回答道。“但我来这里的目的肯定是为了研究 Factor Man。我正在寻找 Scott Aaronson。我希望听听他的看法。”

“I think I liked it better when people thought of me only as an economics graduate student,” I answered. “But Factor Man is certainly why I’m here. I’m looking for Scott Aaronson. I was hoping to get his take on it.”

波特站起身走到我身后，关上了办公室的门。显然他要透露一些重大秘密，比如阿伦森的下落，或者 Factor Man 本人的身份。

Porter got up and walked behind me, closing the door to his office. Clearly about to reveal great secrets, like Aaronson’s location or perhaps the identity of Factor Man himself.

“斯科特因个人事务外出了。”他停顿了一下。“我只知道这么多。”

“Scott’s away on a personal matter.” He paused. “That’s all I know.”

这就是你如何分辨出伟大的调查记者。如果这真的是他所知道的一切，为什么他在说这些之前要停顿一下？为什么他要关上门？

This is how you can tell the great investigative reporters. If that really was all he knew, why did he pause before saying so? Why did he close his door?

事实上，这可能就是你如何分辨平庸的调查记者。优秀的调查记者知道如何利用这些信息推动调查向前发展。

Actually, that was probably how you could tell the mediocre investigative reporters. The great ones knew how to use that information to move the investigation forward.

“那么你为什么要关门呢？”从根本上说，我一无所有。

“So why did you close your door?” Fundamentally, I had nothing.

又一次停顿。“你的问题似乎与斯科特本人有关。当涉及到教职员工的问题时，我总是会闭上嘴。”

Another pause. “Your question seemed to involve Scott personally. I always close my door when questions about a faculty member arise.”

“您觉得这个个人问题可能和 Factor Man 有关吗？”威廉·伯克特 (William Burkett)，细微差别大师。

“Do you think this personal matter might have anything to do with Factor Man?” William Burkett, master of nuance.

“斯科特可以说是世界上最知名的复杂性理论家。我可以想象，他现在所做的很多事情都以某种方式受到了 Factor Man 的影响。”

“Scott is arguably the world’s most visible complexity theorist. I would imagine that much of what he does these days is impacted by Factor Man in one way or another.”

这基本上就是我能从他那里得到的全部了。我们又聊了几分钟，但最终我感谢了波特抽出时间，并承认我已经听够了。

And that was basically the most I could get out of him. We danced around it for a few more minutes, but eventually I thanked Porter for his time and conceded that I had taken enough of it.

他打开门让我出去。当我开始穿过门时，他又说了一句。“威廉？你不是第一个问我这个问题的人。美国国家安全局和联邦调查局上周都来过这里，基本上问了同样的问题。我给了他们基本上相同的答案。”

He opened the door to let me out. As I began to pass through it, he added one more thing. “William? You’re not the first person to ask me about this. The NSA and FBI were both in here last week, with basically the same questions. And I gave them basically the same answers.”

了不起。

Terrific.

* * *

* * *

接下来是 Aaronson 的妻子 Rina，她也是德克萨斯大学奥斯汀分校的计算机科学家。虽然不像丈夫那样是主流的复杂性理论家，但他们从事的领域非常相似。2016 年秋天，他们两人从麻省理工学院转到了奥斯汀，Aaronson 解释说，这一举动有十个因素促使他这样做，从部门质量到奥斯汀和波士顿的天气对比。不过，最主要的是，奥斯汀是 Aaronson 夫妇俩都能在受人尊敬的计算机科学系获得终身教职的地方。

Next up was Aaronson’s wife Rina, also a computer scientist at UT Austin. Not as mainstream a complexity theorist as her husband, but they worked in closely related areas. The two of them had jointly transitioned from MIT to Austin in the fall of 2016, a move that Aaronson had explained as being motivated by ten factors, ranging from the quality of the department to a comparison of the weather in Austin and in Boston. Mostly, though, Austin was a location where the Aaronsons could both get tenure in a respected computer science department.

丽娜比她丈夫小几岁，身高也矮几英寸。上班时间我在办公室找到她时，她比丈夫要亲近得多。她出生于以色列，头发和眼睛都是黑色的，英语说得一口流利，但口音却很温和。

Rina was a few years younger and a few inches shorter than her husband. And, when I found her in her office during office hours, a few notches more accessible. She was Israeli-born, dark hair and eyes, with excellent but gently accented English.

“斯科特和我谈到了你，”她带着一丝苦笑告诉我，“几年前你载他去了酒店。他觉得讽刺的是，当时你帮了他那么多忙，而多年后，同一个人却让 Factor Man 走向了世界。”

“Scott and I talked about you,” she told me with something of a rueful smile. “You gave him a lift to his hotel years ago. It struck him as ironic you had been so helpful back then, and then the same man springs Factor Man on the world years later.”

“不要迁怒于信使，”我告诉她。“Factor Man 向世界介绍了自己。”

“Don’t shoot the messenger,” I told her. “Factor Man introduced himself to the world.”

最重要的是，丽娜给我的并不比其他人多。“斯科特不在城里，”她说。“这是个人问题。”

The bottom line was that Rina gave me no more than anyone else had. “Scott’s out of town,” she said. “A personal matter.”

“你知道在哪里吗？”

“Do you know where?”

“我当然知道在哪里。”

“Of course I know where.”

“愿意分享吗？”

“Care to share?”

“我应该吗？”

“Should I?”

我解释说，我只是想弄清楚事情的真相，仅此而已。我想和 Factor Man 谈谈，不管他是谁。在中国发生这件事之后，我不打算透露任何他想保密的事情。我是一名记者；我只是想知道发生了什么。

I explained that I was trying to get to the bottom of things, nothing more. I wanted to talk with Factor Man, whoever he was. After what happened to China, I had no plans to reveal anything that he wanted to keep secret. I was a reporter; I just wanted to know what was going on.

她想了想。“你认为斯科特是关键人物吗？”

She considered this. “Do you think Scott is Factor Man?”

“你？”

“Do you?”

“伯克特先生，我知道斯科特是不是关键人物。我是他的妻子。我知道。我在问你是怎么想的。”

“Mr. Burkett, I know whether or not Scott is Factor Man. I’m his wife. I know. I’m asking what you think.”

“你显然意识到我认为这是有可能的。”

“You obviously realize I think it’s a possibility.”

再次露出苦笑。“这里有两种可能。第一，斯科特就是 Factor Man。如果是这样，他已经明确表示他希望自己的身份不为人知。所以我不会帮助你。第二，斯科特不是 Factor Man。在这种情况下，让我向你保证，你不是唯一有这些怀疑的人，如果你能以某种方式洗清他的罪名，斯科特和我的生活都会变得简单得多。”

The rueful smile again. “There are two possibilities here. One. Scott is Factor Man. If so, he’s made it clear that he wants his identity to remain unknown. So I won’t help you. Two. Scott is not Factor Man. In that case, let me assure you that you aren’t the only one with these suspicions, and both Scott’s and my lives would be considerably simpler if you could somehow, shall we say, clear his name.”

“我怎么能做到这一点呢？”我问道。“要证明否定是很难的。”

“How could I do that?” I asked. “It’s tough to prove a negative.”

“你可以查出因子人到底是谁，伯克特先生。如果你不能，我们就不知道你能给我们带来什么帮助。”

“You could find out who Factor Man actually is, Mr. Burkett. If you can’t, it’s not clear how you can help us.”

正如我所说，我什么都没有。丽娜礼貌地送我出去，然后我回到了酒店。

Like I said, I had nothing. Rina politely showed me out, and I returned to my hotel.

* * *

* * *

我在这里逗留了一天，舔舐着伤口，停下来见了几个我记得的人，思考下一步该做什么。我最多比三天前刚到奥斯汀时知道得更多一些。有很多事情要考虑，但实际了解的却很少。晚饭后我回到酒店，告诉他们我打算第二天早上退房。

I hung around and licked my wounds for a day, stopping in to see the few people I remembered personally and wondering what to do next. I knew at best incrementally more than when I had arrived in Austin three days earlier. Lots to consider, but little in terms of actual knowledge. I returned to the hotel after dinner, telling them that I planned on checking out the next morning.

我回到房间后不久，门就响了。令我惊讶的是，是丽娜·阿伦森。她递给我一张纸，告诉我该怎么做，然后就离开了。

Shortly after I got back into the room, there was a knock on the door. Rina Aaronson, to my surprise. She handed me a sheet of paper, told me to do the right thing, and left.

纸条上写着：

The sheet of paper said:

北纬 30.3657424, 西经 98.1151105

30.3657424 N, 98.1151105 W

收到进一步的指示

receive further instructions

周四

Thursday

独自前来，无人关注

come alone and unfollowed

那是星期五。威廉·伯克特 (William Burkett)，一名出色的调查记者，延长了他的酒店预订。

It was Friday. William Burkett, crack investigative reporter, extended his hotel reservation.

10

10

维基百科

Wikipedia

Factor Man是一位匿名人士的化名，他声称通过开发和实施解决可满足性问题的多项式时间算法解决了P=NP猜想。他声称一直在使用该算法对不断增加的数字进行因式分解，并已提出在 2019 年中期向出价最高的人出售该技术的独家许可，为期一年。

Factor Man is the pseudonym of an anonymous individual who claims to have resolved the P=NP conjecture by developing and implementing a polynomial time algorithm for solving satisfiability problems. He claims to have been using that algorithm to factor numbers of increasing size, and has offered to sell a license to the technology, exclusive for one year, to the highest bidder in mid-2019.

如果属实，这项技术将对整个现代社会产生深远影响，使各种技术问题得以更有效地解决。然而，这些进步之一就是能够破解大多数或所有现代公钥加密方案，这可能会对互联网商务和互联网安全造成严重破坏。

If true, this technology would have a profound impact across modern society, allowing for the more efficient solution of a wide range of technical problems. Among these advances, however, would be the ability to break most or all modern public-key encryption schemes, potentially wreaking havoc with Internet commerce and Internet security generally.

  1. 历史
  2. History
  3. Factor Man 博客上提到的人物
  4. People named on the Factor Man blog
  5. 身份
  6. Identity
  7. 公众和学术界的看法
  8. Public and academic perception
  9. 争议
  10. Controversies
  11. 技术价值
  12. Value of the technology

…

…

3. 身份

3. Identity

尽管全世界都在激烈猜测，但人们对“人质”的身份知之甚少。人们普遍认为他是一名成年白人美国男性。2019 年 2 月 15 日，中国政府发布了一张据称是“人质”的照片，并向任何能识别照片中人物的人提供 50 万美元的奖励。在“人质”本人提出要求后，该奖励于 3 月 7 日被撤回。

Although the subject of intense worldwide speculation, little is known about Factor Man’s identity. It is generally believed that he is an adult Caucasian American male. On February 15, 2019, the Chinese government circulated a picture they stated to be of Factor Man, offering a reward of $500,000 to anyone who could identify the individual in the photograph. The reward offer was withdrawn on March 7 after a demand to that effect from Factor Man himself.

照片中几乎所有特征都可能是假的，除了该人的身高（约 180 厘米，5 英尺 11 英寸）和体重（约 82 公斤，180 磅）。白种人的肤色也可能是真实的。熟悉照片拍摄地点的人将其识别为维也纳市中心的一组商店。照片的拍摄日期尚不确定。

It is possible that virtually all of the features in the photograph are artificial, except for the height (about 180cm, 5’11”) and weight (about 82 kg, 180 lbs) of the individual in question. The Caucasian skin color is presumably authentic as well. Individuals familiar with the location of the photograph have identified it as a set of shops in downtown Vienna. The date of the photograph is uncertain.

据信，Factor Man 与《纽约时报》记者 William Burkett 有私人关系。这是因为公共领域中第一次提到 Factor Man 是在 Burkett 于 2017 年 5 月 17 日撰写的一篇文章中，标题为“如何找到一个疯子”。如今臭名昭著的Factor Man 博客与 Burkett 的文章同时出现，据推测 Factor Man 本人告诉了 Burkett 这件事。由于该博客的所有早期读者都声称从《纽约时报》的文章中找到了位置，因此可以合理地认为 Burkett 是 Factor Man 现象的“零号病人”。Burkett 拒绝对 Factor Man 历史的这一部分发表评论，并因此获得了相当大的名气。

It is believed that Factor Man has a personal relationship with William Burkett, a reporter for the New York Times. This is because the first mention of Factor Man in the public domain is in an article that Burkett wrote on May 17, 2017 titled, “How to Find a Crackpot.” The now infamous Factor Man blog appeared simultaneously with Burkett’s article, and it is assumed that Factor Man himself told Burkett about it. Because all of the early readers of the blog claim to have gotten the location from the Times article, it is reasonable to think of Burkett as “Patient Zero” of the Factor Man phenomenon. Burkett has refused to comment on this element of Factor Man’s history, and has achieved a considerable amount of celebrity as a result.

最近，关于“因子人”身份的猜测围绕着复杂性理论家斯科特·阿伦森展开，他是德克萨斯大学奥斯汀分校的计算机科学系教员。这在一定程度上是因为阿伦森在复杂性社区中的声誉，尽管他通常认为 P 和 NP 是不同的。然而，更重要的是，阿伦森在 2019 年 3 月消失得无影无踪。他的妻子、计算机科学家丽娜·阿伦森大约一周后失踪。众所周知，2012 年，伯克特在德克萨斯大学奥斯汀分校读研究生时，阿伦森曾在该校发表过演讲。

Recent speculation regarding Factor Man’s identity has swirled around complexity theorist Scott Aaronson, a member of the computer science faculty at the University of Texas at Austin. This is in part because of Aaronson’s reputation within the complexity community, although his stated position has generally been that P and NP are distinct. More importantly, however, Aaronson vanished without a trace in March of 2019. His wife, computer scientist Rina Aaronson, disappeared approximately a week later. Aaronson is known to have given a talk at UT Austin while Burkett was a graduate student there in 2012.

4. 感知

4. Perception

最初人们对 Factor Man 的说法的反应非常负面，普遍的共识是这些说法不太可能成立。然而，随着时间的推移，人们越来越相信 Factor Man 确实能够做到他说的。

Initial response to Factor Man’s claims was extremely negative, the general consensus being that there was little chance those claims were valid. As time has passed, however, it has become increasingly likely that Factor Man can indeed do what he says.

这种观念的改变伴随着公众对“人质”活动的看法的相应改变。盖洛普 2019 年 3 月的一项民意调查显示，92% 的受访者认为“人质”值得信赖，能够做到他声称的事情，87% 的受访者对“人质”采取的行动总体上持积极态度。56% 的受访者认为，“人质”对中国人闯入其律师事务所一事的回应是合理的（见下文的争议）。在其他国家（中国除外）进行的类似民意调查也得出了类似的结果，尽管结果略差一些。

This change in perception has been accompanied by a corresponding modification of the public’s perception of Factor Man’s activities. A Gallup poll in March of 2019 indicated that 92% of respondents believed that Factor Man was trustworthy and could do what he claimed, and that 87% had a favorable view of the course of action Factor Man had taken generally. 56% of those polled felt that Factor Man had been justified in his response to the apparent Chinese break-in at his attorney’s office (see Controversies, below). Similar polling in other countries (other than China) gives comparable results, although slightly less favorable.

而在中国，调查结果则截然不同。略多于一半的中国人（52%）相信 Factor Man 能够做到他所宣称的事情，但只有 13% 的中国人对他持好感。

The results in China are drastically different. A slight majority of Chinese (52%) believe that Factor Man can do what he claims, but he is only viewed favorably by 13% of the Chinese population.

中国政府表示，他们认为“人质”是恐怖分子和威胁，如果能够查明其真实身份，将按恐怖分子和威胁对待他。这一立场遭到美国政府的严厉批评，美国政府表示，据信“人质”是美国公民。因此，他有权受到美国政府的全面保护，直到美国司法系统对他的罪行进行评估（如果有的话）。

The Chinese government has stated that they consider Factor Man to be a terrorist and a threat, and that they will treat him as such if they are able to learn his true identity. This position has been criticized sharply by the American administration, which has said that Factor Man is believed to be an American citizen. He is therefore entitled to the full protection of the United States government until his crimes – if any – are evaluated by the American justice system.

这场争端导致两国之间的紧张关系显著加剧，中国继续坚持认为将采取一切符合中国安全利益的措施。

This dispute has led to a significant increase in tensions between the two nations, with China continuing to maintain that they will take whatever steps they feel to be in the interests of Chinese security.

5. 争议

5. Controversies

据信，为了回应中国威胁，Factor Man 于 2019 年 3 月 6 日中国时间上午 11:58 切断了中国所有互联网连接七秒钟。对于此举是否合理以及报复是否合适，人们的看法各不相同。Factor Man 声称的技术将使他几乎能够以任何他选择的方式破坏互联网服务。

In response to a perceived Chinese threat, Factor Man is believed to have severed all of China’s Internet connections for seven seconds at 11:58AM Chinese time on March 6, 2019. Opinion varies widely as to whether this action was justified and whether reprisals are appropriate. Factor Man’s claimed technology would give him an almost unlimited ability to disrupt Internet service in any way that he chose.

围绕 Factor Man 技术是否应由单个个人或私人实体控制的问题，存在着更深远的争论。Factor Man 宣布计划从 2019 年 7 月 10 日起向出价最高的人提供为期一年的独家技术许可，这使得这个问题变得更加紧迫。一年结束后，美国政府据称也将获得一年的许可，此后（2021 年 7 月 10 日），该技术将进入公共领域，Factor Man 将向全世界公布其身份。

A more far-reaching debate has surrounded the question of whether the Factor Man technology should be in the control of a single individual or private entity. This question is made somewhat more urgent by Factor Man’s stated plan of providing an exclusive license to his technology to the highest bidder for a one-year period commencing on July 10, 2019. After the year is up, the United States government will supposedly also get a license for one year, after which (on July 10, 2021), the technology will be released into the public domain and Factor Man will reveal his or her identity to the world.

许多人认为，从现在到 2021 年，这将使权力过多地集中在少数人手中。几乎所有外国政府都反对只向美国政府开放这项技术。

A variety of individuals have argued that this will concentrate too much power in the hands of a small number of individuals between now and the 2021 date. Virtually all foreign governments have objected to the release of the technology to the government of only the United States.

美国政府也直接卷入了这场争议。Factor Man 技术已被美国军方列为绝密，这意味着，至少根据一些专家的说法，Factor Man 出售或以其他方式分发该技术将是一种犯罪行为。其他专家声称，由于该技术本身似乎是 Factor Man 的发明，因此他分发自己作品的权利受到美国宪法第一修正案（言论自由）的保护。在 Factor Man 确实尝试传播相关技术之前，不可能对此事提起诉讼。

The United States government has also involved itself in this controversy directly. The Factor Man technology has been classified as top secret by the American military, meaning that it will be, at least according to some experts, a crime for Factor Man to sell or otherwise distribute it. Other experts claim that since the technology itself appears to be Factor Man’s invention, his rights to distribute his own work are protected by the First Amendment (freedom of speech) of the U.S. Constitution. It is impossible to litigate this matter until Factor Man does indeed attempt to circulate the technology in question.

美国国会也参与其中，通过立法禁止出售该技术。目前尚不清楚这项立法是否会产生超出绝密级别的影响，但国会不得不对公众的呼吁做出某种回应。

The American Congress has gotten involved as well, passing legislation making it illegal to sell the technology. It is not clear that this legislation will have any effect beyond the consequences of the top secret classification, but Congress was forced to respond to a general public demand for action of one sort or another.

6. 技术价值

6. Value of the technology

由于这项技术具有非凡的价值，而 Factor Man 向出价最高的人支付的一年期许可费可能非常高，因此所有这些问题都变得更加紧迫。目前估计价值在 10 亿美元到 1 万亿美元之间。如果交易按照 Factor Man 的计划进行，他可能会一下子成为地球上最富有的人之一（如果不是最富有的话）。

All of these questions are made considerably more pressing by the fact that the technology is of extraordinary value, and the amount of Factor Man’s fee for a one-year license to the highest bidder is likely to be immense. Current estimates of the value range from $1B (one billion) to $1T (one trillion) US dollars. If the transaction proceeds as Factor Man apparently plans, he is likely to be one of the richest (if not the richest) person on the planet at a single stroke.

…

…

刘

Liu

2019

2019

不尊重中国政府，就是不尊重中国人民。中国领导人正确地宣布“人因”是中国人民的敌人，并允许我们在与他打交道时采取自由行动。

When you disrespect the Chinese government, you disrespect the Chinese people. Chinese leadership had been right to declare Factor Man an enemy of the Chinese people and to allow us freedom of action in dealing with him.

首先，我们必须找到他。

First, we had to find him.

任何时候，都有大约 50 万美国人访问欧洲。其中一半是女性，其余约 70% 的人身高不足 175 厘米或高于 185 厘米，这正好符合我们在维也纳见到的那位个人的身高。这样一来，就剩下 7.5 万人了。

At any given moment, some 500,000 Americans are visiting Europe. Half of those are women, and about 70% of the remainder are shorter than 175cm or taller than 185cm, which safely bracketed the height of the individual we had seen in Vienna. That left 75,000 individuals.

根据我们拍摄的镜头，很难估计“因素人”的年龄，但可以肯定地说，他至少有 20 岁，最多不超过 60 岁。这样一来，人数就减少了大约一半，即 40,000 人。

The footage we had made it difficult to estimate Factor Man’s age, but it was probably safe to say he was at least twenty and no more than sixty. That cut the number by about a factor of two, say 40,000 people.

美国人的肥胖症也帮了我们大忙。照片中的男人最多是稍微超重了一点，这对美国人来说有点反常。虽然护照数据不包括体重，但可以从照片中推断出来。这让我们排除了剩余人员的一半。大约剩下 20,000 个名字。仅从护照数据来看，我们就有 19,729 人需要考虑。

We were also aided by the American obesity epidemic. The man in the picture was at most slightly overweight, something of an anomaly for Americans. While passport data does not include weight, it can be inferred from the photograph. This allowed us to eliminate half of the remaining individuals. 20,000 names remained, give or take. From passport data alone, we had 19,729 people to consider.

种族因素也起到了一定作用。Factor Man 似乎是一名非西班牙裔白人，而非西班牙裔白人占美国人口的 62%。排除这些因素后，我们剩下 12,377 个潜在目标。

Race also helped. Factor Man appeared to be a non-Hispanic white man, and non-Hispanic whites make up 62% of the U.S. population. Eliminating those left us 12,377 potential targets.

12,377 既是大数又是小数。这个数字足够小，以至于我们可以将最先进的面部识别技术应用于该问题，尽管该技术运行速度非常慢，以至于分析每张护照图像并将其与 Factor Man 视频进行比较需要近一秒钟的时间。

12,377 is both a large number and a small one. It was small enough that we could apply our most sophisticated facial recognition technology to the problem, even though that technology ran sufficiently slowly that it would take almost a second to analyze each passport image and compare it to the Factor Man video.

但 12,377 张照片已经足够大，因此手工分析照片并不现实。我们当然有足够的工作人员，但一个人负责检查大约 250 张照片，犯错的可能性实在太大。考虑到很有可能任何一组 250 张照片中没有一个人是我们要找的人，这种情况尤其严重。

But 12,377 was large enough that it was impractical to analyze the images by hand. We certainly had the necessary staff available, but it was simply too likely that errors would be made by a single individual responsible for examining perhaps 250 photographs. That was especially true given that in all probability, none of any particular set of 250 images would be the individual whom we were seeking.

不幸的是，我们的视觉软件无法在候选护照中识别出“人中人”。从很多方面来看，只有“人中人”的鼻子可供分析；其他所有部位都可能是人造的。目前还无法对正面护照照片上的鼻子和我们视频中的侧面图像进行详细比较。鼻子还缺乏嘴巴或耳朵中存在的许多可区分的亚特征。通常提供可靠次要信息的一个区域是人中，即鼻子和上唇之间的垂直凹槽，其宽度和深度各不相同。不幸的是，它被“人中人”的胡子遮住了。

Unfortunately, our vision software was unable to identify Factor Man among the candidate passports. In many senses, only Factor Man’s nose was available for analysis; everything else was potentially artificial. A detailed comparison between a nose on a front-facing passport photograph and a profile image from our video was simply not yet possible. Noses also lacked the many distinguishing subfeatures that were present in mouths or in ears. The one area that generally provides reliable secondary information is the philtrum, the vertical groove between the nose and upper lip that varies in both width and depth. It was unfortunately obscured by Factor Man’s mustache.

因此，我们需要诉诸传统技术。美国劳动力中大约 2% 的男性是计算机科学家。虽然在我们在维也纳见到 Factor Man 的那天，这类人可能在访问欧洲的美国人中占比过高，但我们预计，将我们的重点限制在某种类型的计算机专业人员身上，可以将 Factor Man 嫌疑人的数量减少到 1000 人以下。

We therefore needed to resort to conventional techniques. Approximately 2% of males in the American workforce are computer scientists. While such individuals would likely be somewhat overrepresented in the fraction of Americans visiting Europe on the day we had seen Factor Man in Vienna, we expected that restricting our focus to computer professionals of one sort or another would reduce the number of Factor Man suspects to well under a thousand.

秘密调查大约一万两千名美国人的生计需要打几万个电话，需要上千次亲自拜访，需要花费时间。

Surreptitiously determining the livelihood of some twelve thousand Americans would involve tens of thousands of phone calls. It would require thousands of individual visits. It would take time.

但或许最重要的是，中国很有耐心。

But, perhaps above all else, China is patient.

博客

The blog

2019 年 4 月 3 日

April 3, 2019
