(requested by Adam Baldwin)

39197814408534284172336648357952958193678652469826613528572248216297=10005828435095633188870454978284789×391749815248152 8265542434710910373

39197814408534284172336648357952958193678652469826613528572248216297 = 10005828435095633188870454978284789 × 3917498152481528265542434710910373

（由 Jewel Staite 要求）

(requested by Jewel Staite)

《萤火虫》的五位原班人马。我向马赫先生、托雷斯女士和巴卡琳女士致歉。遗憾的是，格拉斯先生已经离开了我们。

Five of the original cast members of Firefly. My apologies to Mr. Maher, Ms. Torres and Ms. Baccarin. Mr. Glass is unfortunately no longer with us.

226 位数字需要在三天内分解。

226-bit numbers will be factored in three days.

90 天后，将开始竞标我所开发技术的使用许可，该许可为独家使用，但一年内不可转让。我想提供一些有关该流程如何运作的更多细节。

In 90 days, bidding will commence on a license to use the technology I have developed, exclusive but non-transferable for one year. I would like to provide some additional details on how that process will work.

我将采用的竞标方法是改良版维克里拍卖。基本上，它类似于 eBay。假设至少有两个出价，则该技术将授权给出价最高的人，价格将是第二高出价人的报价。如果最高出价不止一次，则第一个出价的人将被视为出价高于其他人。

The bidding method I will use is a modified Vickrey auction. Basically, it’s like eBay. Assuming that there are at least two bids, the technology will be licensed to the highest bidder and the price will be the offer made by the second highest bidder. If the highest bid is made more than once, whoever made the bid first will be treated as having outbid the others.

如果最高出价者因某种原因未能完成交易，则许可证将按照出价者提供的价格发放给第二高出价者。

In the event that the highest bidder for some reason does not complete the transaction, the license will be issued to the second highest bidder at the price that bidder offered.

与 eBay 不同的是，该技术的竞标将分为两步。

Unlike eBay, bidding for the technology will be a two-step process.

1. 首先，所有竞标者必须经过我个人的资格审查。这意味着我需要确定，如果获得许可证，您将用它来促进美国公民的利益。

1. First, all bidders must be qualified by me personally. This means that I need to determine that if awarded the license, you will use it to further the interests of the citizens of the United States.

如果您是公共实体（例如上市公司或名人），我将根据您过去的行为记录做出决定。如果没有这样的记录，请向我提供您选择的任何信息，我将尽我所能做出最佳决定。我的所有资格决定都是最终决定。

If you are a public entity (such as a publicly traded corporation or a famous person), I will make that decision based on the record of your past actions. If there is no such record, please provide me with whatever you choose, and I will make the best decision that I can. All of my qualification decisions are final.

尽管我开发的技术会带来很多后果，但我依然坚信隐私权。所以你也需要说服我，你不会利用这项技术进一步侵犯我们每个人的隐私——包括我自己。

In spite of the consequences of the technology I have developed, I am a great believer in privacy. So you need also to convince me that you will not use the technology to further erode the privacy of each of us – myself included.

为了获得资格，您必须通过我的律师，纽约 Duane Morris 的 Robert Hasday 存入 100 万美元（一百万美元）的托管金。Duane Morris 已聘请 Wilmington Trust 作为托管代理来处理这些资金，托管协议将应要求提供。在资格审查过程中托管的资金将在做出资格审查决定后立即退还给您，无论是正面的还是负面的。

In order to be qualified, you must place $1M (one million US dollars) in escrow through my attorney, Robert Hasday of Duane Morris in New York. Duane Morris has retained Wilmington Trust as the escrow agent to handle these funds, and the escrow agreement will be made available upon request. Money escrowed during the qualification process will be returned to you as soon as a qualification decision is made, whether it is positive or negative.

不允许联合体。我的目标是将技术授权给一个单一实体，而不是标准普尔 500 指数中所有股票的某个集团。我不会让在本文发布时尚未存在的潜在竞标者获得资格。

Consortia are not permitted. My goal here is to license the technology to a single entity, not some conglomerate of all of the stocks in the S&P 500. I will not qualify potential bidders that were not already in existence as of the time of this blog post.

合格的投标者将获得允许其投标的许可证的详细条款。

Qualified bidders will be provided with the detailed terms of the license on which they are permitted to bid.

2. 在您符合资格后（假设您符合资格），您可以随意出价，只要高于目前第二名的出价即可。（该金额将会公布；见下文。）无论您的出价是多少，该金额的 10% 必须通过 Duane Morris 进行托管。托管资金的利息将捐赠给全国消除无家可归者联盟。竞标者还必须放弃任何可能妨碍 Duane Morris 在谈判过程中代表我的利益冲突。

2. After you are qualified (assuming that you are), you are free to place any bid that is higher than the current second place bid. (This amount will be known; see below.) Whatever your bid, 10% of that amount must be placed in escrow through Duane Morris. Interest on the escrowed funds will be donated to the National Alliance to End Homelessness. Bidders will also be required to waive any conflict of interest that might prevent Duane Morris from representing me as negotiations proceed.

每天，我都会通过博客公布目前第二高的出价。竞标结束后，我会公布中标人的身份，并会将第二名出价人的身份告知中标人，以便他们确认价格与申报的价格一致。

Each day, I will announce via the blog the current second-highest bid. When bidding is complete, I will announce the identity of the winning bidder, and will inform the winning bidder of the identity of the second place bidder so that they can confirm that the price is as declared.

合同谈判完成后，许可证将立即发放。中标人必须在 2021 年 7 月 10 日将本可在 2019 年 7 月 10 日用第二名出价对应的资金购买的某些上市公司的股票以及任何股息的再投资转让给我。许可协议将包括有关确切股份数量以及购买这些股份的公司的信息。如果中标人是一家上市公司，则转让的股票中至少 15% 将是获得许可证的公司的股份。

The license will be issued as soon as contractual negotiations are complete. The winning bidder will be required to transfer to me on July 10, 2021 that amount of stock in certain publicly held companies that could have been bought on July 10, 2019 with the funds corresponding to the second-place bid, together with a reinvestment of any dividends. The licensing agreement will include instructions regarding the exact number of shares, and companies in which they are to be purchased. If the winning bidder is a publicly held company, no less than 15% of the stock to be transferred will be shares of the company obtaining the license.

该网站已被访问过 126,211,231,262 次。

This web site has been visited 126,211,231,262 times.

11

11

伯克特

Burkett

2019 年 4 月 4 日

April 4, 2019

一个根据天气预报，奥斯汀周三有雨；这是一场我记忆犹新的早季风暴。周四天气晴朗，但仍然闷热。Factor Man 前一天的博客文章给了我各种各样的信息，但这些信息必须等到我到达目的地后才能知道。

As forecast, Wednesday in Austin was rainy; an early-in-the-season storm of the sort that I remembered all too well. Thursday arrived with clear skies but still muggy. Factor Man’s blog post of the previous day had given me all manner of things to check out, but they would just have to wait until I went wherever it was I was going.

调查记者是计划者。我为这次旅行做了周密的计划，也就是说，我在谷歌上找到了地点，并算出开车到那里大约需要一个小时。它看起来正处于茫茫荒野之中，周围是灌木丛，四周是沙漠。由于前一天下过雨，泥路可能比平时更糟糕。为了组织好行程，我甚至拿起了一副双筒望远镜。

Investigative reporters are planners. I had planned carefully for the trip, which meant that I had pulled up the location on Google and figured out that it would take me about an hour to drive there. It looked to be squarely in the middle of nowhere, desert surrounded by scrub. Dirt roads that would probably be more miserable than usual because of the previous day’s rain. In a paroxysm of organization, I even picked up a pair of binoculars.

我还查看了谷歌的路线指引，这很好，因为他们给我的指引少了大约一英里。谷歌不知道土路的情况，所以它只是把我带到了有名字的路上最近的一个点。其实并没有那么近。不过，花了一个小时研究谷歌卫星图像让我找到了一条可行的路线，我周四一早就从床上起床出发了。

I also checked the Google directions to the location, which was a good thing because they left me about a mile short. Google didn’t know about dirt roads, so it just dropped me at the closest point on a road with a name. Wasn’t all that close. But a tedious hour spent with Google’s satellite imagery had let me figure out a route that would work, and I set off as early on Thursday morning as I could stagger out of bed.

经过一个半小时的坑坑洼洼的路程后，时间是 10:30，我到达了预定地点。大约十英里内，我都没有手机信号。地点和我预想的差不多，主要景点是一块约一英尺宽的岩石。一件好事是我处在方圆五英里内的最高点。在德克萨斯州的这片地区，这意味着我可能比方圆五英里内的最低点高出十五英尺。但这样很容易就能拿起双筒望远镜判断是否有人在跟踪我。

An hour and a half of potholes later, it was 10:30 and I was where I was supposed to be. I hadn’t had a cell signal for around ten miles. The location was pretty much as I expected, with the primary attraction being a rock about a foot across. One good thing was that I was at the highest point for maybe five miles around. In this part of Texas, that meant I was maybe fifteen feet higher than the lowest point for five miles around. But it made it pretty easy to grab the binoculars and tell if I had been followed.

我曾有过。

Which I had.

我不知道该怎么办，于是我回到车里，一边打开空调一边思考这件事，希望会发生一些好事。

I had no idea what to do about that, so I got back in the car and ran the air conditioner while I thought about it and hoped that something good would happen.

没什么好事发生。我又等了一个小时，唯一的变化就是太阳更加直射头顶。

Nothing good happened. I waited another hour and the only thing that changed was that the sun was more directly overhead.

于是我又等了一个小时，但效果和前一个小时差不多。

So I waited another hour, which had pretty much the same effect as the previous hour.

跟踪我的那些人，正如预料的那样，把车停在了返回文明世界的路上。我决定过去和他们聊聊，问问他们是否愿意不带我开车返回文明世界。

The guys who had followed me were, somewhat predictably, parked on the road back to civilization. I decided to go talk to them, and ask if maybe they’d be willing to drive back to civilization without me.

我把车停在他们旁边，摇下车窗，发现他们的空调也开着。他们也摇下车窗，我发现自己正盯着一对戴着墨镜的西装革履夫妇。他们也盯着我看。

I pulled up alongside them, and could tell that their air conditioning was on as well as I rolled my window down. They did the same, and I found myself staring at a couple of suits with sunglasses. They stared back.

“能帮你吗？”其中一个人终于问道。

“Help you?” one of them finally asked.

“你跟着我了吗？”威廉·伯克特（William Burkett），间接大师。

“Are you following me?” William Burkett, master of indirection.

“是的。”

“Yup.”

“你愿意停下来吗？”

“You willing to stop?”

“没有。”

“Nope.”

我认为谈话进展顺利。

I thought the conversation was going well.

“你跟着我干什么？”

“Why are you following me?”

“被告知。”

“Told to.”

我决定谨慎行事。没有必要告诉他们我在外面所做的一切。

I decided to play my cards carefully. No point telling them everything about what I was doing out there.

“我想见一个人。”

“I’m trying to meet someone.”

“我想是的。”

“Figured that.”

“如果你跟着我，他们就不会出现。”

“They’re not going to show up if you’re following me.”

“可能不是。”

“Probably not.”

这是一场典型的墨西哥式僵局。我不能让步，因为那天是星期四。我怀疑他们也不能让步，因为他们没有更好的事情可做。

It was a classic Mexican standoff. I couldn’t give in because it was Thursday. They couldn’t give in, I suspected, because they had nothing better to do.

我可以回到我应该去的地方。不过，我必须关掉空调，否则可能会耗尽汽油。

I could go back to where I was supposed to be. I’d have to turn the a/c off, though, or I’d risk running out of gas.

所以我就是这么做的。我没动，一英里之外，他们也没动。日落时分，他们打开了灯，但他们还是一动不动。

So that’s what I did. I didn’t move and, a mile away, they didn’t move. At sunset, they turned their lights on, but they still didn’t move.

我二话不说就承认了，然后开车回到了奥斯汀的酒店。

I conceded without a word, and drove back to my hotel in Austin.

星期五我先去奥斯汀计算机科学系找丽娜，结果被告知她也在神秘地休个人假。没事可做，我开车回到了沙漠。实际上，几乎什么事都好做，但似乎都没什么用。

I started Friday by looking for Rina at the Austin computer science department, only to be told that she, too, was on a mysterious personal leave. With nothing better to do, I drove back into the desert. Actually, pretty much anything was better but none of it seemed likely to be useful.

同样的结果。同样的两个人，同样的两套西装，同样的太阳镜。同样的石头。那天不是星期四，我不知道这是否重要。

Same result. Same two guys, same two suits, same sunglasses. Same rock. It wasn’t Thursday, and I had no idea if it mattered.

周六的情况有所不同。我先是偷偷溜出酒店，然后打车去了一家汽车租赁公司。我租了一辆车，开到了发现石头的地方。

Saturday was different. I started it by sneaking out of the hotel and taking a cab to a car rental agency. I rented a car and drove to the spot with the rock.

周六的情况与周四和周五差不多。唯一的区别是又下雨了。

Then Saturday turned out pretty much like Thursday and Friday. The only difference was that it rained again.

* * *

* * *

周日的情况确实不同，因为我睡到了中午。我想联邦调查局可能会看着我睡觉，就像看着我开车驶入德克萨斯沙漠中部一样。

Sunday actually was different, because I slept in until noon. I figured the FBI might just as well watch me sleep as watch me drive into the middle of the Texas desert.

中午刚过不久，电话就响了。一个我不认识的女人的声音找我，然后说她有消息。

Shortly after noon, the phone rang. A woman’s voice I didn’t recognize asked for me and then said that she had a message.

“什么？”我问。

“What?” I asked.

“坚持。”然后她挂了电话。

“Persist.” And she hung up.

* * *

* * *

于是我开车返回沙漠。西装革履的人跟在我后面，我转过身去和他们商量事情。

So I drove back toward the desert. The suit guys followed after me, and I turned around to talk things over.

同样的西装，同样的太阳镜。他们的生活和我一样丰富多彩。

Same suits, same sunglasses. Their days had as much variety as mine did.

“嘿。”调查记者就是这么健谈。

“Hey.” Investigative reporters are chatty like that.

这些西装革履的人就没那么喋喋不休了。

The suits were far less loquacious.

“听着，”我说。

“Listen,” I said.

他们说，没什么。

Nothing, they said.

“每个人都知道这里发生了什么。

“Everyone knows what’s going on here.

“我想见一个人，但你却让我无法如愿。我们可以每天在沙漠里做这件事，但我们只会变老。

“I’m trying to meet someone, and you’re making it impossible. We can do this thing in the desert every day, and all we’ll get is older.

“我猜，无论你的老板是谁，他们都希望这次会议能够举行。他们的第一选择是让你旁观，但这显然是不可能的。我敢打赌，他们的第二选择是会议在没有你的情况下举行。他们宁愿这样，也不愿根本没有会议。

“My guess is that your bosses, whoever they are, want this meeting to take place. Their first choice is that you get to watch, but that’s clearly not going to happen. I bet their second choice is that the meeting takes place without you. They prefer that to no meeting at all.

“那么，在我们离开手机信号覆盖范围之前，你能不能先跟他们确认一下？”

“So. Before we leave cell coverage, how about if you check in with them?”

他们盯着我看，仿佛我是外星人，于是我走回车里坐了下来。

They stared at me as if I was a space alien, so I walked back to my car and sat down.

十分钟后，他们开车走了。

Ten minutes later, they drove off.

* * *

* * *

同样的土路交叉口，同样的石头，同样的一切。

Same dirt road intersection. Same rock. Same bunch o’ nothing.

我坐在那里，打开空调，等待好事发生。

I sat there, air conditioning running, and waited for something good to happen.

什么也没发生。

Nothing happened.

我下了车，用望远镜看了看。我一个人。我向天空望去，想找一架隐形直升机，中情局总是派它去追捕像我这样的人，但我没看到它。除非是沙漠天空的蓝色褪色，否则它根本不存在。

I got out of the car and looked with the binoculars. I was by myself. I looked in the sky for that stealth helicopter that the CIA is always sending out after people like me and couldn’t see it. Unless it was the washed-out blue of the desert sky, it wasn’t there.

我回到了车上。

I got back in the car.

最后，我下了车，翻开了石头。威廉·伯克特。没有一块石头没翻过。当只有一块石头时，这很容易。

Eventually, I got out of the car and turned over the rock. William Burkett. No stone unturned. Pretty easy when there’s only one stone.

那里有一张纸，上面有手写的指示。我不知道是该高兴还是该尴尬。

There was a piece of paper with hand-written directions. I didn’t know whether to be elated or embarrassed.

* * *

* * *

路线指引把我带到了一家小镇餐馆，那里没有手机信号，只有一名女服务员。她看上去已经当了很久的服务员。她见多识广，但仍然用热情的微笑迎接顾客，似乎真的很高兴见到我。她的名牌上写着她是路易莎。“一人桌？”她问道。

The directions brought me to a small-town diner with no cell coverage and one waitress. She looked like she had been a waitress for a long time. Seen it all, but still greeting incoming patrons with a warm smile and appearing to be genuinely pleased to see me. Her nametag identified her as Luisa. “Table for one?” she asked.

我认出了这个声音。正是这个鼓励我坚持下去的声音。

I recognized the voice. Same one that had encouraged persistence.

我还认出了坐在角落桌旁的丽娜·阿伦森。她背对着墙，眼睛看着门。我进门时，她已经站起来走了过来。

I also recognized Rina Aaronson, sitting at a corner table. Back to the wall, eyes to the door. She had gotten up and walked over as I entered.

“没关系，路易莎。这是我让你打电话的朋友。他不会留下来。”

“That’s fine, Luisa. This is the friend I had you call. He won’t be staying.”

“当然了，阿伦森夫人。我期待着您回来时见到您。”

“Of course, Mrs. Aaronson. I’ll look forward to seeing you when you come back.”

出发时，丽娜告诉我，她以为我想尽快见到斯科特。我告诉她，她是对的；我花了整整四天才走到这一步。

As we headed out, Rina told me she had assumed I wanted to see Scott as quickly as possible. I told her that she was right; it had taken me four long days to get this far.

她笑了。“真是大错特错。他们有三县最好的食物。”

She smiled. “Big mistake. They’ve got the best food in three counties.”

我们站着，丽娜继续说：“抱歉，我讲了这么多秘密。我想你们都知道，我出生在以色列。每个以色列公民都要在以色列国防军服役；女性服役两年，男性服役时间稍长。但考虑到我在以色列军队服役的经历，以及斯科特作为复杂性理论家的经历，我相信你们可以想象，美国政府最近对我们……很粗暴。”

We remained standing as Rina continued. “Sorry about all the cloak-and-dagger stuff. As I expect you know, I am Israeli-born. Every Israeli citizen is expected to serve in the Israeli Defense Forces; women serve for two years and men for slightly longer. But given my history of Israeli military service and Scott’s history as a complexity theorist, I am sure you can imagine that the United States government has treated us … intrusively of late.”

丽娜让我们坐她的车。经过一个小时，大概总共行驶了十英里，感觉这些路已经十年没有维护了，我们来到一个小木屋，旁边是一个比小溪大但比溪流小的东西。小溪里长满了各种绿色植物，太阳能电池板似乎为小屋本身提供电力。正如我可能预料的那样，没有手机信号。没有卫星天线或任何其他明显的与外界联系的方式。

Rina asked that we take her car. After an hour and probably a grand total of ten miles over roads that felt like they hadn’t been maintained in a decade, we got to a small cabin next to something bigger than a creek but smaller than a stream. The little brook supported a variety of greenery, and solar panels appeared to provide power to the cabin itself. As I might have predicted, there was no cell signal. There wasn’t a satellite dish or any other obvious way of contacting the outside world.

小屋本身很小但很可爱；卧室配有一张桌子，可以兼作办公室和厨房/餐厅。我们进屋时，斯科特·阿伦森正在电脑上打字（没有网络连接，使用电脑还有什么意义？），他起身迎接我们。

The cabin itself was small but lovely; a bedroom with a desk that allowed it to double as an office and a kitchen/dining room combination. Scott Aaronson was typing away at a computer as we entered (is there even any point using a computer with no Internet connection?), and rose to greet us.

在与我握手之前，我先与丽娜拥抱并亲吻。

A hug and kiss with Rina preceded a handshake with me.

“我想，是因子人吧？”我问道。

“Factor Man, I presume?” I asked.

“恐怕没有，”他回答道。

“’Fraid not,” he answered.

* * *

* * *

Factor Man 是谁？

Who is Factor Man?

威廉·伯克特，《纽约时报》

William Burkett, The New York Times

我刚刚和一个不是 Factor Man 的人一起度过了两天。

I have just spent two days with someone who is not Factor Man.

我听到你说这不太令人印象深刻。通常情况下，我会同意你的看法。

Not so impressive, I hear you say. And normally, I’d agree with you.

但这个人就是斯科特·阿伦森。他是德克萨斯大学奥斯汀分校的复杂性理论家，在所有人眼中的“因子人”候选人名单中名列前茅。或者至少，他曾经是。

But this particular someone was Scott Aaronson. A complexity theorist at the University of Texas at Austin, he’s pretty high on everyone’s list of Factor Man candidates. Or at least, he used to be.

首先，我要告诉你一些我的亲身经历：成为 Factor Man 社交圈的知名成员（更不用说 Factor Man 本人了）几乎没有任何好处。你的隐私将受到严重侵犯，各种政府机构的关注度也将大大提高。你所珍视的任何个人关系都将面临巨大压力，因为你的男朋友、女朋友、配偶或其他任何人会意识到，避免这种命运最简单的方法就是离开道奇。（如果他或她没有逃跑，一定要经常告诉他或她，你有多欣赏他们坚定的性格。）

Let me begin by telling you something I know from personal experience: Being a known member of Factor Man’s social circle – let alone Factor Man himself – comes with virtually no benefits. Expect a serious hit to your privacy, and a big increase in attention received from various three-letter government agencies. Expect significant strains on any personal relationships you hold dear, as your boyfriend, girlfriend, spouse or whatever realizes that the simplest way to avoid your fate is simply to get out of Dodge. (If he or she doesn’t cut and run, be sure to tell him or her often how much you appreciate their steadfast nature.)

在阿伦森的案例中，他的妻子曾是以色列军人，这让事情变得更加糟糕。美国政府不仅担心斯科特是关键人物，还担心以色列人会抢在美国之前掌握这项技术。

In Aaronson’s case, his wife’s history as a member of the Israeli military made things worse still. Not only was the American government concerned that Scott was Factor Man, but they were also concerned that the Israelis would get their hands on the technology before the Americans did.

因此，阿伦森决定证明自己不是“因子人”。他和妻子丽娜在奥斯汀郊外几个小时车程外拥有一间三室小屋，并在每个房间都安装了摄像机。他远离最近的手机信号塔，在那里呆了一个星期，录下自己的一举一动，以证明他没有做过“因子人”做过的任何事。“因子人”甚至比平时更不按常理出牌，召集了《萤火虫》的演员们，在一天内提供了要进行因子分析的数字。

So Aaronson decided to prove that he wasn’t Factor Man. He retreated to a three-room cabin he and his wife Rina own a couple of hours outside of Austin, and set up a video camera in every room. Far away from the nearest cell tower, he stayed there for a week, videotaping his every move to prove that he did none of the things Factor Man did. Factor Man even obliged by being a bit less predictable than usual, gathering the cast of Firefly to provide the numbers to be factored one day.

当然，随着阿伦森和他的妻子消失在德克萨斯州的沙漠中，这三个字母的家伙比以往任何时候都更加确信他们已经找到了神秘的、被认为是恐怖分子的 Factor Man。他们展开了深入的搜索，我本人甚至也短暂地被卷入其中。阿伦森一家躲了起来，他们不想被发现。

Of course, with Aaronson and his wife disappearing into the Texas desert, the three-letter guys were more convinced than ever that they had identified the mysterious-and-assumed-to-be-a-terrorist Factor Man. An intensive search was set up, and yours truly was even caught up in it briefly. The Aaronsons were hiding, and they didn’t want to be found.

他们最终把我带到了小屋，我和他们一起度过了几天。以下是我了解到的情况。

They eventually brought me out to the cabin, and I spent a couple of days with them. Here’s what I learned.

首先，斯科特·阿伦森不是关键人物。我看了他截至 4 月 7 日的一周的大部分视频。视频非常无聊。阿伦森没有离开小屋。他没有登录互联网。他没有收到任何电子邮件，也没有打过任何电话。他见了妻子，但很明显没有交换任何文件或其他信息。他们只是聊天，做已婚夫妇会做的事。

First, Scott Aaronson is not Factor Man. I watched much of the video of him for the week ending April 7. It was very boring. Aaronson didn’t leave the cabin. He didn’t log onto the Internet. He didn’t get any email, and he didn’t make any phone calls. He met with his wife, but it was all too clear that no documents or other information was exchanged. They just talked and did what married couples do.

第二，我和阿伦森详细谈论了因素人本身。我问斯科特，他现在是否认为P和NP是相同的。他笑着告诉我，他的观点没有改变。

Second, I spoke with Aaronson at some length about Factor Man himself. I asked Scott if he now thought that P and NP were identical. He smiled and told me that his views were unchanged.

自从 Factor Man 出现以来，P和NP就成了家喻户晓的词汇。我们都知道P 的意思是“简单”，比如检查一条特定的旅行路线是否经过美国大陆的每个州首府，并且全长 6,813 英里。我们都知道NP的意思是“困难”，比如找到一条确实经过所有 48 个下级州首府的最短公路。我们甚至知道NP中的一些问题非常困难，如果你能解决它们，那么你也可以解决NP中的所有其他问题。我们知道 Factor Man 声称他已经解决了其中一个“超难”问题。

Since Factor Man’s appearance, P and NP have become household words. We all understand that P means “easy”, like checking that a particular route of travel visits every state capital in the continental United States and is 6,813 miles long. We all understand that NP means “hard”, like finding the shortest road trip that does indeed visit the capitals of all 48 lower states. We even understand that some problems in NP are so hard that if you can solve them, you can solve all of the other problems in NP as well. We know that Factor Man claims he has solved one of these “superhard” problems.

然而，因式分解（这是因式分解人唯一能做到的）并不是一个已知的超级难题。它可能是超级难题。它也可能属于P 类，属于简单问题之一。

Number factoring, however – which is all that Factor Man has proven he can do – is not known to be one of the superhard problems. It might be superhard. It also might be in P, one of the easy problems.

阿伦森认为，因式分解属于P范畴，而 Factor Man 已经证明了这一点。这将会很有趣，而且对于互联网商务来说确实会很尴尬。但它的影响不会像证明P=NP那样深远。

Aaronson believes that number factoring is in P, and that Factor Man has proven that. That would be interesting, and it would indeed be awkward for Internet commerce. But it would be nothing like as far-reaching as proving that P=NP.

所以 Scott Aaronson 不是 Factor Man。他的妻子也不是。我也不是。

So Scott Aaronson is not Factor Man. Neither is his wife. Neither am I.

完成 3 个，还剩 6,999,999,997 个。

Three down, 6,999,999,997 to go.

这篇文章发表的第二天，卡内基梅隆大学复杂性理论家、因子人候选人领先者史蒂文·鲁迪奇联系了阿伦森，要求借用小屋。三天后，他带着政府随行人员赶到。

The day after this article appeared, Steven Rudich (complexity theorist at Carnegie Mellon University, and also a leading Factor Man candidate) contacted Aaronson and asked to borrow the cabin. He arrived, government entourage in tow, three days later.

鲁迪奇在船舱里度过了愉快的两周，而随行人员在外面度过了不太愉快的两周。

Rudich spent a pleasant two weeks in the cabin, and the entourage spent a rather less pleasant two weeks outside.

已完成 4 个，还剩 6,999,999,996 个。

Four down, 6,999,999,996 to go.

Factor Man 博客

The Factor Man blog

2019 年 4 月 15 日

April 15, 2019

(requested by Dwayne Johnson)

（应 Olivia Wilde 要求）

(requested by Olivia Wilde)

（应艾玛·沃特森要求）

(requested by Emma Watson)

78189999769399726248484919802848410205197013119327423511629559173819621 = 267905519794587982358521925385569029 × 29185662105 5626564325906629016266849

（应安吉丽娜·朱莉要求）

(requested by Angelina Jolie)

80854241359520937877717789206399870681672011704813766921239294602538597=257550376509677282800484515185864539×31393563641 9009055274826797620757823

80854241359520937877717789206399870681672011704813766921239294602538597 = 257550376509677282800484515185864539 × 313935636419009055274826797620757823

（应林-曼努尔·米兰达要求）

(requested by Lin-Manuel Miranda)

237 位数字需要两天时间才能分解完成。

237-bit numbers will be factored in two days.

在最近的一次采访中，斯科特·阿伦森 (Scott Aaronson) 表示，我实际上并没有证明P=NP ，而只是表明了数字分解属于P 。这是一个非常合理的观点，这正是我希望斯科特相信的观点。

In a recent interview, Scott Aaronson suggested that I have not in fact proven that P=NP, but have instead only shown that number factoring is in P. This is such an eminently reasonably view that it is exactly what I would expect Scott to believe.

我也很难反驳这一点。我考虑过通过这个博客提出解决 SAT 中的任意问题，但这些问题必然是特殊情况，相对无意义，或者具有明显的商业价值，解决这些问题会超出我在此阶段项目的目标。

It is also difficult for me to disprove. I considered offering, through this blog, to solve arbitrary problems in SAT, but such problems would inevitably be special cases, relatively meaningless, or of such obvious commercial value that solving them would overreach my goals in this phase of the project.

以下是我愿意展示的内容：我将颁发许可证的代码是通用的布尔可满足性引擎。这是我迄今为止用来支持演示的技术，并且可以由我的技术许可人验证。鉴于许可费应在许可证授予后整整两年内支付，如果这些陈述被证明不属实，许可人无需支付任何费用。

Here is what I am willing to show: The code for which I will issue a license is a general-purpose Boolean satisfiability engine. It is the technique I have used to power my demonstration thus far, and that can be validated by the licensor of my technology. Given that the licensing fee is due a full two years after the license is granted, the licensor need pay nothing if these statements prove to be untrue.

有理由问为什么我不直接用软件来证明P=NP 。原因有二。

It is reasonable to ask why I don’t just use the software to prove that P=NP. There are two reasons.

首先，它效率不够高。代码本身是手写的（也是我写的），大约有 5,000 行 C++ 代码。

First, it’s not efficient enough. The code itself was written by hand (and by me), and is about 5,000 lines of C++.

更重要的是， P=NP是完全可能的，但标准算术公理却无法证明这一点。（事实上，在安德鲁·怀尔斯出现之前，人们一直认为费马大定理属于这一类。）

More important, it is completely possible that P=NP but there is no proof from the standard axioms of arithmetic. (Indeed, there were thoughts that Fermat’s Last Theorem was in this class, until Andrew Wiles came along.)

我唯一确定的是，我的代码是可以运行的。也许，虽然效率不高，但实际上却更有价值。这是我第一次因为懒惰而得到报酬。

All I know for sure is that I have code that works. Presumably the fact that it’s moderately inefficient will actually make it more valuable. First time I’ve ever gotten paid for being lazy.

该网站已被访问 171,299,382,217 次。

This web site has been visited 171,299,382,217 times.

12

12

伯克特

Burkett

2019 年 5 月 27 日

May 27, 2019

Factor Man 技术价值几何？

How much is the Factor Man technology worth?

威廉·伯克特，《纽约时报》

William Burkett, The New York Times

Factor Man 技术的拍卖将在两周后开始。它最终会落到哪里呢？

The auction for Factor Man technology starts in two weeks. Where is it likely to end up?

如今，该技术本身的基本价值已基本毋庸置疑。Factor Man 继续分解逐渐增大的数字，每个电子商务网站都已至少改用 256 位加密。（事实上，大约 80% 的大型电子商务网站已改用 1024 位或更高位加密，尽管尚不清楚这是否重要。）

The fundamental value of the technology itself is now relatively unquestioned. Factor Man continues to factor numbers of gradually increasing size, and every e-commerce site has switched to 256-bit encryption at least. (In fact, some 80% of the largest e-commerce sites have switched to 1024-bit encryption or more, although it’s not clear that it matters.)

这项技术是否能解决除数字分解以外的其他问题仍未得到解决，但科学界的明确共识是，它很可能可以。卡内基梅隆大学复杂性理论家史蒂文·鲁迪奇告诉我：“换算成 SAT 来说，数字分解为什么应该如此特殊呢？

The question of whether the technology can solve more than just number factoring problems remains open, but the clear consensus of the scientific community is that it probably can. “Converted to SAT,” Carnegie Mellon complexity theorist Steven Rudich told me, “why should number factoring be special?

“这样想吧。你买了一辆车，开到试车跑道上，它时速达到 287 英里。你认为当你把它带回家时，它的表现会有很大不同吗？”

“Look at it this way. You buy a car, take it to a test track, and it goes 287 miles an hour. Would you expect it to behave substantially differently when you brought it home?”

鲁迪奇还解释了 Factor Man 的有些神秘的评论：代码应该更有价值，因为它效率低下。

Rudich also explained Factor Man’s somewhat cryptic comment that the code should be more valuable because it’s inefficient.

“你需要明白，”他告诉我，“如果这项技术真如其名，那么它不只是分解数字那么简单。它几乎可以解决所有问题……”

“You need to understand,” he told me. “This technology, if it’s as described, isn’t just about factoring numbers. It’s about solving pretty much anything.

“只要是你能识别的品质，它就在你面前，这段代码就能产生。

“Any quality that you can recognize if it’s in front of you, this code can produce.

“我们能识别的一件事就是高效代码。因此，如果您想要更高效的 Factor Man 代码版本，您可以使用代码本身来创建它。”

“One of the things that we can recognize is efficient code. So if you want a more efficient version of the Factor Man code, you can use the code itself to create it.”

我问他为什么这会使它更有价值，而不是更没有价值。

I asked him why that made it more valuable, as opposed to less.

“因为谁先拿到代码，谁就能至少提前一年实现这一目标。他们编写的代码——实际上是技术本身编写的代码——将比政府在一年内获得的代码好得多。而且，它还会比我们其他人在两年内获得的代码更好。”

“Because whoever gets the code first will have at least a one-year head start on making that happen. The code they make – the code that the tech itself makes, actually – will be that much better than the code the government gets in a year. And it will be better still than the code the rest of us get in two years.”

我问鲁迪奇，他认为这个密码值多少钱。“无论你付出多少，它都是值得的，”他回答道。“打开你的存钱罐吧。”

I asked Rudich how much he thought the code was worth. “It’s worth whatever you pay for it,” he replied. “Break open your piggy bank.”

英国博彩市场似乎同意他的观点。他们最近热衷的市场是这样一个市场：你支付一定数额的钱，就可以得到 Factor Man 中标价的十亿分之一。截至撰写本文时，你必须支付 94.37 美元。他们也有常见的赌注，例如，你可以押注最终价格将在 750 亿美元到 1000 亿美元之间；那里的数字表明该技术的预期价格为 873 亿美元，因此 94.37 美元的下注者支付的费用比他们实际需要支付的费用要多一点。

The British betting markets appear to agree with him. Their latest rage is a market where you pay in a certain amount of money, and you get back one billionth of the winning Factor Man bid. As of this writing, you have to pay $94.37. They also have the usual sorts of bets where you can wager, for example, that the final price will be between $75 and $100 billion; the numbers there suggest an expected price of $87.3 billion for the technology, so that the $94.37 betters are paying a bit more than they actually might need to.

美国股市似乎也参与其中。美国公司持有的大部分自由现金都掌握在少数几家公司手中：

The American stock market appears to have chimed in as well. Most of the free cash held by American companies is held by a handful of them:

公司

Company

库存现金（十亿美元）

Cash on hand ($B)

苹果

Apple

236.4

236.4

微软

Microsoft

102.6

102.6

谷歌

Google

75.2

75.2

思科

Cisco

58.6

58.6

甲骨文

Oracle

52.7

52.7

辉瑞

Pfizer

39.3

39.3

强生公司

Johnson & Johnson

38.4

38.4

安进

Amgen

36.9

36.9

英特尔

Intel

31.3

31.3

高通

Qualcomm

28.4

28.4

所有这些公司可能都会对 Factor Man 技术感兴趣。软件公司是显而易见的。制药公司可以利用它来设计更好的药物。药物设计在很大程度上是弄清楚如何制造特定形状的分子，但一旦你有了分子，识别它是否具有必要的形状就很容易了。

All of these companies would presumably be interested in the Factor Man technology. The software companies are obvious. The drug companies could use it to design better drugs. Drug design is in large measure a matter of figuring out how to make a molecule of a specific shape, but once you have the molecule, recognizing that it has the necessary shape is easy.

如果鲁迪奇关于倾家荡产的说法是正确的，那么每家公司都会出价至少相当于他们手头现金的数额。因此，苹果最终将向 Factor Man 支付 1026 亿美元（微软预计排名第二的出价金额），作为回报，苹果将获得为期一年的独家许可，并比除美国政府之外的所有人提前两年开始竞标。

If Rudich is right about breaking the bank, each of the companies will make a bid at least equivalent to their cash on hand. So Apple will wind up handing Factor Man $102.6 billion (the value of Microsoft’s presumed second place bid), getting a one-year exclusive license in return and a two-year head start on everyone except the U.S. government.

有四家知名公司未列入上述名单，但其市值足够大，可以通过增发股票筹集大量资金。这四家公司分别是 Facebook、亚马逊、AT&T 和阿里巴巴集团，后者是中国电子商务巨头在纽约证券交易所的化身。没有人认为 Factor Man 会接受阿里巴巴的收购要约，这只会加深美国和中国之间的国家紧张关系。

Four notable companies are not on the above list, but have market capitalizations large enough that they could raise large amounts of cash by issuing additional stock. Those four companies are Facebook, Amazon, AT&T and the Alibaba Group, the NYSE incarnation of the Chinese e-commerce giant. No one expects Factor Man to accept a bid from Alibaba, which has served only to deepen the national tensions between the Americans and the Chinese.

华尔街目前对苹果的估值约为 6800 亿美元。Factor Man 宣布当天，苹果股价上涨 18%——略高于 1000 亿美元。显而易见的解释是，华尔街预计苹果将以 1000 亿美元的价格获得该技术的许可，而其价值将比这高出约 1000 亿美元。因此，华尔街对该技术价值的估计为 2000 亿美元。

Apple is currently valued at about $680B by Wall Street. The day of the Factor Man announcement, Apple stock jumped 18% – a bit over $100 billion. The obvious interpretation is that the Street expects Apple to license the technology for $100 billion, and for it to be worth about $100 billion more than that. So Wall Street’s estimate of the value of the technology is $200 billion.

博客

The blog

2019 年 6 月 9 日

June 9, 2019

发件人：Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

From: Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

收件人：Tim Cook (tcook@apple.com)

To: Tim Cook (tcook@apple.com),

拉里·佩奇（larry@google.com），

Larry Page (larry@google.com),

萨蒂亚·纳德拉（satyan@microsoft.com），

Satya Nadella (satyan@microsoft.com),

查克·罗宾斯（crobbins@cisco.com），

Chuck Robbins (crobbins@cisco.com),

拉里·埃里森 (ellison@oracle.com)

Larry Ellison (ellison@oracle.com)

回复：Factor Man 提供

Re: Factor Man offering

先生们：

Gentlemen:

我显然不知道您是否会竞标我大约一个月后将提供的技术许可。不过，如果您决定竞标，为了支持您的竞标，我可以保证，如果您在我演示的最后一天提交一个合适的数字进行分解，我将提供答案。

I obviously have no idea whether you will bid on the license to my technology that I will make available in about a month. In the interests of supporting such a bid if you decide to make it, however, I can guarantee that if you submit a suitable number for factorization on the last day of my demonstration, I will provide an answer.

调频

（应萨蒂亚·纳德拉要求）

(requested by Satya Nadella)

33961816262878148599942318331855077594431919467338180353771080136945015164101 = 221552899502310351503001936055091524493 × 15 3289874965161514877495785496037676057

33961816262878148599942318331855077594431919467338180353771080136945015164101 = 221552899502310351503001936055091524493 × 153289874965161514877495785496037676057

（应查克·罗宾斯要求）

(requested by Chuck Robbins)

39007763895250933515155780430381494356557030123873808465555797061175942093359 = 238868262102464974045526685894044510191 × 163302414276025317565173223901300634049

（应拉里·埃里森要求）

(requested by Larry Ellison)

该项技术的许可竞标现已开始。

Bidding for a license to this technology is now open.

有 26 位合格竞标者。第二名的出价目前为 0 美元。

There are 26 qualified bidders. The second-place bid is currently $0.

竞标将在 30 天内结束。

Bidding will close in 30 days.

该网站已被访问过 212,314,295,387 次。

This web site has been visited 212,314,295,387 times.

十三

13

伯克特

Burkett

2019 年 6 月 15 日

June 15, 2019

什么价格力？

What price power?

威廉·伯克特，《纽约时报》

William Burkett, The New York Times

Factor Man 技术拍卖已经进行了五天，目前竞标金额为 31.7 亿美元。最终价格是多少？

The Factor Man technology auction is five days old, and bidding currently stands at $3.17 billion. What will the final price be?

令人惊讶的是，人们对在线拍卖的生命周期知之甚少。例如，eBay 不会在拍卖进行期间和拍卖结束时公布物品的相对价格信息。事实上，唯一可用的在线信息似乎来自一个人，特洛伊·戴维斯，他绘制了 2009 年出售的一台数码相机的价值图表。

Surprisingly little is known about the life cycles of online auctions. eBay, for example, does not publish information about the relative prices of items while the auction is ongoing and when it ends. In fact, the only online information available appears to be from a single individual, Troy Davis, who charted the value of a digital camera he sold in 2009.

戴维斯发现，当拍卖额超出六分之一时（戴维斯为期七天的拍卖只进行了一天），价格是最终价格的 20%。基于此，Factor Man 的技术最终将以 160 亿美元左右的价格出售。没有人相信这一点。

What Davis found was that when the auction was one-sixth over (one day in, for Davis’ seven-day auction), the price was 20% of the final price. Based on that, Factor Man’s technology will eventually sell for about $16 billion. No one believes that for a second.

网上拍卖通常会以一段短暂的“狙击”期结束。这意味着各种竞标者通过计算机程序出价，并告诉程序在最后一刻出价。通过这样做，他们希望避免情绪占据主导地位，导致双方陷入竞价战，相互竞价，最终支付的价格远远超过某件物品的价值。

Online auctions often end with a brief period of what is called “sniping”. This means that a variety of bidders make their bids via computer programs, telling the program to place the bid at the last possible moment. By doing this, they hope to avoid situations where emotions take over and two parties wind up in a bidding war, bidding against each other and eventually paying much more than a particular item is worth.

这似乎不太可能发生。电脑竞标是不可能的，因为需要通过 Duane Morris 存入 10% 的投标金额。此外，虽然众所周知 Factor Man 拍卖将于 7 月 10 日结束，但没有人知道拍卖会在那天的确切时间结束。这使得狙击不可能，并且发给 Factor Man 的电子邮件询问有关拍卖结束的更多细节也没有得到答复。

That seems unlikely to happen here. Computerized bidding is impossible, given the requirement of depositing 10% of the bid in escrow through Duane Morris. In addition, while it is well known that the Factor Man auction will end on July 10, no one is sure exactly when on that day the auction will conclude. This makes sniping impossible, and email to Factor Man asking for more specifics about the end of the auction has gone unanswered.

普遍的看法是，最终的价格可能略高于 1000 亿美元。这个数字的经济效益令人震惊。假设他没有主要合作伙伴，那么 Factor Man 将一举成为地球上最富有的人，而且无人能及。Factor Man 一人拥有的 GDP 将超过哥斯达黎加或卢森堡。也比一大堆你不想去的国家还要大。

General wisdom remains that the final price is likely to be a little bit north of $100 billion. The economics of that number are staggering. Assuming that he has no major partners, Factor Man will, at a stroke, become the richest man on the planet, and it won’t be close. Factor Man will, by himself, have a larger GDP than Costa Rica or Luxembourg. Also larger than a whole bunch of countries that you wouldn’t want to visit.

这个数字也将对威尔明顿信托和全国消除无家可归者联盟产生重大影响。假设有 10% 的资金存入他们那里，威尔明顿信托将持有 300 亿美元——微软的 100 亿美元和苹果的两倍——至少一天左右的时间。如果他们设法以仅仅 0.5% 的利率进行投资，他们以及全国消除无家可归者联盟将获得 500 万美元的利息。就我个人而言，无论如何我都不知道该把这 300 亿美元存放在哪里。你不可能走到当地的分行，把一堆 20 美元钞票交给他们。这将有 1500 多吨20美元钞票，也占流通中的 20 美元钞票的 15% 左右，无疑会造成某种形式的全国性危机。

The number will also have a major impact on Wilmington Trust and the National Alliance to End Homelessness. Assuming that 10% is deposited with them, Wilmington Trust will be holding $30 billion – a presumed $10 billion from Microsoft and double that from Apple – for at least a day or so. If they manage to invest it at a mere 0.5%, they, and therefore the National Alliance to End Homelessness, will make five million in interest. Personally, I wouldn’t know where to park a cool $30 billion at any rate. It’s not as if you can walk down to your local branch and hand over a bunch of 20’s. It would be a bit over 1500 tons of 20’s, and would also be about 15% of the $20 bills in circulation, doubtless causing a national crisis of one form or another.

威尔明顿信托大概会找到应对的方法。而我们其他人似乎真的别无选择，只能继续关注博客。

Wilmington Trust will presumably find a way to cope. And the rest of us really seem to have no choice but to keep watching the blog.

刘

Liu

2019 年 7 月 3 日

July 3, 2019

我们在维也纳未能抓获的恐怖分子打算通过三步旅程向全世界公布他的密码。

The terrorist whom we had failed to capture in Vienna intended a three-step journey by which his code would be released upon the world.

首次发布将交给出价最高的人，毫无疑问是一家美国跨国公司。该组织可能会尽可能小心地保护代码，我们怀疑它会成功做到这一点。

The initial release would be to the highest bidder, doubtless an American multinational corporation. That organization would presumably safeguard the code as carefully as possible, and we suspected that it would be successful in doing so.

第二次发布将交给美国政府。他们可能也会试图保护代码，但他们在实践中能否做到这一点则值得怀疑。

The second release would be to the United States government. They would presumably also attempt to safeguard the code, but their ability to do so in practice was far more questionable.

第三次发布将向广大公众发布。

The third release would be to the public at large.

我的政府认为，每一步都比前一步更加危险，这既可能对中国不利，也可能干扰我们政府控制向中国人民的信息流动的需要。我们曾试图通过阿里巴巴集团（一家在纽约证券交易所上市的中国公司）参与这场荒谬的竞标游戏。阿里巴巴甚至被剥夺了竞标的机会。

The view of my government was that each successive step was more perilous than the previous one, both in terms of the potential disadvantage to China and in terms of potential interference with our government’s need to moderate the information flowing to the Chinese people. We had attempted to participate in the absurd bidding game via the Alibaba group, a Chinese company with a presence on the New York Stock Exchange. Alibaba was denied even the opportunity to make a bid.

然而，我们无法确定我们可以采取什么措施来干扰 Factor Man 的总体计划。他可能安排了他的计划，即使他死了，计划也会继续进行。他可能安排部分或全部释放由代理人执行。

It was not clear what steps we could take to interfere with Factor Man’s overall plan, however. He might have arranged for his plan to proceed even in the event of his death. He might have arranged for some or all of the releases to be performed by surrogates.

但他也可能计划亲自采取每一步。他非常傲慢，以至于我的政府认为，消除“人因”至少有相当的可能性可以消除威胁。考虑到他提出的计划将对整个中国造成的损害，他们决定尽可能消除“人因”。

But he also might be planning to take each of the steps himself. He was sufficiently arrogant that the view of my government was that it was at least reasonably likely that eliminating Factor Man would eliminate the threat. Given the damage that his stated plan would cause China at large, the decision was made to remove Factor Man if possible.

在首次发布后就消灭 Factor Man 可能会让一家美国跨国公司比其他公司更具竞争优势，但这对我们来说并不重要，因为大多数此类公司的利益与中国相当一致。当然，在代码发布之前就完全停止 Factor Man 的活动更有吸引力。

Eliminating Factor Man after the first release might give one American multinational a competitive advantage over the others, but that was of little concern to us because most such corporations had interests fairly well aligned with those of China. Of course, putting a halt to Factor Man’s activities before the code was released at all was more attractive still.

因此，第四部门给我的指示发生了变化。赵将军不再试图获取这项技术，而是命令我用尽一切办法将其销毁。如果可能的话，我必须在 Factor Man 拍卖结束前完成这一任务，这意味着我还有一周的时间。

My instructions from the Fourth Department therefore changed. Instead of attempting to acquire the technology, General Zhao ordered me to use whatever methods were necessary to destroy it. I was to achieve this before the Factor Man auction concluded if at all possible, which meant that I had one week left.

维也纳视频中的 12,377 个潜在匹配对象均经过了三次独立评估。其中一人在三次评估中均被视为可行，另外两人在其中两次评估中被视为可行。

The 12,377 potential matches for the Vienna video had each been evaluated independently three times. One individual was considered a viable possibility under all three evaluations, and two others were considered viable under two of them.

三人中有一名叫约翰·金德的计算机科学家。他毕业于斯坦福大学，目前在西雅图的一家初创公司工作。金德被一名调查员排除在外，因为他鼻梁上的一小颗痣没有出现在维也纳的视频中。痣可以用化妆品来掩盖，所以我决定把他列入现役名单。

One of the three was a computer scientist named John Kind. He had been educated at Stanford but currently worked for a startup in Seattle. Kind had been eliminated by one of the investigators because a small mole on the bridge of his nose did not appear in the Vienna video. Moles can be hidden with makeup, and I decided to place him on the active list.

第二位是卡内基梅隆大学的研究生安东尼·穆拉科。穆拉科是复杂性理论家史蒂文·鲁迪奇的学生。拍摄视频时，他正和妻子在欧洲旅行。

The second was a Carnegie Mellon graduate student named Anthony Muraco. Muraco was a student of complexity theorist Steven Rudich. He had been traveling with his wife in Europe at the time the video was taken.

其中一名调查人员指出，虽然 Muraco 很可能就是维也纳视频中的角色，但同一天在巴黎，他妻子的信用卡上有一笔餐厅费用。查看餐厅记录后发现，Muraco 夫人当时只和一位同伴一起就餐，查看餐厅外的监控录像后确认，那位同伴就是她的丈夫。Muraco 被从名单中除名。

One of the investigators had noted that while Muraco might well have been the character in the Vienna video, there was a restaurant charge to his wife’s credit card on the same day in Paris. An examination of the restaurant’s records indicated that Mrs. Muraco had been dining with a single companion, and an examination of security video from outside the restaurant confirmed that the companion had been her husband. Muraco was removed from the list.

最后一种可能性有点离奇，那就是住在迈阿密郊外的一位 50 岁高科技企业家，名叫戴尔·米勒。他师从加州大学洛杉矶分校计算机科学家里奇·科尔夫，获得了博士学位，科尔夫的研究领域是与复杂性理论和算法开发相关的人工智能。

The final possibility was something of an outlier, a fifty-year-old high-tech entrepreneur named Dale Miller who lived outside of Miami. He had gotten a Ph.D. under UCLA computer scientist Rich Korf, who worked in an area of artificial intelligence related to complexity theory and algorithm development.

我觉得 Kind 是级别较低的员工，因此更容易成为攻击目标。因此，如果我从 Miller 开始，我的时间安排会更加可预测，而且我计划了一次佛罗里达之旅。

I felt that Kind, as a lower level employee, would likely be the easier target. My timing would therefore be more predictable if I started with Miller, and I planned a trip to Florida.

* * *

* * *

我对米勒的调查显示，他是美国一切丑陋的典型代表。他最近刚离婚，陷入了似乎永远存在的中年危机，他开着一辆鲜红色的法拉利，而且驾驶技术很差。他住在一栋大得离谱的房子里，周围都是其他大得离谱的房子，每栋房子与最近的邻居之间的距离不超过六米。

My investigation of Miller showed him to be a paradigmatic example of everything ugly about America. Recently divorced and mired in what appeared to be a permanent midlife crisis, he drove a bright red Ferrari, and drove it poorly. He lived in an absurdly large house surrounded by other absurdly large houses, each no more than six meters from its nearest neighbor.

我把我那辆不起眼的租来的车停在他家附近的拐角处，等他下班回家。等他下班回家后，我又开车回到拐角处告诉他我迷路了，想找几个街区外的地址。他似乎很乐意帮忙。

I parked my nondescript rental car around the corner from his house and waited for him to return from work. When he did, I drove back around the corner and told him I was lost, trying to find an address a couple of blocks away. He seemed only too glad to help.

我似乎是第一次注意到他的车。“车开得不错，”我告诉他。

I appeared to notice his car for the first time. “Nice ride,” I told him.

他回以微笑。“非常好。”

He grinned back. “The nicest.”

我看着那辆法拉利，显然想看看它，但似乎不知道该说些什么。

I looked at the Ferrari, clearly wanting to check it out but seeming not to know what to say.

“我告诉你，”他最后说道。“我很乐意送你去你朋友家。你可以把车停在这里，等你准备好让我来接你的时候再给我发短信。”

“I’ll tell you what,” he finally said. “I’ll be happy to run you over to your friend’s house. You can leave your car here and shoot me a text when you’re ready for me to pick you up.”

我接受了，正是法拉利的操控性能让我们能够在前往我提供的地址的途中尽可能多地转弯。

I accepted, and it was only the Ferrari’s handling that kept us on the road as we took as many corners as possible en route to the address I had provided.

“我告诉你，”我把一只手放在他的手上说道，“你现在想回你家吗？一个小时左右我的朋友肯定还会在那里。”

“I’ll tell you what,” I said, placing one of my hands on one of his. “How would you feel about going back to your place now? My friend will surely still be there in an hour or so.”

我们回到了千篇一律的豪宅。我非常想开车，这个要求毫无疑问会被满足。但我不能让自己把车开坏，最终的结果只会让过于热情的米勒先生感到尴尬。

We returned to the cookie-cutter mansion. I wanted badly to drive, a request that would undoubtedly have been granted. But I could not bring myself to mishandle the car, and the end result would only have been to embarrass the overenthusiastic Mr. Miller.

最后，我花的时间比建议的时间少了很多。米勒一直傻笑着，直到我用手搂住他的脖子。

In the end, I spent significantly less than the suggested hour. Miller grinned clownishly throughout, right up to the point that I wrapped my hands around his neck.

我的基本任务完成了，我清除了所有可能留下的指纹，包括法拉利上的指纹，并在后屋找到了米勒的电脑。电脑没有密码保护，所以我只是将内容复制到闪存盘上，然后删除了硬盘。

My basic mission complete, I removed any potential fingerprints from the surfaces I had touched, including those in the Ferrari, and found Miller’s computer in a back room. It was not password protected, so I simply copied the contents to a flash disk and erased the hard drive.

* * *

* * *

Kind 确实比较容易，但也困难得多。

Kind was indeed easier, but also far more difficult.

我从迈阿密开车到坦帕，然后飞到俄勒冈州的波特兰，用了各种假名，这些假名我都能识别。然后我开车去了西雅图，在那里我发现 Kind 和他的妻子以及两个年幼的孩子住在贝尔维尤郊外的一所简朴的房子里。我是周五到达的，周六他的妻子谢天谢地把孩子们带出去了，他们都笑着去公园或其他娱乐场所。

I drove from Miami to Tampa and then flew to Portland, Oregon using one of a variety of pseudonyms for which I had suitable identification. I then drove to Seattle, where I found that Kind lived in a modest home outside of Bellevue with his wife and two young children. I arrived on a Friday, and on Saturday his wife thankfully took the children out, all of them laughing as they headed to a park or some other enjoyment.

我敲了敲门，按铃似乎有点不合时宜。金德毫无戒备地开了门。他三十五六岁，当然身高和米勒差不多。看上去很健壮。小小的入口处有一张桌子，上面摆放着几张家庭照片。

I knocked on the door; the bell somehow seemed inappropriate. Kind answered, unsuspicious. He was in his mid-thirties and approximately the same height as Miller had been, of course. Athletic looking. The small entryway included a table with a handful of family photographs.

我看着他的一只眼睛，然后朝他的另一只眼睛开了一枪。他的家人会找到他，但我几乎无法阻止这种情况发生。我拿走了连接到 Kind 电脑的备份驱动器，并删除了他的硬盘。

I looked him in one eye and shot him in the other. His family would find him, but there was little I could do to avoid that. I took the backup drive connected to Kind’s computer and erased his hard disk as well.

由于需要向上级汇报，我返回了波特兰，并以 Janet Liu 的身份回国。

Needing to report to my superiors, I returned to Portland and, as Janet Liu, returned home.

在飞越太平洋的长途飞行中，我不得不怀疑。我杀了 Factor Man 了吗？也许吧。他的代码是否保存在我随身行李中的硬盘上？也许吧。如果是这样，其他副本现在都不见了吗？也有可能。

On the long flight over the Pacific, I had to wonder. Had I killed Factor Man? Perhaps. Was his code on a hard drive in my carryon? Perhaps. If so, were the other copies now gone? Also perhaps.

但已经有两人死亡。中国现在拥有唯一一份因子人密码的可能性当然不是零，但也非常小。

But two men had died. The chances that China now had the only copy of the Factor Man code were surely not zero, but they were at best modest.

中国的需求是最重要的，如果可以回到我登上飞往迈阿密的航班的前一天，我的行为不会改变。但有时，感觉中国毕竟没有那么有耐心。

China’s needs are paramount; if it were possible to return to the day before I got on the flight to Miami, my actions would be unchanged. But sometimes, it feels that China is not so patient after all.

14

14

Factor Man 博客

The Factor Man blog

2019 年 7 月 8 日

July 8, 2019

该项技术的许可竞标现已开始。

Bidding for a license to this technology is now open.

有 40 家公司符合资格，排名第二的出价目前为 1,370 亿美元。

There are 40 qualified bidders. The second-place bid is currently $137 billion.

竞标将在两天内结束。

Bidding will close in two days.

十四家潜在投标人的投标资格被拒绝。大多数投标人都相当乐意接受这一决定，但有两家却没有。

Qualification has been denied to fourteen potential bidders. Most of them have accepted this decision with reasonable grace, but two have not.

阿里巴巴集团是一家中国公司，因此，它大概是中国政府的托儿。我与中国政府的关系是众所周知的，如果中国政府抢在中国人民之前获得我的技术，这显然不符合我的利益，更不用说符合美国人民的利益了。

The Alibaba Group is a Chinese corporation and, as such, is presumably a shill for the Chinese government. The nature of my relationship with the Chinese government is well known, and it is clearly not in my interests, let alone those of the American people, for the Chinese government to have access to my technology before the people of China do as well.

Facebook 也曾直言不讳地表达了对被取消资格的不满。我只是指出，无论 Facebook 为世界提供了什么价值，都很难说他们是个人隐私事业的捍卫者。我在一篇相对较早的帖子中明确表示，捍卫隐私利益的历史是获得资格的先决条件。

Facebook has also been quite vocal about its displeasure at being disqualified. I simply point out that whatever value Facebook has provided to the world, it would hardly be appropriate to describe them as championing the cause of individual privacy. I made clear in a relatively early post that a history of defending the interests of privacy was a prerequisite to qualification.

该网站已被访问 236,298,155,214 次。

This web site has been visited 236,298,155,214 times.

伯克特

Burkett

2019年7月10日

July 10,2019

电力价格

The price of power

威廉·伯克特，《纽约时报》

William Burkett, The New York Times

Factor Man 拍卖会现已结束。最终有 41 家符合条件的竞标者，最终价格为 1470 亿美元。苹果是获胜者，人们普遍认为微软或谷歌位居第二。

The Factor Man auction is now over. In the end, there were forty-one qualified bidders, and the final price was $147 billion. Apple was the winning bidder, and it is generally assumed that Microsoft or Google was second.

中标结果公布后，苹果股价略有下跌，但随后华尔街意识到，1470 亿美元中至少有 15%（约 220 亿美元）将重新投资于苹果股票。由于苹果可以发行这些股票而无需实际支付，因此净价更像是 1250 亿美元的实际现金。苹果股价反弹至接近今年的最高点。

Apple’s price dropped slightly after the winning bid was revealed, but then the Street realized that at least 15% of the $147 billion – some $22 billion – would essentially be reinvested in Apple stock. Since Apple could issue this stock without actually paying for it, the net price was more like $125 billion in actual cash. Apple stock rebounded to near its highs for the year.

Factor Man 要求公开许可条款，而 Hasday 的起草能力也显而易见。该文件的语言非常接近通俗易懂的英语，但得到了众多律师的证实，是无懈可击的。

Factor Man required that the terms of the license be made public, and Hasday’s skills as a draftsman have been apparent. The document is written in something remarkably close to plain English, but has been confirmed by a wide range of attorneys as being bullet proof.

该许可证有效期为两年，自 Apple 赢得拍卖之日起算。第一年是独家许可证，但 Factor Man 本人保留使用或修改软件的权利。最初的一年期之后是与美国政府共同独家的第二年。此后，代码将可能属于公共领域，无需许可证。Apple 在任何情况下都不得与任何第三方共享代码。它还必须向 Factor Man 提供代码所有用途的描述；如果 Factor Man 认为代码不符合隐私或美国公民的利益，则有仲裁程序来决定谁对谁错。除非得到 Factor Man 或仲裁员的批准，否则任何应用程序都不能提交甚至开发。

The license is for a two-year period beginning on the day that Apple won the auction. It is exclusive for the first year, although Factor Man himself retains the right to use or modify the software. The initial one-year period is followed by a second year of co-exclusivity with the United States government. After this, the code will presumably be in the public domain and no license will be needed. Apple is not permitted to share the code with any third party under any circumstances. It is also required to provide Factor Man with a description of all of the uses to which the code is being put; in the event that Factor Man feels that the code is not serving the interests of either privacy or the citizens of the United States, an arbitration procedure exists to decide who is right. No application can be fielded or even developed unless either Factor Man or the arbitrators approve.

人们普遍认为，苹果将立即购买价值 1250 亿美元的非苹果股票，以避免两年后这些股票价格上涨的风险，届时这些股票必须转让给 Factor Man。许可协议规定，要转让的股票包括标准普尔 500 指数中所有 500 只股票的股份，数量与每家公司的当前市值成比例。股息（每年将超过 20 亿美元）将以类似的方式再投资。

It is generally assumed that Apple will purchase the $125 billion of non-Apple stock immediately, so as to avoid being exposed to the risk of that stock being more expensive two years from now, when the stock must be transferred to Factor Man. The license agreement specifies that the stock to be transferred consist of shares of all 500 stocks in the S&P 500 index, in amounts proportional to the current capitalization of each of those companies. Dividends (which will amount to over $2 billion annually) are to be reinvested on a similar basis.

在 Factor Man 出面派对（现称为 FCOP）当天，苹果公司将把所有股票的所有权转让给被认定为 Factor Man 的个人。有关 Factor Man 身份的任何争议都将通过 Duane Morris 已经拥有的文件解决。

On the day of the Factor Man Coming Out Party, which is now universally known as FCOP, Apple is to transfer ownership of all of the stock to the individual identified as Factor Man. Any dispute over Factor Man’s identity is to be resolved by documents already in the possession of Duane Morris.

最后，苹果必须在许可期限内保留至少 500 亿美元现金，并且不得采取任何可能合理预期会导致破产风险的行动。

Finally, Apple is required to retain at least $50 billion in cash for the duration of the license, and not to take any actions that could reasonably be expected to risk bankruptcy.

法律界普遍认为，该文件本身保证了 Factor Man 最终会得到报酬，许可证不会危及他在 FCOP 之前的身份保密性，也许最重要的是，Factor Man 本人在有财力支付之前不会欠所涉股票的所得税。到那时，他大概会以相当大的优势成为世界上最富有的人。

The general legal consensus is that the document itself guarantees that Factor Man will eventually be paid, that the license will not jeopardize the secrecy of his identity prior to FCOP and, perhaps most importantly, that Factor Man himself will not owe income taxes on the stock in question until he has the resources to pay them. At that point, he will presumably be the richest man in the world by a considerable margin.

关于 Factor Man 是否有合伙人，人们的猜测很多。没人知道。但如果他有合伙人，那么他们很可能会和他一起跻身世界富豪榜。

Speculation is rampant over the question of whether Factor Man has any partners. No one has a clue. But if he does, they are likely to join him on the list of the world’s richest people.

Factor Man 明确表示，许可条款不容商议，而 Apple 也未尝试进行谈判。在许可条款达成一致后的 48 小时内，标准普尔 500 指数的股票购买压力推动该指数上涨近 5%。一天后，Apple 宣布该代码已作为来自 factorman0 Gmail 帐户的电子邮件的加密附件收到，解密密钥是 Apple CEO 的密码。Apple 解密了该消息并报告说它看起来与 Factor Man 描述的一样。

Factor Man had made it clear that the terms of the license were not negotiable, and Apple did not try to negotiate. Buying pressure on the stocks in the S&P 500 pushed the index up by almost 5% within 48 hours of the license terms being agreed. A day later, Apple announced that the code had been received as an encrypted attachment to an email from the factorman0 Gmail account, with the decryption key being the password of the Apple CEO. Apple decrypted the message and reported that it appeared to be as Factor Man had described it.

苹果还描述了他们将采取的特别措施，以确保代码不会“泄露”。首先，任何能够访问 Factor Man 代码的苹果机器都将是从未连接到互联网的机器。

Apple also described the extraordinary measures that they will be taking to ensure that the code does not get “out”. For a start, any Apple machine with access to the Factor Man code will be a machine that has never been connected to the Internet.

当 Apple 想要向 Factor Man 代码提出问题时，问题将被放到一个新的 U 盘上，并手动加载到 Factor Man 机器上。然后，U 盘将被销毁。Factor Man 代码提供的答案将被加载到新的 U 盘上，并返回到“普通”计算机进行分析和评估。Factor Man 机器大概位于 Apple 庞大的 Sunnyvale 工厂的某个地方，但只有少数人知道其实际位置。U 盘将通过一个称为“气闸室”的特殊房间在机器之间传输，少数值得信赖的员工将在那里收集或存放相关 U 盘，并将它们移至 Factor Man 计算机的位置或从其位置移出。甚至处理传输的员工的身份也是严格保密的。

When Apple wants to give a problem to the Factor Man code, the problem will be put on a new thumb drive and loaded onto the Factor Man machines by hand. The thumb drive will then be destroyed. The answer provided by the Factor Man code will be loaded onto a fresh thumb drive and returned to a “normal” computer for analysis and evaluation. The Factor Man machines are presumably somewhere in Apple’s massive Sunnyvale facility, but the actual location is known only to a small handful of individuals. The thumb drives will be transferred to and from the machines using a special room known as the Airlock, where a handful of trusted employees will gather or deposit the thumb drives in question and move them to or from the location of the Factor Man computers. Even the identities of the employees handling the transfers are a closely guarded secret.

15

15

因子人

Factor Man

2019 年 7 月 11 日

July 11, 2019

发件人：Factor Man (factor.man@yandex.com)

From: Factor Man (factor.man@yandex.com)

收件人：Brian Finn (finnbrian@gmail.com)

To: Brian Finn (finnbrian@gmail.com)

主题：交易

Subject: transaction

亲爱的布莱恩：

Dear Brian:

我给你定的分红是 73.5 亿美元。回报率还不错。谢谢你按照我们约定的时间表把钱转入瑞士账户。请通知银行，我很快就会把钱取出来。

I make your cut to be $7.35B. Not a bad rate of return. Thank you for transfering the money into the Swiss account according to the schedule that we had agreed. Please let the bank know that I will be withdrawing it shortly.

谢谢。我很荣幸，希望几年后能再次见到你。

Thanks. This has been a pleasure, and I’ll look forward to seeing you in a couple of years.

调频

FM

我想，最艰难的部分已经过去了。丹尼斯和我飞往开曼群岛，待了一个星期。

The hard part was over, I figured. Denise and I flew to the Cayman Islands for a week.

正式来说，我们去潜水是为了潜水，开曼群岛的潜水体验和西半球其他地方一样好。开曼群岛以潜水闻名。我们早上和蝠鲼一起潜水，下午在泳池边喝着清凉的饮料。（世界上的早上潜水效果最好，因为白天的洋流会搅动水面，降低能见度。）

Officially, we went for the diving, which is as good in the Caymans as anywhere else in the western hemisphere. The Caymans are known for it. We dove with manta rays in the mornings and drank cool drinks by the pool in the afternoons. (Diving is better in the mornings worldwide, before the day’s currents stir up the water and reduce visibility.)

我们坐头等舱是因为我们买了头等舱机票，而不是因为航空公司决定给我们升舱。我们住在 Le Soleil d'Or 的一间“浪漫小屋”里，这是一家位于海滩边的五星级酒店。泳池和清凉饮料都是我们独享的。又有两位富裕的美国游客来到了天堂。

We flew first class because we bought first class tickets, not because the airlines decided to upgrade us. We stayed in a one-room “romantic cottage” at Le Soleil d’Or, a five-star hotel right on the beach. The pool with the cool drinks was ours alone. Two more well-to-do American tourists in paradise.

开曼群岛还以其银行系统的保密性和律师的优秀而闻名。一天下午，我没有喝冷饮，而是让酒店司机蒂莫西带我去见迪克森开曼的詹姆斯特拉斯克律师，他是酒店礼宾部（和互联网）推荐的律师。

The Caymans are also known for the privacy of their banking system and the excellence of their lawyers. On one of the afternoons, I did without the cool drinks and asked Timothy, the hotel chauffeur, to take me to James Trask of Dixon Cayman, the lawyer the hotel concierge (and the Internet) had recommended.

特拉斯克先生是英国人，他从开曼群岛来到开曼群岛，在一间豪华的办公室里与我会面。我解释说，我需要将资金从瑞士银行账户转到我个人账户。这些资金是干净的，虽然我不需要完全匿名，但一定程度的谨慎是必不可少的。我并不反对在资金到达时在美国缴纳所得税；我只是希望很难甚至不可能将这笔钱追溯到最初的瑞士账户。我的预期是，我现在将涉案的 2400 万美元转移到开曼群岛，然后逐渐提取这笔钱；我的口味相当温和。

Mr. Trask, a British export to the Caymans, met me in a luxuriously appointed office and I explained that I needed to move funds from a Swiss bank account to me personally. The funds were clean and while I didn’t need complete anonymity, some measure of discretion was essential. I had no objection to paying income tax in the United States as the money arrived; I simply wanted it to be difficult to impossible to trace the money back to the original Swiss account. My expectation was that I would move the $24M in question to the Caymans now, but then withdraw the money only gradually; my tastes were fairly modest.

特拉斯克成立了两家空壳公司。在这两起案件中，他都是主要联系人。开曼群岛豪华房地产开发公司（CILRED）是第一家，我拥有该公司的秘密控制权。这将是目前在瑞士的资金的初始存款点。特拉斯克称 CILRED 为“隐藏”公司。

Trask set up two shell companies. In both cases, he was the main point of contact. Cayman Island Luxury Real Estate and Development (CILRED) was the first, and I had a silent but controlling interest in it. It would be the initial point of deposit for the funds that were currently in Switzerland. Trask called CILRED the “hidden” company.

国际进出口咨询服务公司 (IEICS) 是第二家（根据 Trask 的说法，也是“可见的”）公司。IEICS 签约为 CILRED 提供咨询服务。IEICS 与我签约提供这些服务，该公司完全由 Trask 所有。

International Export and Import Consulting Services (IEICS) was the second (and, according to Trask, “visible”) company. IEICS contracted to provide CILRED with consulting services. IEICS contracted with me to provide those services, and it was owned entirely by Trask.

只要我需要，可见公司 IEICS 就会向隐藏公司 CILRED 发送账单。CILRED 会支付账单，Trask 会保留 3%，余额将作为我名义上向 IEICS 提供的服务的报酬支付给我。

Any time I wanted, the visible company IEICS would send the hidden company CILRED a bill. CILRED would pay the bill, Trask would keep 3%, and the balance would be paid to me for the services I had notionally provided to IEICS.

它干净、合法而且安全。

It was clean, it was legal, and it was safe.

说它干净，是因为瑞士账户中的资金（这些资金很快就会被转入隐藏的 CILRED）本身就是干净的。它们不是南美毒枭存入的可疑现金，而是 Brian Finn 存入的干净资金。

It was clean because the funds in the Swiss account, which would shortly be transferred to the hidden CILRED, were themselves clean. They weren’t some shady cash deposit made by a South American drug kingpin; they were a clean deposit made by Brian Finn.

这是合法的，因为可见的 IEICS 可以向 CILRED 收取任何咨询服务费用，而我也可以向 IEICS 收取任何我想要的费用。CILRED 和 IEICS 均不对除其股东以外的任何人承担法律责任，而 Trask 和我都不会抱怨。

It was legal because the visible IEICS could charge CILRED whatever it wanted for consulting services, and I could charge IEICS whatever I wanted. CILRED and IEICS both had no legal responsibilities to anyone other than their shareholders, and neither Trask nor I was about to complain.

而且很安全。我不受公众的监视，因为虽然我的纳税申报单和其他文件会显示来自可见的 IEICS 的收入，但无法通过 Trask 追溯到隐藏的 CILRED。Trask 拥有 IEICS，任何调查都到此为止。确实，当钱从 CILRED 转移到 IEICS 再到我时，Trask 会控制这笔钱，但如果他未能完成转移，交易就会失败，他（显然）会失去剩余资金的 3% 佣金。所以我也不受 Trask 的监视。即使一切都失败了，这两家公司也只能找到原始瑞士银行账户和 Brian Finn。人们可能会想知道 Finn 为什么决定给我 2400 万美元的礼物，但如果我们真的需要，我们可以过桥。

And it was safe. I was protected from the public because while my tax returns and other documents would show income from the visible IEICS, there was no way to trace the money back through Trask to the hidden CILRED. Trask owned IEICS, and any inquiries would simply end there. It was true that Trask would have control of the money as it passed from CILRED to IEICS to me, but if he failed to complete the transfer, the deal would fall apart and he would (obviously) lose his 3% commission on any remaining funds. So I was safe from Trask as well. And even if everything did fall apart, both of the companies could lead no further than to the original Swiss bank account and to Brian Finn. People might wonder why Finn had decided to make me a gift of $24 million, but we could cross that bridge if we ever came to it.

整个安排也只能持续两年。之后，我的身份就会广为人知，而特拉斯克会……感到惊讶。

The whole arrangement also had to last only two years. After that, my identity would be well known and Trask would be, well … surprised.

一切准备就绪大概花了一个小时。特拉斯克问我要向 CILRED 转账多少资金来启动项目，我告诉他 500 万美元。他让我签署了一份授权转账的表格，然后离开了几分钟。当他回来时，他告诉我一切都完成了。

Setting everything up took maybe an hour. Trask asked me how much I wanted to transfer to CILRED to get things started, and I told him $5 million. He had me sign a form authorizing the transfer and stepped away for a few minutes. When he returned, he told me everything was complete.

* * *

* * *

现在，我应该在这里解释一些事情。

Now, there are some things I should probably explain here.

我并不富有。

I’m not rich.

我并不出名。

I’m not famous.

我沒有强大力量。

I’m not powerful.

我是一名计算机科学家，我很擅长计算机。我知道如何解决一些困难的事情。我知道如何利用这一点——我希望如此！但这就是全部了。

I’m a computer scientist, and I’m good at it. I figured out how to do something hard. I figured out – I hope! – how to capitalize on that. But that’s sort of it.

我看着特拉斯克，说实话，我不知道该怎么问下一个问题。“我可以……试试吗？”这是我最后能想到的最好的答案。

I looked at Trask and, in all honesty, I didn’t know how to ask the next question. “Can I … try it?” was the best I eventually produced.

“当然了，”他回答道。“多少钱？”

“Of course,” was the answer. “How much?”

我告诉他是五十万。

I told him half a million.

“很好。请您在此等候。”

“Very good. Please wait here.”

特拉斯克又走了几分钟，回来时带回了两张账单和一张电汇指示单。一张账单是 IEICS 开给 CILRED 的，金额为 515,000 美元，即 50 万美元加上特拉斯克的 3%。另一张账单是我开给 IEICS 的，金额为 500,000 美元。电汇指示是为了让 IEICS 知道将资金汇往何处。我填写了我在家乡银行的账户信息，然后将所有文件交还给特拉斯克。

Trask was gone for a few more minutes, and came back with two bills and a wire instruction sheet. One bill was from IEICS to CILRED and was for $515,000, the half million plus Trask’s 3%. The other bill was from me to IEICS for $500,000. The wire instructions were so that IEICS knew where to send the funds. I filled them in with account information for my bank back home, and handed all the paperwork back to Trask.

“太好了，”他说，“大约一小时后，你就能在你的账户上看到资金了。”他站了起来。我过了一会儿才意识到，我们已经完成了。

“Excellent,” he said. “You should see the funds in your account in about an hour.” He stood. It took me a moment to realize it, but we were done.

我有些无语地离开了。不到一个小时，我的手机就响了，银行给我发了一封电子邮件，说我收到了来自开曼群岛国际进出口咨询服务公司的 50 万美元电汇。

I left, somewhat speechless. In just under an hour, my phone buzzed as my bank sent me an email, indicating that a wire for $500,000 had been received from International Export and Import Consulting Services in the Cayman Islands.

丹尼斯和我两年内有 2,400 万美元可以花。我想我们可能可以应付过去。

Denise and I had $24 million to spend over two years. I figured we could probably get by.

哈德森

Hudson

2019 年 7 月 11 日

July 11, 2019

Factor Man 拍卖结束的那天，有人告诉我，我大概有两周的时间去寻找他。人们预计，在与苹果的交易完成后，他基本上会完全消失，至少一年内不会再出现。如果没有新数据，这个案子就会不了了之。但不管是否了了之，我们对找到他的兴趣都不会减弱：Factor Man 知道太多重要的事情，调查局不能不知道他是谁、在哪里。

The day the Factor Man auction ended, I was told I probably had two weeks to find him. The expectation was that he would basically go completely dark after the transaction with Apple was complete, not to reappear for at least a year. With no new data, the case would be cold. But cold or not, our interest in finding him would be unabated: Factor Man knew too much that was too important for the Bureau to be comfortable not knowing who and where he was.

我掌握的信息不多。我手上有威廉·伯克特，他不肯合作，而且似乎什么都不知道。我手上有罗伯特·哈斯戴，他更不肯合作，而且可能知道的并不比伯克特多。而且，如果中国人的话可信的话，我有一张 Factor Man 鼻子的照片。

I didn’t have much. I had William Burkett, who was not cooperative and appeared to know virtually nothing in any case. I had Robert Hasday, who was even less cooperative and probably didn’t know much more than Burkett. And, if the Chinese were to be believed, I had a picture of Factor Man’s nose.

我认为鼻子可能是我最好的线索。

I figured that the nose was probably my best lead.

我们尝试直接寻找鼻子。我们在护照和飞机上寻找。我们尝试过驾驶执照和安全摄像头录像。

We tried just looking for the nose straight up. We looked for it in passports, and on airplanes. We tried driver’s licenses and security camera footage.

我们找到了。问题是我们发现了很多。结果表明，大约每 5,000 人中就有 1 人的鼻子与 Factor Man 的鼻子几乎没有区别。

And we found it. The problem is that we found it a lot. It turned out that about one person in 5,000 had a nose pretty much indistinguishable from Factor Man’s.

所以我决定减少检查次数。我不再查看所有信息，而是只查看警方报告，FBI 的技术人员会自动扫描这些报告，寻找可能匹配的鼻子。

So I decided to scale back. Instead of looking at everything, I just looked at police reports, with the kind FBI technical folks automatically scanning them for noses that might match.

大多数匹配都是面部照片，我很快就决定这些照片没什么意思。Factor Man 似乎不太可能被捕；他太小心了。但也许他会以其他方式触犯法律。

Most of the matches were mug shots, and I decided fairly quickly that those weren’t so interesting. Factor Man didn’t seem likely to get arrested; he was too careful for that. But maybe he’d bump into the legal system in some other way.

我通常每天能拍到一两件。但拍卖结束后的第二天，我就拍到了三件。

I generally got a hit or two a day. But the day after the auction ended, I got three.

第一份是阿肯色州的失踪人口报告。我正坐在办公桌前，犹豫着要不要关注，这时另外两份报告进来了。

The first one was a missing person report in Arkansas. I was sitting at my desk, trying to decide if I cared, when the other two came in.

我想我可能最终会决定我不在乎。时机确实很有趣，但我无法想象 Factor Man 会在事情似乎对他有利的时候突然消失。

I think I was probably going to wind up deciding I didn’t care. The timing was certainly interesting, but I couldn’t imagine that Factor Man would up and disappear just as things seemed to be working out for him.

检查一下。我无法想象他会突然消失，并引发失踪人口报告。再说一次，他太小心了。

Check that. I couldn’t imagine that he’d up and disappear in a way that would generate a missing person report. Again, he was just too careful.

无论如何，其他两份报告让我忘记了第一份。两起谋杀案都发生在私人住宅中，而且都没有明显的抢劫动机。佛罗里达和华盛顿相隔一个大陆，但只相隔一天。两起谋杀案都发生在 Factor Man 拍卖结束之前。

The other two reports put the first one out of my mind in any case. Two murders, both in private residences and both without any apparent robbery motive. Florida and Washington, a continent away from each other but separated by only a day. Both occurred just before the Factor Man auction concluded.

我请迈阿密和西雅图的当地特工从当地警察局获取文件并发送给他们。他们照做了，我仔细阅读了这些文件。

I asked agents local to Miami and Seattle to get the files from the local police departments and send them over. They did, and I read through them.

两名受害者被杀时都在家中。戴尔·米勒被勒死在沙发上。约翰·金德站在门口时脸部中枪。金德的家人悲痛欲绝，他们报告说似乎没有丢失任何东西。米勒没有家人，但也没有明显的抢劫动机。他的钱包里有 200 多美元，高端家庭娱乐系统完好无损。法拉利的钥匙放在他的床头柜上。

Both victims had been at home when they had been killed. Dale Miller had been strangled on his couch. John Kind had been shot in the face, standing in his doorway. Kind’s family, justifiably distraught, reported that nothing appeared to be missing. Miller had no family but there was no obvious robbery motive there, either. His wallet contained over $200 and a high-end home entertainment system was untouched. Keys to a Ferrari were on his nightstand.

这两起谋杀案都是新近发生的，档案也才刚刚开始。有尸体的照片；米勒的尸体状况相当好。金德似乎是被枪击中了脸部一侧，而鼻子——促使我收到档案的那个鼻子——仍然清晰可见。一些照片重点关注死亡原因；其他照片则展示了尸体被发现时的完整样子。还有其他一些事情，但我说不出来。

The murders were both fresh, and the files only just getting started. There were photos of the bodies; Miller’s was in pretty good shape. Kind appeared to have been shot on the side of his face, and the nose, which had triggered my receiving the file at all, was still visible. Some of the photos focused on the cause of death; others showed the bodies in their entirety as they had been found. There was something more, but I couldn’t place it.

不管怎样，没有理由相信它们有任何联系，无论是与 Factor Man 还是彼此之间。我把文件夹放在一边。

More or not, there was no reason to believe they were connected, either to Factor Man or to each other. I set the folders aside.

在过去异常令人沮丧的十二个月里，Factor Man 一直是我唯一的案子。政府希望找到他，但很容易同情这个人。他在中国发生的事情上当然得到了我的支持。但我的老板说要找到他，所以我会找到他。

Factor Man had been my only case for what had been an exceptionally frustrating twelve months. The government wanted him found, but it was easy to sympathize with the guy. He certainly had my vote on what had happened with China. But my bosses said find him, so I would find him.

也许明天吧。我回到公寓，用微波炉加热了一些剩菜，一边喝着几杯啤酒，一边看着红袜队大胜洋基队。他们真棒。比赛结束了，我上床睡觉了。

Maybe tomorrow. I went back to my apartment, heated up some leftovers in the microwave, and drank a couple of beers while watching the Red Sox pound the Yankees. Good for them. The game ended and I hit the sack.

* * *

* * *

你的潜意识在你睡觉时能发挥的作用真是令人惊叹。第二天早上我精神饱满地醒来，意识到这两起谋杀案让我困扰的是什么。拿出文件后，我从尸体周围看到，两名受害者的身高和体重大致相同。我估计他们大概是六英尺高，190 磅。

It’s amazing the work your subconscious can do while you’re sleeping. I woke up fresh the next morning and realized what had been bothering me about the two murders. Pulling the files out, I could see from the bodies’ surroundings that the two victims were about the same height and weight. I made them maybe six feet tall and 190.

我知道戴尔·米勒是某个互联网大亨，而谋杀案档案上说约翰·金德是一家互联网初创公司的程序员，负责信用分析。

I knew that Dale Miller was some sort of Internet fat cat, and the murder file said that John Kind was a programmer for an Internet startup that did credit analysis.

两名计算机科学家被谋杀。他们的身高和体重大致相同。他们的鼻子也一样。他们都被残忍地杀害，没有明显的动机。

Two computer scientists had been murdered. They were the same height and weight, give or take. They had the same nose. They were both killed in cold blood with no apparent motive.

有人刚刚试图除掉 Factor Man。

Someone had just tried to take out Factor Man.

* * *

* * *

取决于说话的人，联邦调查局是一群勤奋、有创造力、热爱国家的公民，或者是一群渴望权力的政府雇员。事实是，这两种人都相当多，这并不奇怪。

Depending on who’s talking, the FBI is a bunch of hard-working, reasonably inventive citizens working for love of country, or a bunch of power-hungry cardboard government employees. The truth, not surprisingly, is that we’ve got both types in reasonable abundance.

我在纽约市工作，最初接到 Factor Man 的任务是因为 William Burkett 也在纽约工作。当 Burkett 的名字出现时，我恰好是可用的经纪人，并且高层认为他值得一试。然后 Hasday 的名字也出现了，Factor Man 很快就成了我唯一的职责。

I work out of New York City, and had originally drawn the Factor Man assignment because William Burkett works out of New York, too. I just happened to be the agent available when Burkett’s name came up and someone high up in the food chain decided he was worth a look. Then Hasday’s name came up as well, and Factor Man rapidly became my only responsibility.

我在这项工作中的搭档是一位名叫罗恩·利文斯通的特工。利文斯通和我相处得很好，我们过去一起处理过很多案件，通常都很成功。但他绝对是街头的硬汉。我愿意相信我不是那样的人。

My partner in this work has generally been a Special Agent named Ron Livingstone. Livingstone and I get along fine, and we’ve worked a bunch of cases together in the past, generally successfully. But he’s definitely from the cardboard side of the street. I like to believe I’m not like that.

现在，利文斯通正在做另一件事，一个似乎很适合他的白领会计骗局。我的老板，助理特别探员主管詹妮弗·威利斯 (Jennifer Willis) 给了我相当大的自由，让我可以做任何我认为可以帮助弄清楚 Factor Man 真正身份的事情。令人惊讶的是，这种自由包括旅行。我不必总是向另一个司法管辖区的探员寻求帮助，而是可以亲自前往那里。当然，前提是我告诉当地的特别探员我在做什么。官僚机构就是官僚机构，地盘就是地盘。

Right now, Livingstone was working something else, a white collar accounting scam that appeared to be right up his alley. My boss, ASAC (Assistant Special Agent in Charge) Jennifer Willis, had given me a considerable amount of leeway in whatever I thought might help figure out who Factor Man really was. Surprisingly, that leeway included travel. Instead of always asking for help from an agent in another jurisdiction, I could actually head out there. Provided, of course, that I told the local SAC what I was up to. Bureaucracies are bureaucracies, and turf is turf.

我决定利用一些自由时间去迈阿密和西雅图旅行。我更喜欢海鲜而不是古巴菜——比古巴菜好太多了——所以，在与西雅图 SAC 核实后，我决定从那里开始。

I decided to use some of my leeway on trips to Miami and Seattle. I prefer seafood to Cuban – by a lot – so, after checking in with the Seattle SAC, I decided to start there.

无论有没有宽限，批准我旅行的文书工作可能都要花上几周的时间。

Leeway or not, the paperwork authorizing my travel would likely take a couple of weeks.

因子人

Factor Man

2019 年 7 月 22 日

July 22, 2019

发件人：Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

From: Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

收件人：Robert Hasday (rjhasday@duanemorris.com)

To: Robert Hasday (rjhasday@duanemorris.com)

主题：Factor Man 出道派对

Subject: Factor Man Coming Out Party

鲍勃：

Bob:

我需要帮助来组织这件事。你能找到合适的人吗？

I need help organizing this. Can you find someone appropriate?

想象一下一个活动组织者使用类固醇。我猜这应该是一件众所周知的大事。

Figure an event organizer on steroids. My guess is that it rates to be the proverbial Big Deal.

调频

FM

Hasday：你觉得呢？

Hasday: You think?

因子人：我认为。为我选择吧。

Factor Man: I think. Choose well for me.

16

16

伯克特

Burkett

2019 年 7 月 31 日

July 31, 2019

我我擅长数字。如果您需要了解一项新技术对信用卡使用的影响，我就是您的不二之选。分析一堆推文？算我一份。

I’m good with numbers. If you need to know the impact that a new piece of technology has on credit card use, I’m your man. Analyze a bunch of tweets? Count me in.

但作为一名调查记者，我认为自己相当糟糕。

But as an investigative reporter, I figured that I pretty much sucked.

确实没有比这更好的词了。

There really was no better word.

一天晚上，晚饭后，当我们在斯特兰德大街闲逛时，我向艾玛坦白了我的失败。

I confessed my failings to Emma one night as we were wandering around The Strand after dinner.

不是酒店。是书店。

Not the hotel. The bookstore.

斯特兰德书店是纽约的地标，是一家拥有 250 万种图书的大型书店。对于艾玛和我来说，这是完美的约会。艾玛从手稿审查员晋升为助理文学经纪人，我们出去庆祝。我承认，调查性新闻似乎超出了我的能力范围。

The Strand is a New York landmark, an enormous bookstore carrying two and a half million titles. For Emma and for me, it’s the perfect date. Emma had been promoted from manuscript screener to assistant literary agent, and we were out celebrating. And I confessed that investigative journalism appeared to be beyond me.

艾玛用那种冷漠的目光看着我，让我感觉自己又回到了高中时代，然后笑了笑。“成为一名调查记者的关键是……”她开始说道。

Emma looked at me with that cool gaze that makes me feel like I’m in high school again and smiled. “The key to being an investigative reporter…” she began.

尽管有宣传，艾玛还是继续阅读了大量送到她所在机构电子邮箱的手稿。她似乎更喜欢阅读那些之前未被发现的作者的小说，这些小说通常是自称某个不知名领域的专家、认为自己已经写出了下一版《火星救援》的人写的垃圾。

Promotion notwithstanding, Emma continued to read an inordinate number of the manuscripts that made their way to her agency’s e-doorstep. Mostly, she seemed to delight in reading fiction from heretofore-undiscovered authors, typically garbage from self-proclaimed experts in an obscure field who believe that they’ve written the next version of The Martian.

他们的专业领域从职业摔跤到歌剧，一应俱全。故事情节通常都很愚蠢。但艾玛，真心实意，致力于确保这片广阔的土地上的每一颗钻石都未被发现。她仔细地阅读每一篇投稿，这让我惊叹不已。

Their domains of expertise range from professional wrestling to opera. The plots are generally moronic. But Emma, bless her heart, is committed to ensuring that no diamond in this vast rough goes undiscovered. She reads each submission with a care that never ceases to amaze me.

然而，不幸的结果是，她开始相信她也知道所有关于职业摔跤的背景故事，或者如何在纽约歌剧界取得成功。

One unfortunate upshot of this, however, is that she comes to believe that she, too, knows all there is to know about the back story of professional wrestling, or what it really takes to make it in the world of New York opera.

或者，在这种情况下，是调查性报道。

Or, in this case, investigative reporting.

“成为一名调查记者的关键，”她告诉我，“就是永不停止提问。要不知疲倦。问，问，问。做一个令人讨厌的人。让别人更容易与你交谈，而不是忽视你。”

“The key to being an investigative reporter,” she told me, “is to never stop asking questions. Be indefatigable. Ask, and ask, and ask. Be a pest. Make it easier for someone to talk with you than to ignore you.”

“假设我在调查一桩银行丑闻，”我回答道。

“So let’s say I’m investigating a banking scandal,” I replied.

“没错！银行行长知道。但他不会说。所以你找他身边的人。如果他不说，就找他身边的人。最终，有人会说。然后你把一切都讲出来，你就有了自己的故事。”

“Exactly! The head of the bank knows. But he won’t talk. So you find someone around him. If he won’t talk, find someone around him. Eventually, someone talks. Then you wind it all back in and you have your story.”

我想在这里说清楚。我全心全意地爱着这个女人。有时她的热情会让她失去理智。

I want to be clear here. I love this woman with all my heart. Sometimes her enthusiasm just gets the better of her.

“听起来很简单，”我说。艾玛笑了。

“Sounds easy,” I said. Emma grinned.

“假设我想要弄清楚谁是 Factor Man。”

“So let’s say I want to figure out who Factor Man is.”

“确实如此，”她鼓励道。

“Exactly,” she encouraged.

“现在，他不说话了。”

“Now, he isn’t talking.”

“没关系。你找一个知道的人，问问他，”然后她停了下来，绝对是在句子中间，几乎是在单词中间。

“That’s fine. You find someone around him who knows. You ask,” and she stopped, definitely mid-sentence and practically mid-word.

“哦，”她终于总结道。她又恢复了冷漠的目光，仍然令人着迷。她对我微笑，然后转身继续浏览斯特兰德十八英里长的书架。

“Oh,” she finally concluded. Back came the cool gaze, which was still entirely bewitching. She smiled at me and turned back to browsing the eighteen miles of bookshelves that the Strand offers.

* * *

* * *

第二天早上我起床发现了以下情况。

I got up the next morning to find the following.

发件人：jess@jmac.com（Jess MacMurray）

From: jess@jmac.com (Jess MacMurray)

收件人：wburkett@nytimes.com（威廉·伯克特）

To: wburkett@nytimes.com (William Burkett)

主题：转发：帮忙举办聚会吗？

Subject: Fwd: help with a party?

伯克特先生：

Mr. Burkett:

你知道我应该怎么想吗？说实话，我不知道该问谁。

Any idea what I should make of this? In all honesty, I haven’t a clue who to ask.

杰斯

Jess

发件人：Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

From: Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

收件人：Jess MacMurray (jess@jmac.com)

To: Jess MacMurray (jess@jmac.com)

主题：帮忙举办聚会吗？

Subject: help with a party?

亲爱的麦克默里女士：

Dear Ms. MacMurray:

我从我的律师 Bob Hasday 那里得到了您的联系方式。我需要有人来安排 Factor Man 出道派对，但我不知道该怎么做。

I got your contact information from my attorney, Bob Hasday. I need someone to arrange the Factor Man Coming Out Party, and have no idea how to do it.

你有兴趣吗？会有各种限制和某些不寻常的开支，但简而言之，无论你能安排多少门票销售和转播权收入，扣除开支后，都将作为费用归你所有。

Are you interested? There will be a variety of restrictions and certain unusual expenses, but the short version is that whatever you can arrange in terms of income from ticket sales and broadcast rights, after expenses, will be yours to keep as a fee.

调频

FM

“你看到了吗？”我问艾玛。“就是这样做的。”

“You see?” I asked Emma. “That’s how it’s done.”

她把手腕交叉放在我脑后，再次用冷漠的目光看着我，尽量远离她。“就像你的一生一样，小伙子。好运比好运更重要。”

She crossed her wrists behind my head and gave me the cool gaze again from as far away as her arms could manage. “Just like the rest of your life, bucko. Better to be lucky than good.”

爱情是一件奇妙的事情。

Love is a wonderful thing.
