All told, the savings from the use of the technology are expected to be just north of $200 billion annually by the time the technology is fully deployed in 2022. This will cover about 25% of the currently projected United States federal deficit, although the CBO is also estimating that the broader economic impact of the technology can be expected to reduce the deficit to levels not seen since the 1990’s.

尽管新闻数量多得离谱，世界仍然照常运转。年轻人相爱、结婚。调查记者展开调查。

The absurd amount of news notwithstanding, the world continued to spin on its axis. Young men fell in love and got married. Investigative reporters investigated.

我可以说是这两个团体的成员。

I was arguably a member of both of these groups.

* * *

* * *

我根本不知道我要向艾玛求婚。

I had no idea I was going to propose to Emma.

那是一个出奇温暖的周六下午，我们来到了长岛的一个古董市场。艾玛去那里是因为她喜欢古董。我去那里是因为我爱艾玛。

It was a surprisingly balmy Saturday afternoon, and we were at an antique market on Long Island. Emma was there because she loved antiques. I was there because I loved Emma.

我们来到一个摊位，里面全是——我知道你们可能难以置信——Cracker Jacks 的奖品。

We came to one booth that was entirely – and I know you will find this difficult to believe – Cracker Jacks prizes.

现在，您可能不知道的第一件事（如果您未满 25 岁）是 Cracker Jacks 曾经在盒子或袋子里附带小奖品，或者（如果您超过 25 岁）这些我们共同童年时期的珍贵奖品现在已经被 QVC 代码取代，鼓励您从 Frito-Lay 下载应用程序。

Now the first thing you may not know here (if you are under, say, 25) is that Cracker Jacks used to come with little prizes in the boxes or bags or (if you are over 25) that these treasured prizes from our collective childhood have now been replaced with QVC codes encouraging you to download an app from Frito-Lay.

我属于 25 岁以上的群体。我小时候很喜欢这些奖品，但不知道它们已经被这些蹩脚的小纸片取代了。（我显然需要去看更多大联盟棒球比赛，Cracker Jacks 是这些比赛中的常客，它们已被歌曲永久铭记。）

I’m in the over-25 group. I remembered the prizes fondly from being a kid, and had no idea that they had been replaced by these crappy little pieces of paper. (I clearly need to go to more major league baseball games, where Cracker Jacks are such a staple that they have been immortalized in song.)

我隐约记得，从我第一次得到奖品到上次这样的活动，奖品变得越来越糟糕。它们曾经是一些小塑料玩意儿，虽然很聪明，但毫无价值，后来慢慢地被一些同样毫无价值但远没有那么聪明的小纸质笑话书之类的东西所取代。我不知道它们现在已经完全消失了，再也没有孩子会兴高采烈地翻找他的 Cracker Jacks，兴奋地想知道他会找到什么。人们说，美丽和纯真没有敌人，只有时间。

I did vaguely remember that the prizes had gotten worse from the first time I got one until the last such event. They used to be little plastic things that were clever but worthless, and they slowly got replaced by tiny paper joke books or such that were just as worthless but not nearly as clever. I had no idea that they were now gone completely, with no kid ever to dig cheerfully through his Cracker Jacks wondering excitedly what he will find. Beauty and innocence, they say, have no enemy but time.

我也没有想到，当这一切开始时，奖品实际上非常酷。

I also had no idea that back when all of this started, the prizes were actually very cool.

Cracker Jacks 本身自 1896 年就已存在。有这样一个都市传说：它或类似的产品是在 1893 年芝加哥世界博览会上推出的。“根据传说……”这是 crackerjack.com 网站上的描述，这个传说广为流传，以至于芝加哥小熊队在 1993 年 6 月 16 日对阵当时扩建的佛罗里达马林鱼队的比赛中庆祝了 Cracker Jacks 成立 100 周年。1908 年，“带我去看球赛”中的不朽故事就发生在此。

Cracker Jacks itself has been around since 1896. There is an urban myth that it, or a similar product, was introduced at the Chicago World’s Fair in 1893. “According to legend…” is the description on the crackerjack.com web site, and the legend is sufficiently pervasive that the Chicago Cubs celebrated the 100th anniversary of Cracker Jacks during their June 16, 1993 game against the then-expansion Florida Marlins. The immortalization in “Take Me Out to the Ball Game” occurred in 1908.

奖品于 1912 年推出，包括棒球卡、我记得的小塑料玩具和各种其他物品。收藏家市场肯定存在，旧奖品包括手表、订婚戒指、解码戒指和各种其他酷炫的东西。

The prizes were introduced in 1912, and have included baseball cards, the little plastic toys I remember, and a variety of other things. There is a definite collector’s market, and the old prizes include watches, engagement rings, decoder rings, and all sorts of other cool stuff.

订婚戒指。

Engagement rings.

我站在那里，仔细查看这些戒指，它们一定有将近一百年的历史了，同时看着对面另一家商店里的艾玛。阳光穿过云层，恰到好处地照在她的头发上。她有着我非常熟悉的气质——有点傲慢，同时又有点害羞。她走到她要去的摊位的柜台前，对柜台后面的那个人说了些什么。他笑了。

I was standing there, checking out these rings that must have been nearly a hundred years old, and looking at Emma across the way at another shop. The sun broke through the clouds and came off her hair just right. She had that bearing that I had come to know all too well – somehow a little bit haughty and a little bit shy at the same time. She stepped up to the counter of the booth she was visiting and said something to the guy behind it. He smiled.

艾玛就是这样。你一开始没有注意到。但无论她走到哪里，都像是被一朵幸福的云团包围着。并不是说她一直都如此欣喜若狂，只是她周围的人，无论他们是快乐还是悲伤，在她以某种方式触动他们之后，似乎总是会更快乐一点。

Emma was like that. You didn’t notice it at first. But everywhere she went, it was like this cloud of happiness surrounded her. Not that she was so deliriously happy all the time, just that the people around her, however happy or sad they were, always seemed to be just a little bit happier after she had touched them in some way.

有点像猪圈，但是里面是快乐而不是泥土。

Sort of like Pigpen, but with happiness instead of dirt.

所以她就在那里，扮演艾玛的角色，在那一刻——我必须承认，此后的那一刻——我爱她爱得无法忍受。所以我买了一枚傻傻的 Cracker Jacks 订婚戒指，走过过道（没有双关语的意思），单膝跪地，向她求婚。

So she was just there, being Emma, and in that moment – and the moments since, I must confess – I loved her more than I could bear. So I bought one of the silly Cracker Jacks engagement rings, walked across the aisle (no pun intended), got down on one knee, and asked her to marry me.

她看了看我走出的那个摊位，又看了看那枚戒指，从她的眼睛里我可以看出她已经明白了一切，并且竭力忍住不笑。她单膝跪在我面前。

She looked at the booth from which I had emerged, and looked at the ring, and I could see in her eyes that she had figured it all out and was trying incredibly hard not to laugh. She knelt down on one knee facing me.

“威廉·伯克特，”她告诉我，“我会嫁给你。但我想要的不仅仅是那枚戒指。”

“William Burkett,” she told me, “I will marry you. But I want more than just that ring.”

我不知道该说什么。

I didn’t know what to say.

“我想要与之搭配的 Cracker Jacks。”

“I want the Cracker Jacks that go with it.”

“一百年前的 Cracker Jacks？太恶心了。”

“A hundred-year-old Cracker Jacks? Gross.”

她看着我。“威尔伯，”她告诉我，“你最后说的十一句话中，有五个是‘你愿意嫁给我吗？’和‘恶心’。但是，是的，我会嫁给你。我会永远听你胡乱使用英语。”

She looked at me. “Wilbur,” she told me, “Of the last eleven words out of your mouth, five have been, ‘Will you marry me?’ and ‘Gross’. But yes, I will marry you. I will listen to you mangle the English language forever.”

毁容？谁毁容？但我关心的只是答案。

Mangle? Who mangles? But all I cared about was the answer.

我回到 Cracker Jacks 摊位并买了一个解码戒指，理由是订婚戒指对我的个人事业有很大帮助，也许相关的焦糖魔法也能满足我的职业需求。

I returned to the Cracker Jacks booth and bought a decoder ring, on the grounds that my personal cause had been helped immeasurably by the engagement ring and perhaps related caramel magic would support my professional needs as well.

它不起作用。

It didn’t work.

我可以随心所欲地报道 Factor Man。而且，多亏了 Jess MacMurray，我经常有新奇的东西要说。但在揭露他的身份方面，我完全无能为力。正如我所解释的那样，在这种时候，我的策略是找别人来打扰。不过，在这个特殊情况下，我似乎没有其他人。

I could report on Factor Man all I wanted. And, thanks to Jess MacMurray, I often had something novel to say. But in terms of unmasking his identity, I was absolutely nowhere. My strategy in such moments, as I have explained, is to find someone else to bother. In this particular case, though, I seemed to be out of someone elses.

那天晚上我们回到家时，我意识到情况不太对劲。我心里有别人了。我讨厌打这个电话，但艾玛已经同意嫁给我了，我个人无法阻止她。

When we got home that evening, I realized that wasn’t quite right. There was someone else. It was a call I hated making, but Emma had agreed to marry me and I was personally unstoppable.

我翻阅了一些旧文件，找到了两年半前让我损失电脑和手机的那张逮捕令。约翰·哈德森的卡还在上面。

I dug through some old paperwork and found the warrant that, two and a half years earlier, had cost me my computer and phone. John Hudson’s card was still attached.

20

20

哈德森

Hudson

2020 年 10 月 11 日

October 11, 2020

电视有很多人可能会在周日下午给我打电话，但威廉·伯克特不是其中之一。尽管我们互相猜疑，但我们还是同意第二天早上在第三大道和第一大道的星巴克见面。

There were many folks who might call me on a Sunday afternoon, but William Burkett wasn’t one of them. Mutual suspicions notwithstanding, we agreed to meet the next morning at the Starbucks at 3rd and First Avenue.

显然，我知道伯克特从一开始就参与了 Factor Man 的故事，就像他知道我一样。我怀疑他想分享信息，并花了一晚上的时间试图弄清楚我到底愿意告诉他多少，以及我想要什么回报。

I knew, obviously, that Burkett had been involved with the Factor Man story from its beginning, just as he knew that I had. I suspected he wanted to share information, and spent the evening trying to figure out just how much I was willing to tell him, and what I wanted in return.

* * *

* * *

我们 9 点的会议我早到了几分钟，但伯克特来得更早。我拒绝了他请我喝一杯的提议，我们在后面找了一张桌子。我们坐了下来，我等着他开始。

I was a few minutes early for our 9AM meeting, but Burkett was earlier still. I passed on his offer to buy me a cup of whatever I was drinking, and we found a table near the back. We sat down, and I waited for him to begin.

“首先，”他问道，“我该怎么称呼你？”

“For a start,” he asked, “What do I call you?”

“你可以叫我约翰。或者哈德森特工。随你喜欢。”

“You can call me John. Or Agent Hudson. Whichever you’d prefer.”

“约翰。谢谢。我是威廉。谢谢你把另一个人留在家里。”

“John. Thanks. I’m William. And thanks for leaving that other guy at home.”

我告诉他，邀请函上似乎没有包括利文斯通特工。

I told him that the invitation didn’t seem to include Agent Livingstone.

然后我等待着。

And I waited.

“那么，”他终于继续说道。“约翰。我是不是应该问你关于妻子和孩子的事？”

“So,” he finally continued. “John. Am I supposed to ask you about the wife and kids?”

“你在想什么，威廉？”

“What’s on your mind, William?”

又停顿了一下。“我在找 Factor Man。我猜你也还在找。”

Another pause. “I’m looking for Factor Man. I assume you still are as well.”

我告诉他：“我们仍是。”

“We still are,” I told him.

“有进展吗？” 这个甚至不需要回答。

“Getting anywhere?” That one didn’t even need a response.

“好吧，”伯克特最终继续说道。“我认为标准协议应该是你带上另一名特工。如果你不这样做，你大概会陷入困境。我也一样。如果我们合作，也许我们可以摆脱困境。共享信息。你知道的。”

“Fine,” Burkett eventually continued. “I figure standard protocol has to be for you to bring another agent with you. If you didn’t do that, you’re presumably stuck. I’m also stuck. Maybe we could get unstuck if we worked together. Shared information. You know.”

“分享吧，”我告诉他。

“Share away,” I told him.

“双向街道？”

“Two-way street?”

我回答道：“那要看你能给我们带来什么。”

“That depends on what you’ve got for us,” I answered.

伯克特沉默了一会儿才回答。“我什么也没有。”

There was yet another pause before Burkett answered. “I’ve got nothing.”

“几乎不可能，”我回答道。“那把你所有的电子邮件联系人都列出来怎么样？”

“Hardly,” I responded. “How about a list of all of your email contacts?”

“你知道我不会这么做。”

“You know I won’t do that.”

“如果去掉邮件内容中的名字，那邮件内容本身怎么样？”

“How about the text of the emails themselves, with the names stripped out?”

“答案一样。”

“Same answer.”

“那么告诉我，威廉，”我问他，“当你不愿意与我们分享任何一件事时，你建议怎样让这条路成为一条双行道？”

“So tell me, William,” I asked him, “How do you propose that this be a two-way street when there’s not a single thing you’re willing to share with us?”

没有什么。

Nothing.

“威廉，”我继续说，“信息交换就是信息交换。这并不意味着我们现在告诉你我们知道的事情，也许你以后会告诉我们你弄清楚的事情。但我会告诉你什么。有一件事我要和你分享。

“William,” I continued, “information exchange means information exchange. It doesn’t mean that we tell you what we know now, and maybe you tell us something you figure out later. But I’ll tell you what. There is one thing I’ll share with you.

“我有一张我们认为与此案有关的人的照片。如果我给你看这张照片，你告诉我你是否认识这个人，你愿意吗？”

“I’ve got a picture of someone we think is somehow involved. How about if I show you the picture and you tell me if you know the person. You willing to do that?”

伯克特说是的。

Burkett said he was.

于是我给他看了刘嘉玲的照片。他脸色惨白，说不知道她是谁。

So I showed him a photo of Janet Liu. He went white as a sheet, and claimed to have no idea who she was.

伯克特

Burkett

2020 年 10 月 12 日

October 12, 2020

哈德森建议我们在东村的星巴克见面。我猜他以为那意味着时髦。我们俩都早到了一点；我更早。唯一的好消息是他没有带他的帮手来。

Hudson suggested we meet at a Starbucks in the East Village. I guess he thought that meant trendy. We both arrived a bit early; I was earlier. The only bit of good news was that he didn’t bring his goon with him.

我们寒暄了几句，同意以直呼其名的方式合作。然后他轻蔑地表示我什么都不懂。基本上就是一副“这对我有什么好处？”的态度。我很喜欢 FBI。

We traded supposed pleasantries and agreed to work on a first-name basis. Then he belittled the fact that I didn’t know squat. Basically a “what’s in it for me?” attitude. Gotta love the FBI.

然后他给我看了一张奥斯汀咖啡店里那位绝色美女的照片。

And then he showed me a picture of the stunningly attractive woman from the coffee shop in Austin.

我试图淡然面对，但显然没有成功。但很难想象她去那里有什么无辜的理由。

I attempted, surely unsuccessfully, to take it in stride. But it was hard to imagine an innocent reason for her to have been there.

当我试图弄明白时，哈德森什么也没说。他对照片中的女人的态度似乎表明她不是一个好人，甚至不是一个中立的人。她似乎并没有以积极的方式与 Factor Man 产生联系。几乎就像她是一个威胁。

Hudson didn’t say anything while I tried to figure it out. His attitude toward the woman in the picture somehow suggested that she wasn’t a good guy, or even a neutral. Not as if she was somehow involved with Factor Man in a positive way. Almost as if she was a threat.

那么她在德州咖啡交易商那里做什么呢？她显然不是 FBI 的人，所以这几乎肯定意味着她要么在跟踪 FBI，要么一直在跟踪我。我怀疑人们很少跟踪 FBI。

So what could she have been doing in Texas Coffee Traders? She clearly wasn’t with the FBI, so that almost certainly meant that she was either following the FBI or that she had been following me. I doubted that people followed the FBI all that often.

剩下的只有一种可能，我不能说我很喜欢它。我只是不经常被美女追着。这总是让我感到有些惊讶，也有些悲伤。

That left one possibility, and I can’t say I liked it much. I just don’t get followed around by gorgeous women all that frequently. This has always struck me as a somewhat surprising and somewhat sad aspect of my existence generally.

所以我一直在寻找那个与中国人发生争斗的 Factor Man，而这位引起 FBI 兴趣的美丽的亚洲女子也一直在跟踪我。

So I had been looking for Factor Man, who had picked a fight with the Chinese, and this gorgeous Asian woman who had attracted the interest of the FBI had been following me.

这一切都不是一件好事。

None of this was good.

我把照片还给哈德森，并试图拖延时间，告诉他——我赶紧补充说，这是实话——我不知道她是谁。

I handed the photo back to Hudson and tried to buy some time by telling him – truthfully, I hasten to add – that I had no idea who she was.

“得了吧，威廉，”他告诉我。“别跟人开玩笑了。你花了这么长时间才明白这一点？”

“Come on, William,” he told me. “Don’t kid a kidder. It took you that long to figure that out?”

我告诉他我很小心。

I told him I was being careful.

“小心点，就像刚见了鬼一样？”

“Careful enough to look like you just saw a ghost?”

这个问题比较难回答。

That one was a bit harder to answer.

“她是谁？”我问。

“Who is she?” I asked.

“所以你确实认识她。”

“So you do know her.”

“我没这么说。我问的是她是谁。”

“I didn’t say that. I asked who she was.”

“我问你是否认识她。”

“And I asked if you knew her.”

我想了想。“约翰，我知道的不多，但总比什么都多。你显然知道的比什么都多，因为你给我看了那张照片。但我猜你知道的也不多。所以我告诉你我知道的，你告诉我你知道的。公平吗？”

I thought about it. “John, I don’t know much, but it’s more than nothing. You obviously know more than nothing, because you showed me the picture. But my guess is that you don’t know much, either. So I’ll tell you what I know, and you tell me what you know. Fair?”

哈德森同意了，我告诉他我在德州咖啡店见过她。他告诉我她是一名中国人，似乎正在寻找 Factor Man。

Hudson agreed, and I told him I had seen her in Texas Coffee Traders. He told me she was a Chinese national who appeared to be looking for Factor Man.

“就这些？”我问。

“That’s it?” I asked.

“就是这样。”

“That’s it.”

“不可能，约翰。这张照片出自哪里？”

“That can’t be it, John. Where is the picture from?”

“这是一张档案照片。”

“It’s a file photo.”

“如果这是一张档案照片，你就有一个名字。”

“If it’s a file photo, you have a name.”

他告诉我她的名字叫 Janet Liu。

He told me her name was Janet Liu.

“所以如果你知道她的名字，”我回答，“她就一定会出现在其他地方。”

“So if you have a name,” I answered, “she has to have shown up somewhere else.”

至少他看上去不太自在。“我无法回答这个问题。”

He looked uncomfortable, at least. “I can’t answer that.”

“你不能什么？我以为我们正在告诉对方我们所知道的事情。”

“You can’t what? I thought we were telling each other what we knew here.”

“是的。我告诉你她在寻找 Factor Man，你也证实了这一点。如果你想要更多，那就给我一些我真正能用的东西。”

“Yeah. I told you she’s looking for Factor Man, and you confirmed it. You want more, give me something I can actually use.”

“就这些了，约翰。至少我已经把我知道的都告诉你了。”

“That’s all there is, John. At least I told you everything I had.”

“你什么时候在奥斯汀见到她？”

“When did you see her in Austin?”

“你很清楚我当时在奥斯汀。”

“You know damn well when I was in Austin.”

“她一个人吗？”

“Was she alone?”

我回想起来。她曾经是。一个美丽的女孩，坐在桌边，喝着咖啡，读着一本书。但哈德森似乎不知道这一点，似乎不知道她是否是单人行动者。

I thought back. She had been. Gorgeous girl, sitting at a table, drinking a cup of coffee and reading a book. But Hudson appeared not to know that, appeared not to know if she was a solo operator.

“我不知道我是否想告诉你这个，”我告诉他，“除非你告诉我你怎么知道她参与了这件事。”

“I don’t know that I want to tell you that,” I told him, “unless you tell me how you know she’s involved.”

他问我：“你知道罗伯特·哈斯戴是谁吗？”我告诉他，每个人都知道鲍勃·哈斯戴是谁。

“Do you know who Robert Hasday is?” he asked me. I told him that everyone knew who Bob Hasday was.

“刘女士是 Hasday 办公室入室盗窃案的嫌疑人。我们认为她可能一直在寻找 Hasday 的 Factor Man 文件。”

“Ms. Liu is a person of interest in a break-in at Mr. Hasday’s offices. We believe she may have been looking for Hasday’s Factor Man file.”

“什么时候发生的？”

“When did this happen?”

“两年多以前。”

“Two-plus years ago.”

“她现在在哪儿？”

“And where is she now?”

“据我们所知，她现在在国外。威廉，告诉我，她是一个人吗？”

“To the best of our knowledge, she’s out of the country. So tell me, William, was she alone or not?”

“她独自一人。”

“She was alone.”

“你确定吗？”

“You’re sure?”

“我敢肯定。”

“I’m sure.”

“卫生间里没有同伴吗？”

“No companion in the bathroom?”

“我在咖啡店里待了一个多小时。这真是一次不错的旅行。”

“I was in the coffee shop for over an hour. Would’ve been quite the excursion.”

哈德森等着，但我没什么可说的。最后，他问我们是否结束了。我告诉他，我认为我们已经结束了。

Hudson waited, but I had nothing to add. Eventually, he asked if we were done. I told him that I thought we were.

我们站起来，他向我伸出了手，我握了握。他说我是个讨厌鬼。我告诉他，我的未婚妻也有同样的感觉，然后我们就分道扬镳了。

We stood, and he offered me a hand, which I shook. He told me I was a pain in the ass. I told him that my fiancée felt the same way, and we went our separate ways.

2021 年 2 月 10 日

February 10, 2021

如果你要参加 FCOP，你就得知道

If You’re Going to FCOP, You Know It

威廉·伯克特，《纽约时报》

William Burkett, The New York Times

距离开幕还有五个月，FCOP 的所有门票（不可转让）已全部售出。总门票销售额为 267,369,219 美元，扣除通货膨胀因素后，该活动成为历史上票房收入排名第 16 的巡回演唱会。

With five months to go, all of the (non-transferable) tickets for FCOP have now been sold. Total ticket sales were $267,369,219, which makes this event the 16th highest grossing concert tour in history, after adjusting for inflation.

问题是，每场收入更高的巡演都至少有 69 场个人演唱会。One Direction 乐队 2014 年的“Where We Are”巡演就是如此。除此之外，每场收入更高的巡演都至少有 84 场活动。FCOP 就是一场活动。

The thing is, every tour that made more money involved at least sixty-nine individual concerts. That was One Direction’s “Where We Are” Tour in 2014. Except for that, every higher grossing tour involved at least eighty-four events. FCOP is one event.

其他比较甚至没有实际意义。单场平均票房最高的巡演是 U2 的 360˚ 巡演，该巡演持续了三年，共 110 场，平均每场票房为 670 万美元。这大约是 FCOP 票房收入的 2.5%。

Other comparisons aren’t even really meaningful. The tour with the highest average gross per event was U2’s 360˚ tour, which ran for three years, 110 shows, and grossed an average of $6.7 million per show. That’s about 2.5% of what FCOP is bringing in.

此次活动的广播收入令人失望，至少与行业标准（大约是门票销售额的三倍）相比是如此。Factor Man 禁止广告，导致媒体总收入仅为 1.323 亿美元。399,669,219 美元的总收入使该活动成为有史以来票房收入排名第122 的电影，排在《鳄鱼邓迪》（1986 年票房为 1.75 亿美元）和 1921 年的默片经典《天启四骑士》（当时票房为 920 万美元，但经通货膨胀调整后票房为 3.97 亿美元）之间。

Broadcast revenue for the event has been disappointing, at least in comparison to the industry standard of approximately tripling ticket sales. Factor Man’s prohibition on advertising has resulted in total media revenue of only $132,300,000. The $399,669,219 total makes the event the 122nd highest grossing film of all time, between Crocodile Dundee ($175M in 1986 dollars) and 1921’s silent classic The Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse ($9.2M dollars at the time, but $397M after adjusting for inflation).

购票者中有各种各样的中国公民，因此地球上的每个国家都会出席。美国政府额外购买了十几张门票，新第一夫妇也将出席。

A variety of Chinese nationals were among the ticket purchasers, so every nation on earth will be in attendance. The United States government purchased an additional dozen tickets, and the new First Couple will be among the attendees.

在整个过程中，Factor Man 本人一直保持沉默。他的博客没有更新。

Through all of this, Factor Man himself has remained completely silent. The blog has not been updated.

但他的技术影响仍在不断扩大。苹果的 Siri 已经变得名副其实地智能，iPhone 在智能手机市场上几乎无人能敌。上个月，一部由电脑创作的交响乐在圣何塞表演艺术中心开演，获得了热烈的好评。有传言称，苹果已重新对自动驾驶产生了兴趣，一款名副其实的自动驾驶汽车操作系统将在 FCOP 之后不久发布。

But the impact of his technology continues to spread. Apple’s Siri has become legitimately intelligent, and the iPhone is now almost unchallenged in the smartphone market. A computer-composed symphony opened to rave reviews last month at the San Jose Center for the Performing Arts. Rumors are that Apple has renewed its interest in autonomous driving and that a legitimately autonomous vehicle operating system is slated for release shortly after FCOP.

美国政府也一直很忙。除了《因素人法案》要求的效率提高外，最令人惊讶的影响是税收征收的改善。

The American government has also been busy. In addition to the efficiency gains mandated by the Factor Man Act, the most surprising impact has been on the improvement in tax collection.

2016 年，约有 19% 的联邦税款未收缴。去年，这一数字为 9.3%，预计明年还会进一步下降。这导致联邦金库额外收入约 3000 亿美元，政府在不久的将来有可能出现盈余。几年前，这几乎是不可想象的。

In 2016, some 19% of federal taxes went uncollected. Last year, that number was 9.3%, and it is expected to fall further still next year. The impact has been an additional approximately $300 billion flowing into the federal coffers, and there is some chance that the government will show a surplus in the near future. This would have been virtually unthinkable a few years ago.

恐怖主义的影响也十分深远。在 Factor Man 技术出现之前，2015 年恐怖事件数量与 2014 年相比下降了 13%。然而，随着追踪单个恐怖分子的能力大大增强，今年恐怖事件数量有望下降 52%。

The impact on terrorism has also been profound. Prior to the appearance of the Factor Man technology, 2015 showed a 13% drop in the number of terrorist incidents when compared to 2014. With vastly enhanced abilities to track individual terrorists, however, this year is on track to show a full 52% reduction.

但也许这一切并非都是进步。虽然政府机构没有收集到新的信息，但这些机构利用所获信息的能力却是史无前例的。如果国税局能找到偷税漏税者，那么政府机构也能找到他们感兴趣的其他人，这无疑相当于隐私权的普遍下降。恐怖分子的情况也类似。

But perhaps not all of this is progress. While there is no new information being collected by government agencies, those agencies’ ability to use what they know is unprecedented. If the IRS can find tax cheats, government agencies can find other people in whom they have taken an interest, and this surely corresponds to a general degradation in privacy. Similar arguments can be made for terrorists.

苹果在智能手机和汽车市场的明显主导地位也可能产生类似的令人不寒而栗的影响。智能手机为手机制造商和电话公司提供了大量有关其用户的数据，一家公司收集大量这些数据或拥有前所未有的利用这些数据的能力是不合适的。有迹象表明，苹果可能已经利用其在手机市场的主导地位来影响其与电信公司的关系性质，并规定苹果被允许收集的数据的条款。

Apple’s apparent domination of both the smartphone and automotive markets may have similarly chilling effects. Smartphones provide both handset manufacturers and telephone companies with vast amounts of data about their users, and it cannot be appropriate for one organization to either collect the bulk of this data or to have hitherto unheard of abilities to exploit it. There are suggestions that Apple may already be using its dominant position in the handset market to impact both the nature of its relationships with the telcos and to dictate terms regarding the data that Apple is permitted to collect.

自动驾驶汽车市场的竞争受到抑制，其影响同样深远。目前，这项技术的价值估计为每年 5600 亿美元，因为它有可能彻底改变我们所有人的出行和互动方式。与其他例子一样，总体技术效果是积极的，但将这项技术掌握在一群孤立无援的人手中，充其量也令人不安。自从收购 Factor Man 技术以来，苹果的股价一路飙升，苹果即将成为第一家市值超过一万亿美元的公司。

A stifling of competition in the autonomous car market would be similarly profound. This technology is currently estimated to be worth some $560 billion annually, as it has the potential to completely rework the ways in which all of us travel and interact. As with other examples, the overall technological effects are positive, but having the technology in an isolated set of hands is troubling at best. Apple’s stock has skyrocketed in the period since it acquired the Factor Man technology, and Apple is on the verge of becoming the first company with a capitalization in excess of one trillion dollars.

当然，五个月后，一切都将再次改变。假设 Factor Man 信守诺言，这项技术将向所有人开放。让我们希望这一转变能够顺利进行，因为目前尚不清楚，如果没有 Factor Man 的要求，苹果或美国政府是否会采取同样慷慨的做法。

In five months, of course, that will all change – again. Assuming that Factor Man is true to his word, the technology will be made available to everyone. Let us hope that this transition goes without difficulty, since it is not clear that either Apple or the United States government would take a similarly generous approach if Factor Man were not around to require it.

因子人

Factor Man

2021 年 3 月 15 日

March 15, 2021

离 FCOP 大约还有四个月的时间。据我所知，我仍然没有被发现。

FCOP was about four months away. As far as I could tell, I remained undiscovered.

有一些意外。首先是获得 Brian Finn 的 2500 万美元（或剩下的 2400 万美元）并不像我希望的那么有趣。

There had been some surprises. The first was that having access to Brian Finn’s $25 million (or the $24 million that was left) wasn’t nearly as much fun as I had hoped it would be.

我没法把钱花光。我的假期质量确实提高了，但还不足以包括乘坐私人飞机或类似的奢侈享受。这必须等到 FCOP 才能实现，因为我将乘坐私人飞机参加 FCOP，而且派对结束后，我可以随心所欲地尽情炫耀。

I couldn’t spend it. The quality of my vacations had certainly improved, but not enough to include transportation by private jet or similar extravagances. That had to wait until FCOP, both because I’d be attending FCOP itself by private jet and because after the party was over, I could be as flamboyant as I wanted.

好吧，我妻子丹尼斯能接受的奢华程度，她会想把所有的钱都捐给慈善机构。

Well, as flamboyant as my wife Denise could stomach. She would want to give all the money to charity.

但那都是以后的事了。现在，这 2,400 万美元就放在开曼群岛的银行里，詹姆斯·特拉斯克等着我花掉它，这样他就可以获得 3% 的提成。

But that was all for later. For now, the $24 million just sat in the bank in the Caymans, and James Trask waited for me to spend it so that he could get his 3% cut.

我不必担心钱的问题。但我还有很多其他事情要担心。我最担心的是 FCOP，以及在它发生之前如何不被发现。

I didn’t have to worry about money. But I had plenty of other stuff to worry about. Mostly, I had to worry about FCOP, and about remaining undiscovered until it happened.

在这方面我能做的最大的帮助就是尽早发布代码。我讨厌这样一个事实：我曾承诺苹果和美国政府在下一次发布之前有整整一年的时间开发它。但现实生活中的科学发展速度比电影中慢得多，时间太短可能不足以让他们真正做出任何有趣的事情。所以总共是两年。

The biggest thing I could do to help in that regard was to just release the code early. I hated the fact that I had promised both Apple and the US government a full year to work with it before the next release took place. But science moves much more slowly in real life than it does in the movies, and less time probably wouldn’t have been enough for them to actually do anything interesting. So two years total it was.

我能做的第二件事是设置某种死人开关，这样如果我被杀或以其他方式从画面中消失，密码无论如何都会被释放（或者可能立即被释放）。这似乎是个非常好的主意，因为它会消除中国人（例如）弄清楚我是谁并把我干掉的动机。

The second thing I could do was to set up some kind of a dead man’s switch, something so that if I were killed or otherwise removed from the picture, the code would get released anyway (or perhaps immediately). That seemed like an incredibly good idea, since it would remove the incentive for the Chinese (for example) to figure out who I was and take me out.

但我就是不知道该怎么做。而且我花了大量的时间去尝试。

But I just couldn’t figure out how to do it. And I had spent an inordinate amount of time trying.

根本问题是我不能直接把代码放到互联网上，因为被发现的风险太大了。如果它是未加密的，那么任何一个傻瓜都能发现它。如果它是加密的，找到一种释放加密密钥的方法基本上就等于找到一种释放代码本身的方法。

The fundamental problem was that I couldn’t just put the code on the Internet somewhere, because the risk was too great that it would be found. If it were unencrypted, then any random idiot could discover it. If it were encrypted, finding a way to release the encryption key was basically the same as finding a way to release the code itself.

如果我不能将代码放到互联网上，我基本上就必须将其放在信封里，然后交给某人或藏在某个地方。

If I couldn’t put the code on the Internet, I would have to basically stick it in an envelope and either give it to someone or hide it somewhere.

把密码交给我信任的人，比如鲍勃·哈斯戴或我的家人，也是行不通的。如果中国人找到我，他们也会找到我的家人。除掉我只会鼓励他们也除掉我的家人。而且每个人都知道我和哈斯戴的关系。把密码交给一个人只会让这个人面临我应该自己承担的风险。

Giving it to someone I trusted, like Bob Hasday or a family member, wouldn’t work, either. If the Chinese found me, they would have found my family members as well. Eliminating me would simply encourage them to eliminate my family also. And everyone knew about my relationship with Hasday. Giving the code to a person would simply expose that person to the risk that I should have borne myself.

剩下的就是把代码藏在石头下面或别的地方。我可以在 FCOP 之后设置一封自动电子邮件：“Factor Man 代码是埋在缅因州格伦伍德 (人口 3) 最大的橡树旁边的一个信封。”这就像寻宝一样。

All that was left was hiding the code under a rock or something. I could set up an automatic email just after FCOP: “The Factor Man code is an envelope buried next to the biggest oak tree in Glenwood, Maine (population 3).” It would be like a treasure hunt.

问题是，这就像一场寻宝游戏。我将被淘汰，电子邮件将被发出，世界将降临格伦伍德，有人将获得密码。

The problem is that it would be exactly like a treasure hunt. I would be eliminated, the email would go out, the world would descend on Glenwood, and someone would get the code.

某人。

Someone.

一个人。

One person.

那根本不起作用。

That wouldn’t work at all.

也许我忽略了什么，但自从给威廉·伯克特发第一封电子邮件之前，我就一直在担心这个问题，只是一直没能解决。但有一件事我可以做，让人们相信我对没有死人开关一事是认真的。

Maybe I was missing something, but I’d been worrying about this since before that first email to William Burkett, and I just hadn’t been able to solve it. But there was one thing I could do to convince people I was serious about the lack of a dead man’s switch.

Factor Man 博客

The Factor Man blog

距离 Factor Man 出道派对还有四个月的时间。门票基本都已经售完了，但我还是想澄清一下技术方面的情况。

The Factor Man Coming Out Party is about four months away. The tickets have pretty much all been distributed, but I would still like to clarify what’s happening with the technology.

众所周知，我将于 2021 年 7 月 10 日将我的技术放到公共领域。我在这里说的是：我将把这项技术放到公共领域。

As is well known, I will be placing my technology in the public domain on July 10, 2021. And I mean what I say here: I will be placing the technology in the public domain.

它还没有放在网络上的某个地方等待，因为我担心其他人会过早地找到它并使用它。

It’s not already on the web somewhere waiting, because I’m concerned that someone else will find it and use it prematurely.

而且它肯定不在我的任何熟人或家人手中，因为我不想让他们承担为我保管这项技术的责任或风险。

And it’s certainly not in the hands of any of my acquaintances or family, because I don’t want to burden them with either the responsibilities or the risk associated with holding the technology for me.

但它确实存在。访问 www.thiscodeisours.com，你就会找到它。它是加密的，解密密钥是 Tim Cook 的当前密码。他是 Apple 的首席执行官，Tim，你可能想在我向 FCOP 透露密码之前更改该密码。在那之前，我会保密。

But it is out there. Go to www.thiscodeisours.com, and you’ll find it. It’s encrypted, and the decryption key is Tim Cook’s current password. He’s the CEO of Apple and Tim, you probably want to change that password before I reveal it at FCOP. Until then, I’ll keep it a secret.

所以每个人都必须等待。不管好坏，我也在等待。无论 FCOP 之后我的生活会变成什么样，我都期待着开始。

So everyone just has to wait. For better or worse, I’m waiting, too. Whatever my life is going to be like after FCOP, I’m looking forward to getting started.

该网站已被访问 226,388,257,314 次。

This web site has been visited 226,388,257,314 times.

如果我将苹果首席执行官的密码泄露给第三方，那将是一个非常明显的错误，所以希望这能让人们相信我确实是密钥的保管者。

It would be a pretty obvious mistake for me to distribute the Apple CEO’s password to third parties, so hopefully this would convince people that I really was the keeper of the key.

刘

Liu

2021 年 4 月 9 日，距离 FCOP 还有三个月

April 9, 2021, three months to FCOP

Factor Man 声称他的目标是在三个月内将他的代码公之于众。但在过去三年里，我一直没能成功识别他。

Factor Man’s stated intention was to release his code to the world in three months. And in the past three years, I had been singularly ineffective at identifying him.

我的上司曾两次替换我。不幸的是，每次我的上司取得的进步都比我少。每次我都被重新派回领导一个拥有更多人员和资源的团队。有一次，我甚至还获得了晋升。

My superiors had replaced me twice. On each occasion, my replacement had unfortunately made less progress than I had. And on each occasion, I had been returned to lead a group with increased staffing and resources. On one occasion, I had actually received a promotion.

我现在参加了各级会议，讨论解决 Factor Man 问题所需的步骤。中国当局已决定，发布 Factor Man 代码的恐怖行为是必须不惜一切代价避免的。如果 Factor Man 在发布代码之前被识别，他将被消灭。鉴于 Factor Man 一个月前发表的博客文章，解释了他决定亲自进行最终发布，我的上级和我相信消灭他就足够了。

I now participated in meetings at all levels involving the steps required to resolve the Factor Man issue. The Chinese authorities had decided that the terrorist act of releasing the Factor Man code was one that needed to be avoided at all costs. If Factor Man were identified prior to the release of his code, he was to be eliminated. Given Factor Man’s blog post of a month previously, explaining his decision to conduct the final release personally, my superiors and I believed it to be reasonably likely that eliminating him would suffice.

这不是民族自豪感的问题，而是国家权宜之计。如果 Factor Man 本人不发布代码，我们预计苹果和美国政府都会拒绝这样做。虽然我们无法接受美国最大的跨国公司和美国政府都能够获得该技术，但这种结果仍然比广泛发布的结果要好得多。尽管中国消除 Factor Man 的成本可能非常高昂，尤其是如果消除发生在美国本土，但这一成本低于让该技术流向野外的估计成本。

This was a matter not of national pride, but of national expediency. Without Factor Man himself to release the code, we expected that both Apple and the United States government would decline to do so. While it was anathema to us that both the largest American multinational and the American government have access to the technology, such an outcome was still vastly preferable to one where the release was widespread. Although the cost to China of eliminating Factor Man was likely to be immense, especially if the elimination occurred on American soil, that cost was less than the estimated cost of having the technology escape into the wild.

我们有三种方案来解决这个问题，具体取决于何时可以确定“人因”的身份。最简单的方案是使用任何一位目前在美国各地等待的中国特工。鉴于美国政府获得“人因”密码后反间谍工作的效率提高，只有五位这样的特工可用。这比以前少得多。

We had three plans for resolving the issue, depending on when Factor Man himself could be identified. The simplest involved the use of any of the Chinese agents who were currently waiting at geographically distributed locations in the United States. Given the increased effectiveness of the American counterespionage efforts since the US government had obtained the Factor Man code, there were only five such agents available. This was far fewer than previously.

我们预计，随着 FCOP 活动的临近，我们识别“人质”的能力可能会因某种原因而增强。如果在那之前无法拦截“人质”，那么我们政府在 FCOP 的两名出席者就会有空。门票上的名字分别是李强武和马永锋，这两个名字是中国男性的常用名，具体人选尚未确定。一旦更准确地确定了中国的需求，就可以很容易地制作过期护照和其他文件。

We expected that our ability to identify Factor Man would likely increase, for one reason or another, as the FCOP event approached. If it were impossible to intercept Factor Man prior to that time, our government’s two attendees at FCOP itself would be available. The tickets were in the names of Li Qiang Wu and Ma Yong Feng, common names for Chinese men and for whom specific individuals had yet to be selected. It would be easy to produce backdated passports and other documents once China’s needs were identified more precisely.

第二种选择的困难在于可能为时已晚。到 FCOP 时，代码可能已经发布。因此，我们开发了另一种选择。

The difficulty with this second option was that it might be too late. By the time of FCOP itself, the code might conceivably have been released. So an additional option had been developed.

因素人可能有时会乘飞机旅行。如果有必要，我们会摧毁这架飞机。

Factor Man presumably traveled by air at times. If need be, we would destroy the aircraft in question.

这样做需要使用成都歼-20，这是中国空军唯一的隐形战斗机。歼-20 大致相当于美国的 F-22，在从受入侵的洛克希德计算机中获取 F-35 规格后，歼-20 的设计已与美国洛克希德 F-35 进行了仔细比较。

Doing so would require the use of Chengdu J-20’s, the sole stealth fighter in the Chinese Air Force. The J-20 was the approximate equivalent of the American F-22, and the J-20 design had been compared carefully to that of the American Lockheed F-35 after the F-35 specifications had been obtained from compromised Lockheed computers.

不幸的是，歼-20不具备舰载能力。

Unfortunately, the J-20 was not carrier capable.

中国唯一的远洋航母是辽宁号，由当时的苏联于 1985 年开始建造。苏联解体后，建造工作停止，经过一段相对漫长的旅程，这艘航母终于来到我们手中。它主要用于训练目的，但部署也在其潜在使用范围内。

China’s only blue water aircraft carrier was the Liaoning, built beginning in 1985 by the then-Soviet Union. Construction was halted when the Soviet Union broke apart and, after a relatively lengthy journey, the vessel came to us. It is used primarily for training purposes, but deployment is within its potential scope of use.

辽宁号最多可携带 24 架沈阳歼-15。不幸的是，老式的歼-15 不是隐形飞机，不适合在美国领空执行任何任务。

The Liaoning can carry up to 24 Shenyang J-15’s. Unfortunately, the older J-15’s are not stealthy aircraft and are unsuitable for any mission in United States airspace.

然而，我们确实有一架歼-20，它经过改装，使用新的 WS-20 喷气发动机，并进一步配备了弯曲喷嘴技术。这将使歼-20 具有近乎垂直的起飞和降落能力。虽然这艘船会受到一些损坏，但它能够从辽宁舰起飞，在美国上空执行任务，然后返回辽宁舰，飞行员将弹射，飞机将被遗弃。这些行动本身将归咎于叛徒中国飞行员的行为。与任务的外交成本相比，歼-20 的损失可能仍然微不足道，但比什么都不做要好得多。

We did, however, have one J-20 that had been modified to use the new WS-20 jet engine, further equipped with curved nozzle technology. This would give the J-20 nearly vertical takeoff and landing capabilities. Although there would be some damage to the ship, it would be able to take off from the Liaoning, execute a mission over the United States, and return to the Liaoning, where the pilot would eject and the aircraft would be abandoned. The actions themselves would be attributed to the behavior of a renegade Chinese airman. The loss of the J-20 would still likely pale in comparison to the diplomatic cost of the mission, but would be far preferable to taking no action at all.

如果所有计划都失败了，而 Factor Man 成功地将他的技术公之于众，那又会怎样呢？没有第四个计划。没有必要；一旦代码泄露出去，就太晚了。

And if all of the plans failed, and Factor Man succeeded in releasing his technology to the world? There was no fourth plan. There was no need for one; once the code was out, it would be too late.

21

21

伯克特

Burkett

2021 年 4 月 22 日，距离 FCOP 还有 12 周

April 22, 2021, twelve weeks to FCOP

P=NP，黎曼假设成立

P=NP, and the Riemann Hypothesis is True

威廉·伯克特，《纽约时报》

William Burkett, The New York Times

苹果公司今天宣布，它已经利用两年前从 Factor Man 获得许可的技术证明了黎曼猜想和P=NP 。在这两种情况下，证明都是由从原始 Factor Man 代码衍生的软件自动生成的。

Apple today announced that it had proven both the Riemann Hypothesis and that P=NP using technology the tech giant licensed from Factor Man just under two years ago. In both cases, the proofs were generated automatically by software derived from the original Factor Man code.

黎曼猜想类似于费马大定理，虽然更晦涩一些，但还是说明了一些东西。费马大定理说，如果n是大于 2 的整数，则不存在正整数a、b和c使得a n + b n = c n。自 1637 年法国法学家和数学家皮埃尔·费马提出该定理以来，该定理一直未得到证实，直到 1994 年英国数学家安德鲁·怀尔斯证明了该定理。自 1859 年德国数学家伯恩哈德·黎曼提出黎曼猜想以来，黎曼猜想一直未得到证实。

The Riemann Hypothesis is like Fermat’s Last Theorem, although a bit more obscure, which is saying something. Fermat’s Last Theorem says that if n is an integer greater than two, there are no positive integers a, b, and c such that an + bn = cn. The Theorem remained unproved from the time it was suggested by French jurist and mathematician Pierre Fermat in 1637 until the British mathematician Andrew Wiles proved it in 1994. The Riemann Hypothesis has been unproven since the German mathematician Bernhard Riemann conjectured it in 1859.

苹果发现的证明大约有 3,000 页，目前正在接受多位知名数学家的审查。苹果还表示，同一软件发现了费马大定理的证明，证实了怀尔斯的结果。费马证明要短得多，大约 1,000 页。它也是数学界目前密切关注的课题。

The proof discovered by Apple is approximately 3,000 pages long and is currently being examined by a variety of respected mathematicians. Apple has also indicated that the same software discovered a proof of Fermat’s Last Theorem, confirming Wiles’ result. The Fermat proof is considerably shorter, some 1,000 pages. It, too, is the current subject of considerable scrutiny by the mathematical community.

费马大定理和黎曼猜想都没有什么实用价值，尽管黎曼猜想与素数分布有关，因此可以预期对加密技术产生了一些影响。然而，因子人能够分解任意大小的数字，这使得该技术变得毫无意义。

Both Fermat’s Last Theorem and the Riemann Hypothesis are of little practical value, although the Riemann Hypothesis bears on the distribution of prime numbers and could therefore be expected to have had some impact on encryption technology. However, Factor Man’s ability to factor numbers of arbitrary size renders that technology moot.

苹果声称的P=NP证明则大不相同，最终以无可辩驳的方式验证了因子人的理论，并因此具有巨大的实用价值。然而，苹果拒绝在这种情况下公布证明，称该证明是“建设性的”，因为它揭示了一种构建与因子人相当的软件的机制。苹果声称，正因为如此，他们与因子人的许可协议禁止他们向国际数学界或广大公众公布该证明。他们承诺将于 7 月 11 日，即 FCOP 的第二天公布该证明。

Apple’s claimed proof that P=NP would be quite different, finally validating the Factor Man work in an irrefutable way and having immense practical value as a result. Apple, however, has declined to release the proof in this case, stating that the proof is “constructive” in that it reveals a mechanism for building software equivalent to Factor Man’s. Apple claims that because of this, their license agreement with Factor Man precludes their releasing the proof to either the international mathematical community or to the public at large. They have promised to release the proof on July 11, the day after FCOP.

因子人

Factor Man

2021 年 5 月 1 日，距离 FCOP 还有 10 周

May 1, 2021, ten weeks to FCOP

发件人：Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

From: Factor Man (factorman0@gmail.com)

收件人：Erin Keenan (erinok@gmail.com)

To: Erin Keenan (erinok@gmail.com)

主题：FCOP

Subject: FCOP

亲爱的基南先生：

Dear Mr. Keenan:

我很高兴邀请您和您选择的 29 位朋友或同事一起参加 FCOP。我将为您提供活动前后两晚帕萨迪纳附近的房间，并提供往返 FCOP 的私人飞机交通服务。请安排您的客人在活动前一天在一两个城市会面，以便将他们带到洛杉矶。

It is my pleasure to invite you, together with twenty-nine friends or colleagues of your choice, to FCOP. I will provide you with rooms near Pasadena for the nights before and after the event, and transportation to and from FCOP by private jet. Please arrange for your guests to meet in one or two cities on the day prior to the event so that they can be brought to Los Angeles.

我确实要求您在 FCOP 前一个月之前向我提供您的客人姓名，以及如果需要的话将安排交通的第二个城市的位置。我假设第一个城市就是您自己居住的城市。

I do ask that you provide me with the names of your guests no later than one calendar month before FCOP, along with the location of the second city from which transportation is to be arranged if needed. I will assume that the first city will be the city in which you yourself reside.

我还要求你们对出席活动保密。如果媒体得知你们出席活动，你们的所有门票都将被取消。如果媒体得知你们的任何一位嘉宾出席活动，该嘉宾的门票也将被取消。如果媒体确认你们有三位或以上嘉宾出席活动，你们的所有门票都将被取消。

I also ask that you keep your attendance confidential. If the press learns of your attendance, all of your tickets will be canceled. If the press learns of the attendance of any of your guests, that guest’s ticket will be canceled. If three or more of your guests are identified by the press, all of your tickets will be canceled.

我只需要你提供你的客人姓名和第二机场的位置。如果你不感兴趣参加，你甚至不需要回复这条消息。

All I need is for you to provide me with the names of your guests and the location of the second airport. If you are not interested in attending, you need not even reply to this message.

调频

FM

最后，Jess 挑选的十位计算机专家全都接受了我的邀请。我之前从未听说过他们中的任何一个人，媒体也没有发现任何消息。在 FCOP 那天，我就可以躲在众目睽睽之下了。

In the end, all ten of the computer folks Jess picked accepted my invitation. I had never heard of any of them, and the press discovered nothing. On the day of FCOP, I would be able to hide in plain sight.

刘

Liu

2021 年 5 月 8 日，距离 FCOP 还有九周

May 8, 2021, nine weeks to FCOP

我们费尽心机从扩大的 Factor Man 候选人名单中剔除了 13%。不幸的是，我们用尽了 FCOP 之前的大部分时间。我们无法访问美国计算机网络，这被证明是一个令人惊讶的巨大障碍。

We had painstakingly eliminated 13% of our expanded list of Factor Man candidates. Unfortunately, we had used the bulk of the time available before FCOP. Our lack of access to the American computer network had proved to be a surprisingly large impediment.

还剩下 75,236 个名字，根据我们目前的进度，我们有足够的时间以合理的谨慎程度检查其中的约两千个名字。我们及时识别出 Factor Man 的机会很小。

There were 75,236 names remaining and, based on our current rate of progress, we had enough time to examine about two thousand of them with the care reasonably required. Our chances of identifying Factor Man in time were slim.

我知道这是不可接受的结果。但我不知道该怎么做。

I knew that this was an unacceptable result. What I did not know was what I might do about it.

大中华区也无能为力。宣布我们反对公布该准则是毫无意义的。美国政府曾进行过试探性调查，表示如果该准则被公开，中国将停止投资美国债务。新任美国总统发表了一次广为流传的电视讲话作为回应。

There was little that greater China could do as well. Announcing that we were opposed to the release of the code would be pointless. Tentative inquiries had been made of the United States government, indicating that China would cease investing in American debt if the code were made public. The new American president made a widely televised speech in response.

...正如你们许多人所知，使我们能够做到这些事情的代码，即计算机程序，计划在两个多月后向公众开放。

… As many of you know, the code that has allowed us to do these things, the computer program, is scheduled to be made publicly available in a little over two months.

美国对此表示欢迎。虽然拥有 Factor Man 代码的独家使用权确实让我们在国家安全和经济稳定方面取得了前所未有的进步，但现在是时候让这些能力服务于我们所有人了，而不仅仅是那些有幸生活在特定国家的人。

America welcomes this. While it is true that having exclusive access to the Factor Man code has allowed us to make unprecedented strides both in national security and in the stability of our economy, it is time for these abilities to serve all of us, not just those fortunate enough to live in a particular country.

这些好处也不应仅限于某个特定行业。是的，苹果在过去几年里取得了惊人的成就。但谷歌、Facebook、微软、汽车制造商、制药公司以及美国工业的每一个环节都可以利用这项技术更高效地运作。他们可以提供更好的产品，而且成本更低。在美国和国外，公民——所有公民——都将从这些进步中受益。科学不会因种族、信仰、年龄、宗教、残疾或性取向而有所区别。这项技术应该属于我们每个人，地球上的每个男人、女人和孩子。

Nor should the benefits be restricted to a particular industry. Yes, Apple has done amazing things over the past couple years. But Google, and Facebook, and Microsoft, and the automakers, and the pharmaceutical companies, and every element of American industry can operate more efficiently given this technology. They can provide better products, and provide them for less money. In America and abroad, citizens – all citizens – will benefit from these advances. Science does not distinguish on the basis of race, or creed, or age, or religion, or disability, or sexual orientation. This technology should belong to every one of us, every man, woman and child on the face of the earth.

它会的。

And it will.

当然，并不是所有人都有这种感觉。有些国家靠压迫其公民而存在。通过限制他们的知识，并通过这些限制，限制他们的自由。

Of course, not everyone feels this way. Some nations exist by oppressing their citizens. By limiting their knowledge and, through those limitations, by limiting their freedoms.

对于那些国家，我要说：“够了。”我要说：“不再如此。”我要说，知识属于所有人，政府无权否认这一点。

To those nations, I say, “Enough.” I say, “No longer.” I say that knowledge belongs to all people, and that it is not the place of government to deny it.

现在，这项技术属于一个人。我很高兴他选择与美国政府分享这项技术，更高兴的是他选择与全世界分享这项技术。美国政府对这些行动表示赞赏，并将尽一切努力予以支持。

Right now, this technology belongs to one man. I am pleased that he has chosen to share it with the American government, and more pleased still that he has chosen to share it with the world. This government applauds those actions and will do everything it can to support them.

私下里，总统曾告诉我们，由于美国政府即将出现盈余，如果中国人不再想购买美国政府支持的证券，他也没意见。

Privately, the president had let us know that with the US government about to be running at a surplus, if the Chinese no longer wanted to purchase US government-backed securities, that was just fine with him.

如果没有 Factor Man 的参与以确保此类事件的发生，我们对美国政府公布密码的承诺表示严重怀疑，因此我们所有可行的选择都取决于在 FCOP 之前确认 Factor Man 本人的身份。

We had serious doubts about the American government’s commitment to releasing the code if Factor Man were not around to ensure that such an event transpired, and all of our viable options thus depended on identifying Factor Man himself prior to FCOP.

正当我为此苦思冥想的时候，许艳敲响了我办公室的门。

I was brooding over this when Xu Yan knocked on my office door.

徐是在最近一次改组时加入团队的。他脸色苍白，书呆子气十足，美国人称之为书呆子。身高一般，头发比一般人稍长，而且打理得也不太好。我看不出他和同事有什么不同，于是疲惫地抬起头，请他进来坐下。

Xu had been added to the team in the most recent reorganization. He was pale and bookish, what Americans would call a nerd. Average height, hair slightly longer than average and slightly less well-kept. I had seen nothing to distinguish him from his colleagues, and looked up wearily as I invited him in and to sit down.

“我一直在考虑 Factor Man 的护照，”他开始说道。

“I’ve been thinking about Factor Man’s passport,” he began.

“和？”

“And?”

“我们知道他于 2018 年 6 月 8 日在维也纳。这是我们掌握的最大线索之一，当时有一名美国人在欧洲。”

“We know he was in Vienna on June 8, 2018. That is one of the biggest clues we have, an American in Europe then.”

“是的。”我没时间做这些。

“Yes.” I had no time for this.

“我们之所以知道这一点，是因为他参观过斯巴达的包厢……不管它叫什么名字。”

“And we know that because he visited the box at Sparta … Sparta whatever it was called.”

我等着他告诉我一些我不知道的事情。

I waited for him to tell me something I didn’t know.

“而且你在那里看见了他。这是第一次有人真正看见他。”

“And you saw him there. The one time someone has actually seen him.”

“严，你的观点是什么？”

“Your point, Yan?”

“他是怎么租到这个包厢的？”

“How did he rent the box?”

这是一个非常简单的问题，以前没有人想到要问。

An absurdly simple question, which no one previously had thought to ask.

“我是这样认为的，”徐继续说道，“我认为他亲自租了这个箱子。否则他怎么拿到钥匙的？他肯定不会给斯巴达人一个地址，让他们把钥匙寄给他。所以他以前去过欧洲。”

“Here’s what I think,” Xu continued. “I think he rented the box in person. How else would he get the keys? Surely he wouldn’t have given the Sparta people an address and asked them to send them to him. So he’s been to Europe before.”

在访问欧洲的美国人中，只有一小部分人以前去过那里。对大多数人来说，这是一生一次的旅行。我打开电脑，想知道有多少美国人是欧洲的回头客。

Of the Americans visiting Europe, only a small fraction has been there before. For most, it’s a once-in-a-lifetime trip. I turned to my computer, to find out what fraction of Americans in Europe were return visitors.

“但是等一下，”他说，“还有更多。他什么时候租的这个箱子？”

“But wait,” he said. “There’s more. When did he rent the box?”

这是我们忽略了的另一个显而易见的问题。

Another obvious question that we had neglected to ask.

“我认为他是在威廉·伯克特第一篇专栏之前租的。想想看。当 Factor Man 联系伯克特时，他肯定已经制定了整个计划，或者几乎已经制定好了。我们在每个环节都看到了这一点。整个计划都是提前制定好的。更重要的是，我认为他一准备好就联系了伯克特。我们见过他操作。他很享受这种感觉。他喜欢被关注，他喜欢贬低中国。我猜，他一知道他的技术有效，就把一切都付诸行动了。他去了维也纳，拿到了保险箱，然后联系了伯克特。”

“I think he rented it just before the first William Burkett column. Consider. By the time Factor Man contacted Burkett, he certainly had his entire plan worked out, or nearly so. We’ve seen that at every turn. The whole plan was established in advance. What’s more, I think he contacted Burkett that first time as soon as he was ready. We’ve seen him operate. He enjoys this. He enjoys the attention, and he enjoys belittling China. My guess is that as soon as he knew his technology worked, he put everything in motion. He went to Vienna, got the safe deposit box, and contacted Burkett.”

这很有道理。“这意味着我们可以把注意力集中在不仅在 2018 年 6 月 8 日在欧洲的美国人身上，而且在 2017 年 5 月 14 日左右也在欧洲的美国人身上，”我回答道。我早就记住了第一篇伯克特文章的日期。

It made sense. “So that means that we can restrict our attention to Americans who were in Europe not just on June 8, 2018, but around May 14, 2017 as well,” I responded. I had long since committed the date of the first Burkett article to memory.

“确切地。”

“Exactly.”

我转身回到电脑前，想知道这额外的知识能带来多大的变化。

I turned back to my computer, wondering how much of a difference that additional piece of knowledge might make.

“我已经知道了，”徐说。“我进行了调查，寻找符合我们现有资料，且在 2017 年 5 月 14 日后的两周内去过欧洲的美国人。”

“I already know,” Xu said. “I ran it, looking for Americans who fit our existing profile but also were in Europe within two weeks of May 14, 2017.”

“和？”

“And?”

“现在我们剩下的 75,000 个名字已经不多了。我们只剩下 2,461 个了。”

“And we no longer have 75,000 names remaining. We have 2,461.”

伯克特

Burkett

2021 年 6 月 5 日，距离 FCOP 还有五周

June 5, 2021, five weeks to FCOP

在这个科技时代，研究生院已经有所不同。

Graduate school is different in this age of technology.

例如，在 Google 上搜索“购买学期论文”，看看会得到什么。有很多组织可以付费帮你写学期论文。

As an example, Google “buy a term paper” and see what you get. There is a whole host of organizations out there that will write one for you for a fee.

例如 EssayViking.com。每页 13 美元，他们可以写一篇论文、一篇文章、一篇大学入学论文，随便什么都可以。一切都是保密的。他们的作者都是专业人士。实际上，他们说，“我们只聘请拥有硕士和博士学位的毕业生。”

EssayViking.com, for example. For $13 a page, they’ll write an essay, an article, a college entrance essay, you name it. Everything is confidential. Their writers are professionals. Actually, they say, “We hire only graduated with MA and PhD diplomas.”

所以也许它们并不是最好的选择。

So maybe they aren’t the best choice after all.

但是，市面上有很多这样的服务，它们都很乐意为你做作业。但要收费。在当今竞争激烈的世界里，人们根本不像以前那样认真对待荣誉准则。这里顺便提一句：英国牛津大学直到最近才颁发文凭。感觉没有人会撒谎说自己拥有牛津学位。啊，希望有更温和的日子……

But there are a ton of such services out there, all happy to do your homework for you. For a fee. In today’s overly competitive world, people simply don’t take honor codes as seriously as they used to. Just a side note here: Oxford University in the United Kingdom didn’t even give you a diploma until recently. The feeling was that no one would ever lie about having an Oxford degree. Ah, for gentler days …

当我还是一名研究生时，这已经成为一个问题。后来一位教授决定反击。

When I was a graduate student, this was becoming a problem. And then one of the professors decided to strike back.

他使用了文体测量学。

He used stylometry.

什么？

What?

根据维基百科，文体学是“语言风格研究的应用……用于确定匿名或有争议文件的作者。它既有法律应用，也有学术和文学应用，从莎士比亚作品的作者问题到法医语言学。”瓦萨学院教授唐纳德·福斯特使用这种技术（正确地）得出结论，《原色》一书的作者是乔·克莱因。

Stylometry, according to Wikipedia, is “the application of the study of linguistic style … to attribute authorship to anonymous or disputed documents. It has legal as well as academic and literary applications, ranging from the question of the authorship of Shakespeare’s works to forensic linguistics.” Vassar professor Donald Foster used this technique to conclude (correctly) that the book Primary Colors was written by Joe Klein.

《原色》虽然自称是一部虚构作品，但显然是一部揭露比尔·克林顿首次总统竞选的小说。作者是“匿名”，这是一个明智的选择，因为书中描述了总统候选人的性不忠行为，而这些行为显然是以克林顿为原型的。

Primary Colors, while purporting to be a work of fiction, was clearly an exposé of sorts about Bill Clinton’s first presidential campaign. The author was “Anonymous”, a prudent choice given the book’s description of, for example, sexual infidelities on the part of a presidential candidate clearly modeled after Mr. Clinton.

尽管福斯特进行了文体分析，克莱因最初还是否认自己是作者。但《原色》手稿的早期版本中包含手写笔记，证实了福斯特的结论，克莱因的身份被揭穿。

In spite of Foster’s stylometric analysis, Klein initially denied being the author. But an early version of the Primary Colors manuscript contained handwritten notes that confirmed Foster’s conclusion, and Klein was outed.

我的一位德克萨斯大学奥斯汀分校的教授决定对学期论文做类似的事情。一位名叫 Neil Yager 的人（奇怪的是，他住在牛津）制作了一个在线工具，你可以用它来分析各种写作样本，看看哪些似乎有共同的作者。通过使用此工具分析他入门社会学课程的一些论文，这位教授发现，大多数学生的风格相当独特，这并不奇怪。该软件将他们每个人识别为他们每篇论文最有可能的作者。

One of my UT Austin professors decided to do something similar with term papers. A guy named Neil Yager – living in Oxford, curiously enough – put together an online tool where you could analyze various writing samples and see which appeared to have a common author. By using this tool with some essays from his introductory sociology course, the professor found that most of the students had, not surprisingly, a fairly distinctive style. The software identified each of them as the most likely author of each of their essays.

但对一组学生来说，情况并非如此。例如，学生 1 提交的论文可能与学生 2 提交的论文更相似，而不是与学生 1 的其他作业更相似。更重要的是，这些学生都是朋友。教授得出结论——最终证明这是正确的——他们都在使用其中一种论文生成服务，并让相对少数的作者之一撰写所有论文。这些学生都被迫离开大学，现在无疑正忙于在其他地方实践他们缺乏道德的行为。

But there was one group of students for whom this wasn’t true. An essay submitted by student 1, for example, might resemble an essay submitted by student 2 more closely than it resembled any of student 1’s other assignments. What’s more, the students in question were all friends. The professor concluded – correctly, as it eventually turned out – that they were all using one of these essay generation services, and getting one of a relative handful of authors to write all of their papers. The students were all forced to leave the university, and are doubtless now busy exercising their lack of morals elsewhere.

我突然想到，我可以对 Factor Man 博客做类似的事情。我有大量这个人的写作样本，而且我保留了很久以来的所有电子邮件。我可以通过 Yager 的工具（或我最终找到的各种更复杂的文体工具）来分析这些样本，假设 Factor Man 是我的通信者，我就能猜出他是谁。

It occurred to me that I could try something similar with the Factor Man blog. I had a reasonably large sample of the guy’s writing, and I had kept all of my email from time immemorial. I could run it through Yager’s tool (or any of a variety of more sophisticated stylometric tools that I would eventually find) and, assuming that Factor Man was a correspondent of mine, I could figure out who he was.

嗯，至少值得一试。

Well, it was at least worth a shot.

整个过程大约持续了一周。最后，我并没有比刚开始时更聪明。Factor Man 的博客文章读起来不像我的任何电子邮件。

The whole thing took about a week. At the end, I was no wiser than I was at the beginning. Factor Man’s blog posts didn’t read like any of my e-correspondence.

星期四凌晨两点左右，我收到了这个令人欣喜的消息。我隐约觉得还有其他办法可以尝试，但什么也想不起来。我太累了，爬上床，躺在艾玛身边。她语无伦次地嘟囔着，我陪她一起睡着了。

I received this delightful news at about two on a Thursday morning. I had this vague feeling that there was something else I could try, but nothing came to mind. I was too tired, and crawled into bed next to Emma. She mumbled incoherently and I joined her in sleep.

哈德森

Hudson

2021 年 6 月 11 日，距离 FCOP 还有四周

June 11, 2021, four weeks to FCOP

距离 FCOP 不到一个月，我被召回斯塔基的办公室。在那里，我见到了斯塔基局长、中央情报局局长约翰·哈比森和一名我不认识的海军军官。

With just under a month to go before FCOP, I was summoned back to Starkey’s office. There I found Director Starkey, CIA director John Harbison, and a Navy officer I didn’t recognize.

哈比森是在参议院听证会上被任命为中央情报局局长的，听证会上有一些争议，其中包括肯塔基州参议员兰德·保罗的阻挠议事。保罗的抱怨更多的是对美国无人机计划（哈比森从 2012 年开始监督该计划）而不是哈比森本人。无人机计划冒犯了保罗的孤立主义倾向。在奥巴马白宫做出适度让步后，哈比森被任命。

Harbison had been appointed CIA director after a somewhat contentious Senate hearing that had included a filibuster by Kentucky Senator Rand Paul. Paul’s complaint was more with the American drone program (which Harbison had overseen starting in 2012) than with Harbison himself. The drone program offended Paul’s isolationist tendencies. After a modest concession from the Obama White House, Harbison was confirmed.

我被介绍给海军军官马克·布莱克比上将。这位秃头的布莱克比上将是美国太平洋舰队司令 COMPACFLT。

I was introduced to the Navy officer, Admiral Mark Blackaby. The bald Admiral Blackaby was COMPACFLT, the commander of the US Pacific fleet.

我是一名特工。

And I was a Special Agent.

哈比森首先发言。他说，中国人决定消灭“因子人”，即使这意味着要在美国领土上消灭。他们的目标是不惜一切代价阻止“因子人”技术的泄露。

Harbison spoke first. The Chinese, he said, had decided to eliminate Factor Man, even if that meant doing so on American soil. Their goal was to prevent the release of the Factor Man technology by any means necessary.

我问，这样的计划是否可行。在这种情况下，美国政府难道不会尊重 Factor Man 的意愿，代他发布代码吗？

I asked if such a plan would work. Wouldn’t the US government simply honor Factor Man’s wishes in such a case by releasing the code on his behalf?

沒有人回答。

No one answered.

“不管结果如何，”斯塔基继续说道，“‘因子人’很可能是我国境内的美国公民。保护他的责任落在了我们的身上。而要保护他，我们必须找到他。”

“Result notwithstanding,” Starkey continued, “Factor Man is presumably an American citizen within our national boundaries. Protecting him falls to us. And to protect him, we have to find him.”

我知道这会发生什么，我不太喜欢。但是 COMPACFLT 在这里做什么？

I could tell where this was going, and I didn’t like it much. But what was COMPACFLT doing here?

布莱克比上将把一张大画推过桌子，问我是否知道那是什么。我告诉他，那幅画看起来像一艘老式航空母舰。

Admiral Blackaby answered by sliding a large picture across the table and asking me if I knew what it was. I told him that it looked like an old aircraft carrier.

“是的，”他告诉我。“卫星照片。1985 年由俄罗斯海军服役，1992 年退役。被中国人购买，2012 年重新下水。这是他们唯一的深水航母，目前距离加州海岸五百英里。”

“It is,” he told me. “Satellite picture. Commissioned by the Russian Navy in 1985, decommissioned in 1992. Bought by the Chinese and relaunched in 2012. It’s their only deep water carrier, and right now, it’s five hundred miles off the California coast.”

他指着航母甲板上的一架飞机说：“你看到了吗？这是歼-20，中国唯一的隐形战斗机。它甚至不能在航母上起飞。我们估计它起飞一次就够了，然后就会坠入水中。”

He pointed to a plane on the carrier’s deck. “And you see this? It’s a Chengdu J-20, China’s one and only stealth fighter. It’s not even carrier capable. We figure it’s good for one takeoff and then it’ll wind up ditching in the water.

“那架歼-20 只会执行一次任务。而且不难弄清楚那次任务是什么。”

“That J-20 is going to fly exactly one mission. And it’s not too hard to figure out what that mission is meant to be.”

布莱克比继续解释道，辽宁号目前正处于以乔治·H·W·布什号航空母舰为中心的第二航母打击群（CSG-2）的跟踪之下。一颗卫星也被调来提供监视。但尽管采取了所有可能的预防措施，歼-20 的发射被发现的可能性仍然微乎其微，而当歼-20 开始执行其进入美国领空的预定任务时，追踪该飞机的可能性则更小。

Blackaby went on to explain that the Liaoning was currently being shadowed by CSG-2, Carrier Strike Group 2 centered around the USS George HW Bush. A satellite had been diverted to provide surveillance as well. But with all the precautions possible, the odds were still no better than even that a launch of the J-20 would be detected, and smaller still that it would be possible to track the plane as it embarked on its presumed mission into American airspace.

如果我们不能从一开始就追踪任务，我们就必须从目标开始追踪。同样，保护 Factor Man 意味着找到 Factor Man。

If we couldn’t track the mission from its beginning, we would have to track it from its target. Again, protecting Factor Man meant finding Factor Man.

“那么，约翰，”斯塔基开始说道。

“So, John,” Starkey began.

当联邦调查局局长直呼你的名字时，你就知道你完蛋了。

When the director of the FBI calls you by your first name, you know you’re screwed.

“我们比以往任何时候都更需要找到关键人物，”他继续说道。“弄清楚他到底是谁。你已经关注这个问题很多年了。告诉我们。他是谁？”

“We need, more than ever, to find Factor Man,” he continued. “To figure out who he actually is. You’ve been looking at this for years. Tell us. Who is he?”

我承认我不知道。“我们和中国人有同样的视频。我们比他们能接触到更多的数据和美国人。自从我们改进了系统安全性以来，情况尤其如此。但他一直保持着令人难以置信的低调，在过去一年左右的时间里比以往任何时候都要低调。什么都不管用。他是个幽灵。”

I confessed to not knowing. “We have the same video the Chinese do. We have access to more data, and to more Americans, than they do. That’s especially true since we improved our system security. But he keeps an incredibly low profile, lower than ever for the past year or so. Nothing works. He’s a ghost.”

“如果你试过的方法都不奏效，”斯塔基告诉我，“那就试试别的方法。你需要多少特工就有多少资源。通过你的 SAC 进行协调。”

“If nothing you’ve tried works,” Starkey told me, “Try something else. As many agents as you need. As many resources of any kind. Coordinate it through your SAC.”

我只希望斯塔基能告诉我我还应该尝试什么。

I wished only that Starkey had told me what the something else was that I was expected to try.

22

22

伯克特

Burkett

2021 年 6 月 19 日，距离 FCOP 还有三周

June 19, 2021, three weeks to FCOP

我告诉艾玛我不再和她说话了。

I told Emma I was no longer speaking to her.

“为什么不呢？”她问道。“哦，对了。你没跟我说话，所以你没法解释。”

“Why not?” she asked. “Oh, that’s right. You’re not talking to me, so you can’t explain it.”

“你嘲笑我的说话方式。”

“You make fun of how I talk.”

“我的确喜欢你。你写了很多专栏文章，很多技术性的东西，措辞也非常优美。但面对面交流就不一样了。”她吻了我一下。“我觉得你的嘴比你的脑子要快。”

“I do. It’s adorable. You write all these columns, all these technical things with beautifully turned phrases. But face to face, it’s different.” She kissed me. “I think your mouth gets ahead of your brain.”

她说得有道理。我张嘴想回应，但又改变了主意。

She had a point. I opened my mouth to respond, but thought better of it.

“很好，”她说。“练习一下。”

“That’s good,” she said. “Practice that.”

我写字的方式是这样的，但说话的方式是不同的。每个人都是这样的。我们都有独特的举止，无论是口头的还是书面的。

I write one way, but speak another. Everyone does that. We all have unique mannerisms, be they spoken or written.

就是这样。

That was it.

博客不同于电子邮件。也许我的信件与 Factor Man 博客不符的原因是 Factor Man 本人在写博客时和在写笔记时是不同的。

A blog isn’t the same as email. Maybe the reason none of my correspondence matched the Factor Man blog was because Factor Man himself was different when he was blogging and when he was just writing a note.

我可以做点什么。

And I could do something about it.

Factor Man 从未真正与我通信过；只是很久以前发过一封短信。但他与 Jess MacMurray 通信过。他与她通信过很多次。我保留了所有通信内容。

Factor Man had never really corresponded with me; just that short note from an eternity ago. But he had corresponded with Jess MacMurray. He had corresponded with her a lot. And I had all of it.

于是我重复了前几周的所有努力。但我没有尝试匹配博客，而是将我的电子邮件联系人与 Factor Man 发送给 Jess 的电子邮件进行匹配。

So I repeated all of my effort of the previous weeks. But instead of trying to match the blog, I matched my email contacts with the emails Factor Man had sent to Jess.

两天后我知道了。

And two days later, I knew.

* * *

* * *

知道是一回事，知道如何利用这些知识又是另一回事。

Knowing was one thing. Knowing what to do with that knowledge was something else entirely.

我告诉了艾玛，这样就把问题稍微推后了一点。她也不知道我该怎么办。

I told Emma, thereby pushing the problem slightly into the future. She didn’t know what I should do, either.

我还能告诉谁？

Who else could I tell?

我可以告诉全世界。我的记者生涯就此确定了。但我怀疑 Factor Man 有充分的理由希望再保护一段时间他的隐私。他比我更仔细地考虑了这一切，看来我应该相信他的判断。

I could tell the world. My career as a journalist would be set. But I suspected that Factor Man had good reasons for wanting to protect his privacy for a bit longer. He had thought all of this out far more carefully than I had, and it seemed likely that I should trust his judgment here.

我可以告诉约翰·哈德森。

I could tell John Hudson.

决不。

No way.

唯一真正需要知道的人是艾玛，而我已经告诉她了。

The only person who really needed to know was Emma, and I had already told her.

所以最后我决定不告诉任何人。

So in the end, I decided to tell no one.

好吧，也不是没人。我告诉 Factor Man。

Well, not quite no one. I told Factor Man.

我刚刚给他发了一封电子邮件。不是发到 factorman0@gmail.com，而是发到他的个人电子邮件地址。上面简单地写着：“请记得邀请我参加你的聚会。”

I just sent him an email. Not to factorman0@gmail.com, but to his personal email address. It said simply, “Please remember to invite me to your party.”

他回复得非常迅速。“我已经在名单上了。”

The reply was predictably brisk. I was already on the list, he said.

* * *

* * *

几天后我收到的消息更加详细。

The message I got a few days later was considerably more detailed.

从：

From:

收件人：William Burkett （wburkett@nytimes.com）

To: William Burkett (wburkett@nytimes.com)

主题：FCOP

Subject: FCOP

嘿，威廉：

Hey William:

嗯，猜猜看。

Well, guess what.

一群计算机科学家（包括我！）被随机选中参加 FCOP。不仅如此，我们每个人都可以邀请 29 位朋友。这确实是一次全额付费的假期，包括活动前后的酒店住宿以及往返交通。交通包括从您选择的机场乘坐私人飞机。

A bunch of computer scientists – including me! – got selected at random to go to FCOP. Not only that, we each get to invite 29 friends. It’s truly an all-expenses paid vacation, including a hotel stay before and after the event, and transportation to and from. Transportation including a ride by PRIVATE JET from an airport of your choice.

你想去吗？抱歉这么晚才通知，但我也是最近才听说的。你甚至可以带一位客人。（我听说你订婚了；带她去吧！）

Do you want to go? Sorry for the short notice, but I only heard fairly recently myself. You even get to bring a guest. (I heard through the grapevine that you’re engaged; bring her!)

一个警告：这必须保密。如果媒体发现你要去，你的邀请就会被取消。如果他们发现我的三位或更多客人的身份，我们所有人都会被取消。请不要这样对我！

One caveat: This has to be a secret. If the press finds out you’re going, your invitation gets canceled. If they find out the identities of three or more of my guests, we all get canceled. Please don’t do that to me!

那么：你说什么？很高兴再次见到你，毕竟这是本世纪的聚会。

So: what say? It would be great to see you again, and it is, after all, the party of the century.

或者说我是这样听说的。:)

Or so I’m told. :)

哈德森

Hudson

2021 年 6 月 19 日，距离 FCOP 还有三周

June 19, 2021, three weeks to FCOP

我们掌握了所有这些法医证据。根据 Janet Liu 离开欧洲的日期，我们知道 Factor Man 大约在 2018 年 6 月 8 日去过欧洲。我们知道他有多高，体重是多少。我们知道他的鼻子长什么样。

We had all these bits of forensic evidence. Based on the date that Janet Liu had left Europe, we knew Factor Man had been in Europe on approximately June 8, 2018. We knew how tall he was, and how much he weighed. We knew what his nose looked like.

我们拥有世界上最好的计算机。

And we had the best computers on the planet.

不幸的是，这些都毫无价值。

Unfortunately, none of it was worth squat.

有得必有失。但当你受到联邦调查局和中央情报局局长以及美国太平洋舰队司令的监视时，你真的不想被归为“有失”一类。

You win some, you lose some. But when you’re being watched by the directors of the FBI and the CIA, along with the commander of the US Pacific Fleet, that really wasn’t when you wanted to be in “lose some” category.

是的，我们有大量物证。

Yeah, we had a ton of physical evidence.

不管实物证据。我决定做我们在每个人都随身携带超级计算机之前做的事情。

Screw the physical evidence. I decided to do what we did before everyone carried a supercomputer around in their pocket.

我会追随金钱。

I would follow the money.

2018 年 6 月 8 日左右，Factor Man 出现在一段拍摄于维也纳集市广场的视频中。广场上的一家商店是 Sparta Safes，一家私人保险箱存放处。因此，毫不夸张地说，Factor Man 此次造访的目的地是斯巴达。

On about June 8, 2018, Factor Man had appeared in a video taken at a market square in Vienna. One of the shops in that square was Sparta Safes, a private safe depository. It wasn’t too much of a stretch to conclude that Sparta had been Factor Man’s destination when he visited.

如果这是真的，那么 Factor Man 大概是在用保险箱里的物品购买某种服务。他不需要简单地藏东西；苹果公司实际上已经用（最新统计）大约 2000 亿美元为他藏了东西。所以他把东西放在保险箱里，员工可以取出来使用。对于这种用途来说，现金比其他任何东西都好。

If that was true, Factor Man was presumably using the contents of a safety deposit box to buy services of some kind. He had no need to simply stash anything; Apple was effectively doing that with (at latest count) about $200 billion on his behalf. So he was putting something in the box that an employee could take out and use. Cash was way better than anything else for such purposes.

记录很薄，但这是我所有的记录了。2018 年 6 月 8 日前不久，Factor Man 取了一些现金，大概是从欧洲大陆某地的另一家银行取的。如果要我猜的话，我猜是瑞士的。

It was thin, but it was all I had. Shortly before June 8, 2018, Factor Man had withdrawn some amount of cash, presumably from another bank somewhere on the Continent. If I had to guess, I’d guess Switzerland.

瑞士有三家银行在海外拥有大量业务，管理着大量资产。它们是瑞银集团、瑞士信贷和瑞士宝盛集团。瑞银持有约 4000 亿瑞士法郎，瑞士信贷持有约 9000 亿瑞士法郎，瑞士宝盛持有约 2500 亿瑞士法郎。一瑞士法郎相当于一美元。

There are three Swiss banks with significant overseas presence and with substantial assets under management. They are UBS AG, Credit Suisse, and the Julius Baer Group. UBS holds about 400 billion Swiss francs, Credit Suisse about 900 billion, and Baer about 250 billion. A Swiss franc is worth about a buck.

我没时间说这些微妙的话。第二天，三家银行分别接到了美联储主席皮特·穆勒的私人电话。穆勒询问在 2018 年 6 月 8 日之前的三周内是否有任何大额现金提取。

I had no time for subtlety. The next day, each of the three banks got a personal telephone call from Pete Muller, the chairman of the US Federal Reserve. Muller asked if there had been any large cash withdrawals in the three weeks before June 8, 2018.

这三家银行都犹豫了。穆勒告诉他们不要再胡闹了，他们向他提供了所有相关交易的日期和账户持有人的姓名。瑞士银行的匿名性就到此为止了。

All three banks balked. Muller told each of them to stop screwing around, and they provided him with the dates of any relevant transactions and the names of the account holders. So much for the famed anonymity of Swiss banking.

我拿到了一份有 37 个名字的名单，取款金额从 100 万到 700 万美元不等。

I got a list with thirty-seven names on it. The withdrawals ranged from one to seven million dollars.

我对照正在进行的调查的电脑记录对照这份名单，找到了一个名字。布莱恩·芬恩大约一年前开立的瑞士信贷账户在 Factor Man 抵达维也纳前一周左右被提取了一百万美元现金。

I cross-referenced the list against the computer records of the ongoing investigation, and one name came up. A Credit Suisse account opened by Brian Finn a year or so earlier had seen a million in cash withdrawn about a week before Factor Man made the Vienna drop off.

五个月前，布莱恩·芬恩 (Brian Finn) 和威廉·伯克特 (William Burkett) 曾一起喝咖啡。

And five months ago, Brian Finn and William Burkett had met for coffee.

在 FCOP 结束之前，我被调往洛杉矶，但 Finn 和 Burkett 都在纽约。等我订好机票时，我发现自己已经搭乘了从洛杉矶国际机场飞往肯尼迪国际机场的红眼航班。

I had been relocated to Los Angeles until FCOP was over, but Finn and Burkett were both in New York. By the time I could book a flight, I found myself on a redeye out of LAX bound for JFK.

我打电话给伯克特，他同意第二天早上一起喝咖啡。还是那家星巴克，利文斯通会像往常一样待在家里。我想我会顺便去拜访芬恩。

I called Burkett and he agreed to meet for coffee the next morning. Same Starbucks, and Livingstone would as usual stay home. Finn I figured I’d just drop in on.

伯克特

Burkett

2021年6月23日，距离FCOP还有17天

June 23, 2021, seventeen days to FCOP

在我告诉自己永远不会告诉 FBI Factor Man 是谁之后大约一周，John Hudson 要求与我见面。他建议我去之前那家俗气的星巴克。我和之前一样同意了。

About a week after I told myself I would never tell the FBI who Factor Man was, John Hudson asked to meet with me. He suggested the same tacky Starbucks as previously. I agreed, as previously.

我们上次见面结束得还算顺利。我很乐意地告诉他关于 Factor Man 的一切，而他似乎也对 Janet Liu 做了同样的事情，不管她是谁。

Our last meeting had ended pretty well. I had been fine telling him pretty much everything I knew about Factor Man, and he had seemed to do the same about Janet Liu, whoever she turned out to be.

这次会议将会更加艰难。

This meeting would be harder.

不难理解哈德森为什么要和我见面。我不知道是怎么回事，但他肯定知道我知道 Factor Man 是谁。可以肯定的是，他自己也不知道，否则他就不会费心安排和我谈话了。所以他不知道我知道什么，但他显然知道我知道，这几乎同样糟糕。

It wasn’t too hard to figure out why Hudson wanted to get together. I had no idea how, but he must have learned that I knew who Factor Man was. It was a safe bet that he didn’t know himself, or he wouldn’t have bothered arranging to talk with me. So he didn’t know what I knew, but he apparently knew that I knew, which was pretty much just as bad.

我没打算告诉他。一点儿也没有。

I had no intention of telling him. None.

零。

Zero.

我和哈德森差不多同时到达。我们握手，他表现得比上次见面时友好多了。他甚至给我买了一杯美式咖啡。双份浓缩咖啡，半咖啡因，还有空间。我们找了一张桌子坐下。

Hudson and I arrived about the same time. We shook hands, and he acted a lot friendlier than he had at our previous meeting. Even bought me an Americano. Double shot, half-caf, with room. We found a table and sat.

他直奔主题。“听着，”他开始说道。“我有个问题要问你。你不会喜欢的，但我必须问。”

He got right to it. “Listen,” he began. “I’ve got a question for you. You aren’t going to like it, but I have to ask.”

太棒了。我等了一会儿，哈德森终于把一张布莱恩·芬的照片递给了桌子对面的人。

Outstanding. I waited, and Hudson eventually passed a picture of Brian Finn across the table.

“你认识这个人吗？”

“Do you know this man?”

好的，伯克特。重置。完全重置。这绝对不是我所期待的问题。

Okay, Burkett. Reset. Total reset. Definitely not the question I was expecting.

“我不这么认为，”我回答道。威廉·伯克特，欺骗大师。

“I don’t think so,” I answered. William Burkett, master of deception.

他笑了。“得了吧，威廉。别跟人开玩笑了。我们知道你和他在一月份喝过咖啡。你看起来不像是那种会和陌生人一起喝饮料的人。”

He smiled. “Come on, William. Don’t kid a kidder. We know that you and he met for coffee in January. You don’t seem like the type to share a drink with a stranger.”

“哦，是的。没错。他是 Brian Finn。”

“Oh, yeah. That’s right. That’s Brian Finn.”

“这样好多了。你们见面是为了什么？”

“That’s better. What did you meet about?”

“我们讨论了芬恩在 RJR Nabisco 杠杆收购中所扮演的角色。”

“We talked about Finn’s role in the leveraged buyout of RJR Nabisco.”

“他给了你一个大号马尼拉信封。”

“And he gave you a large manila envelope.”

“收购的财务披露。”威廉·伯克特 (William Burkett)，欺骗大师。

“Financial disclosures from the buyout.” William Burkett, master of deception.

“我明白了。他为什么不直接通过电子邮件发给你呢？”

“I see. Why didn’t he just email them to you?”

“纳贝斯克收购案是什么时候发生的，大概是 80 年代吧？当时都是纸上谈兵。”

“The Nabisco takeover was from when, like the 80’s? It was all paper.”

“1987 年，威廉。而且记录全都是电子的。想再试一次吗？”

“1987, William. And the records were all electronic. Care to try again?”

“不是真的。”威廉·伯克特 (William Burkett)，欺骗大师？

“Not really.” William Burkett, master of deception?

“听着。当我给你看 Janet Liu 的照片时，你很配合。当我给你看 Finn 的照片时，你却闭口不谈。怎么回事？”

“Listen. When I showed you Janet Liu’s picture, you cooperated. When I show you Finn, you clam up. What gives?”

“诚实回答？”

“Honest answer?”

“诚实回答。”

“Honest answer.”

“我不认识刘和亚当。或者夏娃。随便。芬恩我知道，这意味着他可能是——可能是——一个消息来源。所以我什么都不能告诉你。”

“I don’t know Liu from Adam. Or Eve. Whatever. Finn I know, which means that he might be – might be – a source. So I can’t tell you a thing.”

“不能，还是不愿意？”

“Can’t, or won’t?”

“不行。新闻界的规则就是这样，约翰。”

“Can’t. Journalistic rules, John.”

他站起身走开了。

He stood up and walked away.

也许只是我的感觉，但星巴克似乎已经失去了它的魅力。咖啡不像我们上次去的时候那么热了。

Maybe it was just me, but it seemed like Starbucks was losing its touch. The coffee wasn’t nearly as warm as it had been on our previous visit.

哈德森

Hudson

2021 年 6 月 25 日，距离 FCOP 还有 15 天

June 25, 2021, fifteen days to FCOP

我对伯克特的采访以失败告终。我编造了纳贝斯克收购案的日期（最后核实后才知道，日期只差了一年），并哄骗他确认他从芬恩那里收到的文件与收购案本身无关。我想，这一定是 Factor Man 干的。其他任何事情都太巧合了。

My interview with Burkett was a bust. I made up a date for the Nabisco buyout (only off by a year, as I learned when I eventually checked), and bluffed him into confirming that the documents he had received from Finn had nothing to do with the buyout itself. It had to be Factor Man, I figured. Anything else would be too much of a coincidence.

接下来我们去拜访了 Finn。我们再次与 Livingstone 组队，在周六晚餐时间左右抵达了他在长岛的庄园。距离 FCOP 仅剩两周。

So a visit to Finn was next. Teamed up with Livingstone once again, we arrived at his estate on Long Island on a Saturday around dinnertime. Two weeks to the day before FCOP.

长长的车道两旁种满了参天大树，最后我们来到了一座富丽堂皇的石头宅邸。这里没有门铃，只有前门上一个巨大的龙头形门环。

The long driveway was lined with mature trees and eventually deposited us at a palatial stone mansion. There was no doorbell, just a huge knocker on the front door in the shape of a dragon’s head.

我们敲了门。

We knocked.

管家开了门，遗憾地告诉我们芬恩一家不在家。她不太愿意告诉我们在哪里，但我们 FBI 证件中隐含的权威最终说服了她。芬恩一家在阿斯彭的避暑别墅里。

The housekeeper answered the door and regretfully told us that the Finns were away. She was not terribly inclined to tell us where, but the authority implicit in our FBI credentials eventually swayed her. The Finns were at their summer house in Aspen.

* * *

* * *

我坐经济舱从肯尼迪机场飞往丹佛，我怀疑我坐的这趟航班与几天前芬兰人坐的那趟航班的座位不太一样。我体型很大，但与和我同排座位的两位乘客相比，我显得矮小。这趟航班起飞时间比预期晚了 70 分钟，座位上刚好有足够的空间容纳一个个子不高的中学生。

I flew coach from JFK to Denver, and suspected that my seat on the flight bore little resemblance to the fashion in which the Finns had made the same trip a few days previously. I’m a pretty big guy, but a dwarf in comparison to the two fellows who were sharing my row of seats on a United flight that left a predictable seventy minutes late and had just about enough knee room for a not-too-tall middle schooler.

嗯，就像一位好朋友曾经告诉我的那样，你要飞越整个国家，只需要几个小时，天气温暖干燥，你只需要坐着。按照人类历史的标准，这次飞行已经非常舒适了。

Well, as a good friend once told me, you’re traveling most of the way across the country, it’s only going to take a few hours, it’s warm and dry, and you’re sitting on your butt. By historical human standards, the flight was beyond cushy.

我住进了一家政府收费酒店，既不破旧也不雅致。第二天早上，一位当地经纪人陪我一起开车去了芬恩的住处。他位于阿斯彭的家比长岛的庄园要朴素得多，他亲自开门。我们被邀请到客厅，那里的景色令人叹为观止，今年晚些时候这里将成为滑雪场。

I checked into a government-rate hotel, neither seedy nor elegant. The next morning, I was joined by one of the local agents and we drove out to Finn’s place. His Aspen home was considerably more restrained than the Long Island estate, and he answered the door himself. We were invited into the living room, where the views of what would later in the year be ski runs were predictably breathtaking.

介绍完毕后，他问道：“先生们，我能为你们做些什么？”

“What can I do for you gentlemen?” he asked us after introductions were made.

我告诉他：“我们来这里是为了 Factor Man。”

“We’re here about Factor Man,” I told him.

“的确。”

“Indeed.”

“我们认为你可能认识他。”

“We think you may know him.”

芬恩什么也没说。

Finn said nothing.

我告诉他：“如果双方都参与，这些对话通常会更简单。”

“These conversations are generally simpler if both sides participate,” I told him.

“是的。我想是的。”

“Yes. I expect they are.”

现在我们都在等待。

Now we all waited.

“我是 Factor Man 公司的投资者，”他最后说道。“我想你肯定已经知道了，不然你也不会在这里了。”

“I am an investor in the Factor Man enterprise,” he eventually said. “I suspect that you somehow already know that, or you wouldn’t be here.”

“你投资了多少？”

“How much did you invest?”

“我投资了我认为是审慎的数额。”

“I invested an amount that I felt to be prudent.”

“你为什么要投资？他联系你了吗？”

“Why did you invest? Did he contact you?”

“是的。”

“He did.”

“他是怎么说服你参加的？”

“And how did he convince you to participate?”

“他提出了很有吸引力的条件。”

“He offered attractive terms.”

“就是这样？”

“That’s it?”

“他还告诉我，他可以随时拿走这些钱，无需我的允许。”

“He also told me he could always just take the money without my permission.”

“所以他威胁你了。”

“So he threatened you.”

“实际上，没有。整个交流过程非常友好。我相信我本可以拒绝，他就会去别的地方。当然，”芬恩继续说，“我对他的投资回报很好，我相信你可以想象得到。”

“Actually, no. The entire exchange was very amicable. I believe that I could have declined and he would simply have gone elsewhere. Of course,” Finn continued, “my investment in him has worked out quite well, as I’m sure you can imagine.”

“你认为他为什么接近你？”

“Why do you think he approached you?”

“我无从得知。我作为小企业投资者相当出名。”

“I have no way of knowing. I am fairly well known as an investor in small enterprises.”

“Factor Man 企业很难被描述为小企业。”

“The Factor Man enterprise can hardly be described as small.”

“现在还不认识。不过那时候，我觉得他不是一个非常有钱的人。”

“Not now, no. But back then, I had the impression that he was not a terribly wealthy individual.”

“那是什么时候的事？”

“When was that?”

“我得查一下。我想你知道，我最初的投资是五百万现金。也许你比我更清楚这个日期。”

“I’d have to check. As I imagine you know, my initial investment was five million in cash. Perhaps you know the date better than I do.”

“您知道 Factor Man 是谁吗？”

“Do you know who Factor Man is?”

“我不知道。”

“I do not.”

“你认为你认识他吗？”

“Do you believe you know him personally?”

芬恩想了想，最后回答道：“我无从得知。”

Finn considered. “I have no way of knowing,” he eventually responded.

我终于让步了。“芬恩先生，”我说，“我们认为，有人可能试图谋杀 Factor Man，无论是在 FCOP 还是之前。你真的不帮助我们找到他或警告他吗？”

I finally conceded. “Mr. Finn,” I said, “We believe that there may be an attempt on Factor Man’s life, either at FCOP or before. Is there really nothing you will do to help us find or warn him?”

“我无法帮你找到他，因为我不知道他是谁。如果你想警告他，就给他发一封电子邮件。地址几乎不是什么秘密。”

“I can’t help you find him, because I don’t know who he is. And if you want to warn him, send him an email. The address is hardly a secret.”

基本上就是这样了。我搭乘晚间航班返回洛杉矶，和往常一样，又热又干燥，又闷热。

And that was basically it. I caught an evening flight back to Los Angeles, warm, dry and cramped as ever.

23

23

伯克特

Burkett

2021 年 6 月 29 日，距离 FCOP 还有 11 天

June 29, 2021, eleven days to FCOP

谁将参加 FCOP？

Who Will be at FCOP?

威廉·伯克特，《纽约时报》

William Burkett, The New York Times

FCOP 被普遍视为本世纪的盛会，将在大约一周半后举行。但嘉宾名单仍是一个谜。

FCOP, generally viewed as the party of the century, will be upon us in about a week and a half. But the guest list remains shrouded in mystery.

目前所知不多。除中国外，每个国家都会派两名代表出席，这些国家已经公布了其代表的身份。通常是美国大使及其配偶。

A little bit is known. Every country except China will have two people in attendance, and those countries have announced the identities of their representatives. They are typically the American ambassador and his or her spouse.

出演《霹雳娇娃》的凯特·杰克逊将出席。出演《钢铁侠》的罗伯特·唐尼也将出席。没人知道这两位演员有什么共同点。但《钢铁侠》的主人公本人邀请了他们俩。他们的职业生涯被仔细研究，以寻找共同点。除了名气之外，他们似乎几乎没有什么共同之处。

Kate Jackson, of the original Charlie’s Angels, will be there. So will Robert Downey, Jr. of Iron Man fame. What these two actors have in common, no one knows. But Factor Man himself invited them both. Their careers have been examined in minute detail as a commonality has been sought. They appear to have essentially nothing in common beyond fame.

少数计算机科学家也受邀出席，每人获准带几十位嘉宾。这些计算机科学家及其嘉宾将乘坐私人飞机往返活动现场。同样，原因未知。
