A small number of computer scientists have also been invited, each permitted to bring a few dozen guests. The computer scientists, along with their guests, are being provided with travel by private jet to and from the event. Again, the reason is unknown.

当然，最大的未知数是 Factor Man 本身。而这里，谜团更加深了。

The biggest unknown, of course, is Factor Man himself. And here, the mystery deepens.

多个政府消息来源证实，美国政府认为可能有人试图阻止 Factor Man 参加此次活动，并可能阻止他向全世界公布 Factor Man 技术。政府希望在活动举行之前为 Factor Man 提供一个安全港，但他们——就像我们其他人一样——不知道该去哪里寻找。

Multiple government sources have confirmed that the American government believes that there may be an attempt to prevent Factor Man from attending the event and, presumably, to keep him from releasing the Factor Man technology to the world at large. The government would like to provide Factor Man a safe harbor until the event takes place, but they – like the rest of us – don’t know where to look.

敬请期待。Factor Man 出现于四年多前。再过一个半星期也不算太久。

Stay tuned. Factor Man showed up a bit over four years ago. Another week and a half isn’t that long.

因子人

Factor Man

2021 年 6 月 30 日，距离 FCOP 还有 10 天

June 30, 2021, ten days to FCOP

我发现自己又面临一个价值可疑的难题。

I found myself faced with another puzzle of dubious value.

伯克特和我曾就此事交换过大量电子邮件。首先，一个已经被联邦调查局通缉的外国人回国杀我似乎不太可能。甚至连潜在的刺客能否找到我都不清楚。

Burkett and I had exchanged a reasonable amount of email on this. For a start, it seemed unlikely that a foreign national already wanted by the FBI could get back into the country to kill me. It wasn’t even clear that a potential assassin could find me.

事实上，很明显他做不到。如果他能，我可能已经死了。如果真的有威胁的话。

In fact, it was clear that he couldn’t. If he could, I would presumably be dead. If there were a threat at all.

如果 (a) 中国人想杀我，(b) 他们能找到我，(c) FBI 能保护我，那么向 FBI 透露我的位置将是一个好主意。

Revealing my location to the FBI would be a good idea if (a) the Chinese wanted to kill me, (b) they could find me, and (c) the FBI could protect me.

但只有这种情况我最好还是透露自己的行踪。如果 (a) 是假的，而整个事情都是 FBI 捏造的，那么这很可能是为了引诱我。落入政府的圈套肯定是个错误，而且我确信政府中有很多人都希望我的技术得到有效垄断。

But that was the only case where I was better off revealing my whereabouts. If (a) were false, and the whole thing were just an FBI fabrication, it was presumably designed to smoke me out. Playing into the government’s hands would certainly be a mistake, and I was sure there were plenty of folks in the government who would be happier with an effective monopoly on my technology.

如果 (b) 是错误的，而中国人无法找到我——而我毕竟只剩下 10 天的时间了——那么透露我的位置在最好的情况下是中立的，而在最坏的情况下也会向中国人透露信息，如果中国人在 FBI 内部有特工的话。

If (b) were false, and the Chinese couldn’t find me – and I did, after all, only have ten days to go – then revealing my location at best would be neutral and at worst would just tip the Chinese as well, if they had an agent inside the FBI.

如果 (c) 是错误的，并且 FBI 实际上无法保护我，那么我告诉他们我是谁就没有意义了。

And if (c) were false, and the FBI actually couldn’t protect me, there was no point in my telling them who I was.

我认为这三个假设全都成立的可能性很小。每个假设都成立的可能性可能都比较大，但这并不意味着三个假设全都成立。所以我应该继续隐居下去。

I figured that it was pretty unlikely that all three of the assumptions were true. Each of them might be more likely than not, but that hardly meant that all three of them would be. So I should stay hidden.

还有另一个选择。我现在可以简单地发布代码，这大概可以化解整个问题。这似乎是最好的选择。但它也存在问题。

There was one other option. I could simply release the code now, which would presumably defuse the whole thing. That seemed like it might well be the best choice. But it, too, had problems.

发件人：tim@apple.com（蒂姆·库克）

From: tim@apple.com (Tim Cook)

收件人：factorman0@gmail.com (Factor Man)

To: factorman0@gmail.com (Factor Man)

主题：因子人代码

Subject: Factor Man code

我看到了 William Burkett 的最新作品，想知道您是否考虑提前发布 Factor Man 代码。

I saw William Burkett's recent piece, and wonder if you are considering releasing the Factor Man code early as a result.

我们 Apple 非常希望您不要这样做。我相信您能理解，我们处于一个竞争极其激烈的行业。我们对您的代码的独家许可为我们带来了显著的优势，我们希望能够一直保留这一优势，就像我们最初从您那里获得代码许可时承诺的那样。

We at Apple hope very much that you don't do that. As I'm sure you can understand, we are in an extremely competitive industry. Our exclusive license to your code gives us a significant advantage, and we would like to retain that advantage for as long as was promised when we originally licensed the code from you.

我相信你能理解苹果的立场。如果你希望我们采取任何措施来确保你的人身安全，请随时联系我们。

I trust you can understand Apple's position here. If there is anything that you would like us to do to help ensure your personal safety, please don't hesitate to reach out.

真挚地，

Sincerely,

蒂姆·库克

Tim Cook

太棒了。我还以为我们是好朋友呢。

Outstanding. And here I thought we were buds.

除了可能与苹果发生法律纠纷（别忘了，他们代表我持有的股票现已升值到价值超过 2000 亿美元的地步）之外，还有另一个原因不加快时间表。

In addition to a possible legal fight with Apple (and don’t forget, the stock they were presumably holding on my behalf had now appreciated to the point that it was worth well over $200 billion), there was another reason not to accelerate the timetable.

人们已经支付了数亿美元，只为看我在一周半内揭露我的身份并发布代码。我承诺不会提前这么做，我相信一个人应该信守承诺。

People had paid hundreds of millions of dollars to watch me reveal my identity and release the code in a week and a half. I’d made a commitment not to do it sooner, and I believe one should honor one’s commitments.

所以我决定按计划行事。威廉解释了他是如何找到我的，他使用的电子邮件——我与杰西·麦克默里的私人交流——是其他人都不知道的信息。我相信我已经在维也纳摆脱了困境。过去一年我的生活变得相当平静，所以我只希望再过一个半星期也这样。

So I concluded that I would just follow the plan. William had explained how he had found me, and the email he had used – my private exchanges with Jess MacMurray – was information that no one else had. I was confident I had shaken the tail in Vienna. My life had become quite uneventful over the past year, so I would just hope for another week and a half of the same.

并要求苹果保护我？我认为不会。他们比其他任何人都更有动力阻止代码在 FCOP 发布。

And ask Apple to protect me? I thought not. They had more incentive than pretty much anyone else to keep the code from being released at FCOP.

哈德森

Hudson

2021 年 6 月 30 日，距离 FCOP 还有 10 天

June 30, 2021, ten days to FCOP

跟着钱走。

Follow the money.

回到洛杉矶后，我意识到 Finn 与我的预期大相径庭。我原本以为 Finn 是一位在国会山不断受到质问（并感到尴尬）的纽约银行家，他对世界上 99% 的人的生活一无所知。而这种缺乏理解与同情心的缺乏相得益彰。

As I returned to Los Angeles, I considered the fact that Finn had been so different from my expectations. I had expected a New York banker of the kind that is perpetually grilled (and embarrassed) on Capitol Hill, demonstrating little more than a lack of understanding about how 99% of the world lives. And that lack of understanding is matched only by an associated lack of compassion.

Finn 完全不是那样的人。我发现他谦逊、亲切、聪明（非常聪明），而且虽然小心谨慎，但很坦诚。

Finn wasn’t like that at all. I found him unassuming, gracious, smart (very smart), and, while careful, forthcoming.

但他确实很谨慎。我知道他至少在 Factor Man “企业” 上投资了 500 万美元，我也知道政府估计他的净资产约为 5 亿美元。所以这笔投资足以让他在投资前三思而后行。

But he was certainly careful. I knew that he had invested at least $5 million in the Factor Man “enterprise,” and I also knew that government estimates of his net worth put it at around half a billion. So the investment was enough that he would have thought twice before making it.

我认为我相信他不知道 Factor Man 是谁。但我也怀疑他知道的关于为什么 Factor Man 应该是一项不错的投资的信息比他透露的要多。

I believed him – I think – that he didn’t know who Factor Man was. But I also suspected that he knew more than he was letting on about why Factor Man should be a good investment.

在返回天使之城的相对较短的航班上，当我睡​​着时，所有这一切在我的脑海里浮现。

All of this was rattling around in my head as I fell asleep on the relatively short flight back to the city of angels.

* * *

* * *

当飞机着陆时，我突然惊醒。我惊醒了，心里有一个想法。

I woke with a start as the wheels hit the tarmac. With a start and an idea.

在有人听说过 Factor Man 之前，我曾调查过一起网络诈骗案。一家“物联网”初创公司借助最新的科技泡沫，成功说服一群风险投资家向一个完全是“空谈”的项目投入约 3000 万美元。换句话说，那里根本就不存在“那里”。

Before anyone had even heard of Factor Man, I had investigated a case of Internet fraud where an “Internet of Things” startup, riding the latest tech bubble, had managed to convince a bunch of venture capitalists to dump about $30 million into a project that was complete “vaporware”. In other words, there was no “there” there.

现在，风险投资家总是在亏损。这就是问题所在；这几乎就像他们的目标是在一系列投资中亏损，但通过对所谓的独角兽（即在上市前市值超过 10 亿美元的公司）的一笔投资来弥补损失。

Now, venture capitalists lose their money all the time. It’s sort of the point; it’s almost as if the goal is to lose on a bunch of investments but make it all up with a single investment in a so-called unicorn, or a company that is worth in excess of $1 billion before it goes public.

但这个案例很特殊。物联网当时风靡一时，而这家公司的创始人的商业计划竟然是直接从竞争对手那里抄袭来的。尽管风险投资界竞争激烈，但这已经超出了正常范围。这起案件牵涉到商业机密和网络间谍活动，联邦调查局也介入了调查。

But this particular case was special. The Internet of Things was all the rage at the time, and it turned out that the founder of the company in question had actually lifted his business plan straight from a competitor. Cutthroat though the venture world may be, this went beyond the pale. Trade secrets had been involved, along with cyber espionage, and the FBI had been called in.

这段经历让我对高科技世界，尤其是风险投资世界有了深刻的了解。例如，风险投资家的工作并不像大家想象的那么轻松。事实上，他们面临着巨大的投资压力，这些压力来自一组所谓的“有限合伙人”。

That involvement had taught me a great deal about the high-tech world in general and the venture world in particular. For example, venture capitalists don’t have the easy job everyone thinks they do. They are in fact under enormous pressure to invest their money, which comes from a set of so-called “limited partners”.

每个有限合伙人（LP）将钱交给风险投资家（VC），因为他们认为 VC 会为他找到下一个独角兽。如果这笔钱只是因为 VC 尚未投资而闲置，那么它投资于独角兽的可能性就为零。说得更客气一点，LP 将钱交给 VC，因为他们期望 VC 会明智地投资，从而赚取所有 VC 收取的管理费。如果 VC 将钱留在银行，LP 就得支付管理费，而无法享受明智投资的好处。

Each limited partner, or LP, gives money to the venture capitalist (or VC) on the assumption that the VC will find the next unicorn for him. If that money is just sitting on the sidelines because the VC has yet to invest it, then the chances that it’s invested in a unicorn are precisely zero. Put somewhat more graciously, the LP gave the VC the money in the expectation that the VC would invest it wisely, and thereby earn the management fee that all VC’s charge. If the VC leaves the money in the bank, the LP gets to pay the management fee without the upside of a well-informed investment.

结果是，风险投资家总是面临投资压力。但他们在选择投资对象时也几乎像旅鼠一样随机应变。如果一家风险投资家投资了一家物联网公司，其他所有风险投资家都会感到压力，不得不效仿，以免错过物联网这艘船。因此，风险投资家倾向于投资与其同事投资的企业类似的企业。

The result is that VCs are always under pressure to invest. But they are also almost stunningly lemming-like in the investments they choose to make. If one VC invests in an Internet of Things company, all the others feel pressured to do the same, lest they miss the Internet of Things boat. So VCs tend to invest in ventures similar to those in which their colleagues are investing.

他们也倾向于像投资技术一样投资人才。如果你是独角兽公司的创始人，风险投资家们就会争先恐后地投资你的下一家企业。如果你能展示出一个有利可图的退出（“退出”是指公司上市或被一家大公司收购），同样的事情也会发生。因此，风险投资家也倾向于投资那些过去为他们工作过的人。

They also tend to invest in people as much as they do in technology. Be the founder of a unicorn, and the VCs will be falling all over themselves to invest in your next venture. Show a profitable exit at all (an “exit” means that the company went public or was acquired by a larger company), and the same thing will happen. So VCs also tend to invest in people who have worked out well for them in the past.

Finn 不是风险投资家；他更像是所谓的“天使”或“超级天使”。天使是指拥有大量资金的人，他们会将资金投资于看似不错的新兴企业。这有点像《创智赢家》，但没有那么多宣传。

Finn wasn’t a VC; he was more what was called an “angel” or a “super-angel”. An angel is someone with a lot of money who invests it in fledgling enterprises that seem like good bets. It’s sort of like Shark Tank, but without all the publicity.

天使投资人与风险投资人一样，倾向于投资过去表现出色的人。因此，尽管 Finn 可能不知道 Factor Man 到底是谁，但可以合理地猜测，出于某种原因，他之前曾投资过 Factor Man。

Angels are just like VCs in that they tend to invest in people who have worked out well for them in the past. So while Finn may not have known who Factor Man was specifically, it was a reasonable bet that he believed, for one reason or another, that he had invested in him previously.

钱会留下痕迹。当我回到洛杉矶办公室时，我开始查阅银行记录、纳税申报单以及我能找到的一切。我了解到 Finn 倾向于不直接投资公司（许多天使投资人只是开一张支票），而是通过各种空壳公司和合伙企业进行投资。

Money leaves a trail. When I got back to the LA office, I started pulling bank records, tax returns, everything I could find. I learned that Finn tended not to invest in companies directly (many angels simply write a check), but to do so via one of a variety of shell companies and partnerships.

但那只是额外的一层。

But that was just an extra layer.

与此同时，我也从另一端追查此事。Finn 是一位具有国际知名度的银行家，对任何新公司来说，他都是一个有吸引力的投资者。他投资的公司很可能会在其网站或其他宣传中将 Finn 列为投资者。

And in the meantime, I chased it from the other end as well. Finn, as a banker with an international profile, would be an attractive investor for any new company. It was likely that the companies in which he had invested would name Finn as an investor on their web site or in other publicity.

这类问题正是 FBI 所擅长的。查找 Finn 所做的投资。查找提及 Finn 为投资者的公司的创始人。看看 Factor Man 访问保险箱时，这些创始人中是否有人在欧洲。

This was the kind of problem at which the FBI excels. Find investments made by Finn. Find founders of companies that mention Finn as an investor. See if any of those founders was in Europe when Factor Man visited the safe deposit box.

我们非常擅长筛选此类数据。我们在国务院和财政部的朋友也不赖。

We’re very good at sifting through data like this. And our friends at State and Treasury aren’t bad, either.

刘

Liu

2021年7月3日，距离FCOP还有七天

July 3, 2021, seven days to FCOP

我们的资产：一架距离洛杉矶不远的歼-20。两张 FCOP 前排座位的门票。一份只有 536 个名字的名单。还有一周的时间来完成我们的分析。

Our assets: A J-20 within striking distance of Los Angeles. Two front-row tickets to FCOP. A list that contained a scant 536 names. And a week in which to complete our analysis.

我们的缺点：一周的时间根本不够。我们至少要有一点运气才能找到 Factor Man。

Our liabilities: A week was simply not quite long enough. We would find Factor Man only if we were at least somewhat fortunate.

机票上的名字分别是李强武和马永锋。李强武其实是林姓外勤特工，不过我在这里就用李强武来称呼他。经过一番讨论，我们决定用马强武来称呼我。

The tickets were in the names of Li Qiang Wu and Ma Yong Feng. Li was in fact a field agent named Lin, but I will refer to him here as Li. And, after considerable discussion, it was decided that I would be Ma.

这里最明显的问题是永锋是男人的名字，而我不是男人。但或许这也是因祸得福。

The most obvious issue here is that Yong Feng is a man’s name, and I am not a man. But perhaps that was a blessing in disguise.

我和李获得了外交证件，这将确保我们在美国境内的行动自由。

Li and I were given diplomatic credentials, which would ensure us freedom of movement within the United States.

当我看着新护照上的照片时，变化是巨大的。我的头发剪短了，胸部被紧紧地绑着，让我感到不舒服。照片上的年轻人对我来说是个陌生人。

As I looked at the photograph in my new passport, the change was profound. My hair had been cut short and my breasts bound uncomfortably tightly. The young man in the photograph was a stranger to me.

不管有没有外交官证件，我外表的变化让我很开心。中国情报部门一直在监视美国新闻媒体，看是否有任何关于谋杀案的报道，但没有任何报道。因此，没有理由相信美国当局已经意识到这些罪行有关联，也没有理由相信他们认为我以某种方式参与其中。但是，如果他们知道的比我们预期的更多，我很高兴看到护照上的陌生人盯着我看。护照上的陌生人是一名男子，这将提供额外的一层隐蔽性。

Diplomatic credentials or not, the change in my appearance pleased me. Chinese intelligence services had been monitoring the American news media for any mention of the murders, and there had been none. There was thus no reason to believe that the American authorities had realized that the crimes were connected, and no reason to believe that they thought me to have been involved in any way. But, on the chance that they knew more than we expected, I was glad to see a stranger staring back at me from the passport. That the stranger in the passport was a man would provide an additional layer of concealment.

出发前，赵将军亲自向李和我汇报了情况。他告诉我们，我们被授权使用一切必要手段阻止“人因”向世界公布其技术。但一旦该技术公开，所有此类授权就失效了。到那时，中国的政治前途将不幸地取决于国际社会的支持。这种依赖是前所未有的，但中国的事业不太可能因消灭“人因”或任何其他直接行动而得到进一步发展。引用孙子的话：知战者胜，不知战者败。

Before departing, Li and I were briefed by General Zhao himself. We were told that we had been authorized to use any means necessary to keep Factor Man from releasing his technology to the world. But all such authorization ceased the moment the technology was public. At that point, China’s political future would unfortunately depend on the support of the world community. Such dependence was unprecedented, but China’s cause was unlikely to be furthered by the elimination of Factor Man or by any other direct action. To quote Sun Tzu: He will win who knows when to fight and when not to fight.

我们的外交邮袋里装着武器。我们每人都拿到了两把手枪：一把格洛克 17 和一把 3D 打印的武器。格洛克手枪可能很有用，尽管我们无法携带它们通过机场安检。3D 枪使用的塑料经过特殊设计，无法被美国机场使用的全身扫描仪发现。持有枪支违反了里根总统最初签署的《美国不可探测枪支法案》，但我们的外交资格应该可以保护我们免受这方面的骚扰。顺便说一句，我注意到，美国电影中著名的“瓷质格洛克 7”只是一个神话。

Weaponry was provided in our diplomatic pouch. We were each supplied two handguns: a Glock 17 and a 3-D printed weapon. The Glocks might well be useful, even though we would not be able to carry them through airport security. The plastic used in the 3-D guns was specifically designed to be invisible to the full-body scanners in use at American airports. Possession of the gun would be a violation of the American Undetectable Firearms Act originally signed by President Reagan, but our diplomatic credentials would presumably protect us from harassment in this regard. I note, incidentally, that the famous “porcelain Glock 7” from American cinema is a myth.

虽然 3D 枪相对简单，但子弹的检测难度要大得多。子弹通常以格令为单位，1 克约为 15.4 格令。一颗普通子弹重约 150 格令，即 10 克。现代安检系统可以可靠地检测出三倍于该重量的子弹。

While the 3-D guns were relatively straightforward, bullets were much more challenging. Bullets are generally measured in grains, with one gram being approximately 15.4 grains. A typical bullet weighs some 150 grains, or 10 grams. A modern security screening system can reliably detect triple that amount.

我和李每人会带两颗子弹，藏在智能手机的备用电池包里。也许这样也好，因为无论如何，3D 打印的手枪不太可能可靠地射击几次。

Li and I would each have two bullets, concealed in spare battery packs for our smartphones. Perhaps it was just as well, since the 3-D printed handguns were unlikely to be reliable for more than a small number of shots in any case.

中国国际航空公司有三班从北京直飞洛杉矶的航班，每班都是隔夜航班。我们在 FCOP 前六天出发，提前五天到达。我们的头等舱座位很舒适，我们到达洛杉矶时精神饱满。

Air China has three direct flights from Beijing to Los Angeles, each an overnight journey. We left six days before FCOP, and arrived five days before. Our first class seats were comfortable, and we arrived in Los Angeles well rested.

还剩下 457 个名字。

457 names remained.

2021 年 7 月 8 日，距离 FCOP 还有两天

July 8, 2021, two days to FCOP

两天后，北京的同事给我发了一封电子邮件，告诉我一个可能与 Factor Man 匹配的人。当时是洛杉矶的晚上，中国是中午。

Two days remained when my colleagues in Beijing emailed me a possible match for Factor Man. It was evening in Los Angeles, midday in China.

他们发送的信息基本上是有关剩余可能性之一的档案。一名拥有计算机科学背景的商人，比我们最初的资料所假设的年龄要大。如果这就是 Factor Man，那么我们最初没有发现他就不足为奇了。

The information they sent was essentially a dossier on one of the remaining possibilities. A businessman with a background in computer science, older than our original profile had assumed. If this were Factor Man, it was not surprising that we had initially missed him.

包裹里有一张照片，照片上显示的是我梦中见到的那只鼻子的大致模样。但里面还有一段视频，是当地电视台关于该人经营的一家企业的报道。

The packet included a photograph, which showed an approximation of the nose I had come to see in my dreams. But it also included video, a local television story on one of the businesses run by the individual in question.

他可以走路，但这帮不上什么忙，因为维也纳的那位男子拄着拐杖。但他可以说话，还可以打手势。

He was walking, which was of little assistance because the man in Vienna had used a cane. But he was talking, and he was gesturing.

我认出了这些动作。我看到他挥手，挠鼻子。他的头有点前倾，好像他一直在寻找下一件东西。我无法具体描述，但我肯定认出了它。

I recognized the gestures. I saw him wave his hand, and scratch his nose. There was something about the tilt of his head, something forward about it. As if he were always looking for the next thing. I couldn’t describe it specifically, but I certainly recognized it.

我调出了 Factor Man 在维也纳的视频，以确认身份。这绝对是同一个人。

I pulled up the video of Factor Man in Vienna just to be sure. It was absolutely the same individual.

我们抓住了他。

We had him.

一个迫在眉睫的问题是，他住在俄勒冈州的农村。第二天中午之前没有航班可以把我们送到那里，因此我们可以合理地推测，Factor Man 可能已经飞往帕萨迪纳了。

An immediate problem was that he lived in rural Oregon. There was no flight that could get us there before midday the next day, at which point it was reasonable to assume that Factor Man might have left for Pasadena.

我尝试包机，但不可能。全国的每架私人飞机都已承诺将某位美国资本家送往FCOP。我打电话给大使馆，他们试图从中国在美国众多的朋友之一那里借一架飞机。那也是不可能的。

I tried chartering a flight, but it was impossible. Every private jet in the country was already committed to bringing one American capitalist or another to FCOP. I called the embassy, and they tried borrowing a jet from one of China’s many friends in the United States. That, too, was impossible.

从洛杉矶开车过去要 12 个小时。我们要连夜赶路，但比坐飞机早到一两个小时。我们在俄勒冈还有车，如果 Factor Man 自己逃走，我们还能及时赶回帕萨迪纳参加 FCOP。

It was a twelve-hour drive from Los Angeles. We would travel through the night, but we would get there an hour or two earlier than if we flew. We would also have a car in Oregon, and be able to return to Pasadena in time for FCOP if Factor Man himself escaped us.

我和北京商量的时候，李在开车。人事官显然计划乘坐私人飞机前往 FCOP；记录显示，距离他最近的机场有一架飞机将于第二天上午 10 点起飞。乘客名单显示，机上将有 12 人。

Li drove while I conferred with Beijing. Factor Man was apparently planning on traveling to FCOP via private jet; there was a single flight plan recorded out of the airport nearest to him that left at 10AM the next day. The passenger manifest indicated that there would be twelve people aboard.

我们可能在 10 点之前到达 Factor Man 的出发机场，也可能不能，但北京确认我们是距离现场最近的特工。一颗卫星被重新定位到 Factor Man 家上方的地球静止轨道上，这是俄勒冈州尤金市西南一块大地上的一处相对简朴的住所。然而，天气预报表明卫星监视可能是不可能的。

We might or might not reach Factor Man’s departure airport by 10AM, but Beijing confirmed that we were the closest agents to the scene. A satellite was repositioned to a geostationary orbit over Factor Man’s house, a relatively modest dwelling on a large plot of land southwest of Eugene, Oregon. The weather forecast, however, suggested that satellite surveillance might be impossible.

我们有三次机会。其中两次是我的：我们可能及时到达尤金，在 Factor Man 登上飞往帕萨迪纳的包机之前拦截他；或者，作为最后的手段，我和李有时间在尤金短暂休息，然后再返回加利福尼亚对付 Factor Man。

We had three chances. Two of those chances were mine: We might reach Eugene in time to intercept Factor Man before he boarded his charter flight to Pasadena or as a last resort, Li and I would have time for a brief rest in Eugene before returning to California to deal with Factor Man there.

另一个机会是歼-20。该飞机不适合使用辽宁舰上的弹射器，而所需的近乎垂直的起飞会消耗大量燃料。因此，一架西安轰-6U空中加油机从南京起飞，准备在歼-20飞往加利福尼亚的途中为其加油。

The other chance was the J-20. The aircraft had not been fit to use the catapult on the Liaoning, and the nearly vertical takeoff that was required instead would use a great deal of fuel. So a Xian H-6U aerial refueling tanker lifted off from Nanjing, ready to replenish the J-20 on its flight to California.

我们还有另外一个优势。没有证据表明美国政府会为“因素曼”求情，甚至他们也不知道他是谁。

We had one other advantage, as well. There was no evidence that the American government was going to intercede on Factor Man’s behalf, or even that they knew who he was.

24

24

哈德森

Hudson

2021 年 7 月 9 日，距离 FCOP 还有一天。凌晨 2:00

July 9, 2021, one day to FCOP. 2:00 AM

米我的电话在不合时宜的时间响了，我被告知要赶快去爱德华兹空军基地。十五分钟后，一辆车和司机就会到达酒店门前。

My phone rang at an ungodly hour, and I was told to get my butt to Edwards Air Force Base. A car and driver would be in front of the hotel in fifteen minutes.

爱德华兹空军基地位于洛杉矶以北几个小时车程的莫哈维沙漠。虽然其主要任务是飞行测试，但它是距离洛杉矶最近的地方，可以找到战斗机。

Edwards is located a couple hours’ drive north of Los Angeles in the Mojave Desert. Although its primary mission is flight testing, it is the closest place to Los Angeles where one can find fighter aircraft.

抵达爱德华兹后，我迅速通过安检，很快来到一间大控制室，一排排办公桌上摆放着电脑终端。看起来就像 NASA 执行太空任务时的情景。空军测试中心指挥官唐纳德·A·哈金少将面无表情地迎接了我。哈金用沙哑的声音告诉我，卫星图像显示，前一天晚上 9 点，一艘中国加油机从中国东海岸的南京空军基地起飞，飞越太平洋。

Upon my arrival at Edwards, I was whisked through security and shortly found myself in a large control room, rows of desks with computer terminals on them. It looked like NASA during a space mission. I was met by a stone-faced Major General Donald A. Harkin, commander of the Air Force Test Center. In a gravelly voice that sounded straight out of Georgia, Harkin informed me that satellite imagery had shown that at 9 PM the previous night, a Chinese tanker had taken off from Nanjing Air Base on the east coast of China, and headed out over the Pacific.

多种卫星在飞机飞往美洲的过程中对其进行了间歇性观测。最近一次观测是在距离驻扎在洛杉矶附近的中国航空母舰 200 海里范围内。

A variety of satellites had observed the flight intermittently as it traveled toward the Americas. The most recent observation had been within two hundred nautical miles of the Chinese aircraft carrier that had taken position off Los Angeles.

这艘中国航母上载着一架经过特殊改装的隐形战斗机歼-20。如果歼-20要飞抵美国本土的目标，就需要加油，而每个人都认为这架中国加油机正计划帮助它完成这一任务。而假定的目标是搭载“因子人”前往 FCOP 的飞机。

The Chinese carrier was carrying a specially modified stealth fighter called a J-20. The J-20 would need to refuel if it was to reach targets in the continental United States, and everyone’s assumption was that the Chinese tanker was planning to help it do just that. And the assumed target was the plane carrying Factor Man to FCOP.

问题是我们没有办法保护他。

The problem was that we had no way to defend him.

洛杉矶地区有五座机场。当然，洛杉矶国际机场 (LAX) 是其中之一，此外还有伯班克、长滩、圣安娜和安大略等一些较小的机场。我们认为，这些机场中的任何一座都可能是 Factor Man 飞往帕萨迪纳的包机目的地。

There are five airports that serve the Los Angeles area. There is LAX, of course, along with somewhat smaller locations at Burbank, Long Beach, Santa Ana, and Ontario. Any of these could be the destination for what we assumed would be a charter flight bringing Factor Man to Pasadena.

除此之外，我们一无所知。我们有一份宾客名单，上面有近 100,000 个名字。大约 300 个新名字——Factor Man 的宾客——将在几个小时内提供给我们。我们真正知道的是，虽然正常情况下，五个机场每天总共约有 6,000 架飞机降落，但今天计划降落 10,000 架。会有延误，洛杉矶盆地上空的大部分空域已经对空中交通关闭，除了定期的商业航班和可以证明与 FCOP 有关的航班。

Beyond that, we knew nothing. We had a guest list with almost 100,000 names on it. About 300 new names – Factor Man’s guests – would be provided to us in a few hours. All we really knew was that while a normal day had about 6,000 scheduled landings at the five airports combined, there were 10,000 planned for today. There were going to be delays, and much of the airspace over the LA Basin had already been closed to air traffic other than regularly scheduled commercial flights and flights that could prove they were related to FCOP.

美国向中国大使发出了简短信息，警告他任何未经授权的飞机侵犯美国领空的行为都将受到最严厉的惩罚。美国回信也简短地表示，中国的所有行动都在国际领空和水域，中国也保留捍卫国家利益的权利，美国应该管好自己的事。

A terse message was sent to the Chinese ambassador, warning him that any violation of American airspace by unauthorized aircraft would be dealt with in the harshest possible fashion. A terse message was sent back, indicating that all Chinese operations were in international airspace and waters, that China also reserved the right to defend its national interests, and that America should basically mind its own damn business.

紧张局势加剧。

Tensions rose.

我想我当时已经喝了五杯咖啡，控制室里一片忙碌。几张办公桌上都在忙着打字，不久后有人过来向哈金汇报情况。哈金也过来向我汇报情况。

I think I was on my fifth cup of coffee when there was flurry of activity in the control room. There was a rush of typing at a handful of desks, with someone coming up to brief Harkin shortly thereafter. He came to brief me.

“今天早上雾很大，但跟踪中国航母的其中一艘舰船刚刚看清楚了情况。歼-20 已经不在甲板上了。我们推测它已经起飞，朝加利福尼亚飞去。哈德森先生，如果你要帮助我们，现在是时候了。我们无法保卫 10,000 架民航航班。你能做的任何事，都去做吧。出发点。加利福尼亚的可能着陆点。预计时间。任何事情。”

“There’s a lot of fog this morning, but one of the ships shadowing the Chinese carrier just got a pretty good look at it. The J-20 is no longer on deck. We assume it’s airborne and headed toward California. If you’re going to help us, Mr. Hudson, the time is now. We can’t defend 10,000 civilian flights. Anything you can do, do it. Point of departure. Likely landing spot in California. Expected times. Anything at all.”

当时刚过早上九点。

It was just after nine in the morning.

因子人

Factor Man

2021 年 7 月 9 日，距离 FCOP 还有一天。上午 7:00

July 9, 2021, one day to FCOP. 7:00 AM

我不太喜欢坐飞机。我并不担心，只是不方便而已。

I don’t like flying very much. It doesn’t worry me, it’s just inconvenient.

我住的地方附近没有枢纽，所以去任何地方都至少要坐两趟航班，通常要坐三趟。加上航班之间的必要间隔，你需要花一天时间才能到达目的地。

I don’t live near a hub, so getting pretty much anywhere involves at least two flights, and often three. Add the necessary interval between flights, and it takes a day to get where you’re going.

到洛杉矶需要一天时间。到纽约需要一天时间。到明尼阿波利斯需要一天时间。到任何地方都需要一天时间，返回又需要一天时间。

It takes a day to get to Los Angeles. A day to get to New York. A day to get to Minneapolis. A day to get anywhere, and a day to get back.

如果你够幸运的话，那也是可以的。我经常会尝试搭上当天最后一班航班，无论是来回，只要我没有错过转机，并且在某个不经意的地方多住一晚，那就算成功了。

And that’s if you’re lucky. I often try to get on the last flight of the day, coming or going, and if I don’t miss a connection and spend an extra night somewhere unintended, that’s a win.

芬恩的 2500 万美元也没起到什么作用。我负担不起包机带来的麻烦，而且事实证明，头等舱乘客因为错过转机而被困一夜的可能性与其他人一样大。

Finn’s $25M hadn’t helped, either. I couldn’t afford the attention that would come with chartering a plane, and it turns out that first class customers are pretty much as likely to get stuck overnight because of a missed connection as everyone else is.

飞行有时也是一件很奇怪的事情。下面是一个例子。

Flying is also sometimes just plain weird. Here’s an example.

有一天，我乘飞机回家，在盐湖城换乘。我上了飞机，坐在过道的座位上。坐在我旁边中间座位上的是一个人，我简单称他为“类固醇男”。他真的是类固醇使用问题的典型代表。他的手臂像树干一样粗，没有头发，态度也与之相称。他在 iPad 上做着其他事情，但大部分时间都在咒骂设备。

I was flying home one day, changing in Salt Lake City. I get on the plane, an aisle seat. In the middle seat next to me is someone that I will simply describe as “Steroid Man.” He really is a poster child for the problems with steroid use. Arms like tree trunks, no hair, and an attitude to match. Doing something or other on his iPad, but mostly just cursing at the device.

好吧，我不必听。我拿出 Kindle 开始阅读。遗憾的是，我的眼睛已经不如以前好了。我拒绝承认这一点，因此我改变了 Kindle 上的字体。于是我打开了头顶的灯。

Well, I don’t have to listen. I get out my Kindle and start to read. My eyes are, sadly, not as good as they once were. I refuse to admit that by changing the font on the Kindle. So I turn on the overhead light.

Steroid Man 将它关闭。告诉我我的 Kindle 有背光（确实有），这应该足够好了（但事实并非如此）。

Steroid Man turns it off. Tells me that my Kindle has a backlight (which it does) and that should be good enough (which it isn’t).

我试着不开灯看书，但就是做不到。所以我告诉他我的眼睛老了，很抱歉，但我需要灯。我又把灯打开了。

I try to read without the light, but I just can’t do it. So I tell him that my eyes are old, and I’m sorry, but I need the light. I turn it back on.

他一拳砸在了上面，又把它关掉了。“真是他妈的让我头疼。”

He smashes his fist into it, turning it off again. “Givin’ me a fuckin’ headache.”

了不起。

Terrific.

过道对面的那个人没有开灯，所以我告诉他我的灯打扰到了我的邻座，并问他是否愿意换灯。他说没问题，但他和妻子一起旅行，他们希望我坐在中间的座位上，这样他们就可以坐在两个相邻的过道座位上。

The guy across the aisle from me isn’t using his light, so I tell him that my light is bothering my neighbor and ask if he would be willing to switch. He says fine, but he’s traveling with his wife, and they’ll want me to take their middle seat, so they have the two aisle seats next to one another.

我想当然了。最好读读书，别管类固醇男，坐在中间的座位上。我们都换了座位。我走上前去，向乘务员解释发生了什么事，包括换座位的原因。

I figure sure. Better to read and leave Steroid Man alone and be in the middle seat. We all switch. I walk up and explain what’s going on to the flight attendant, including the reason for the seat shuffle.

到目前为止一切顺利。与我交换座位的那个男人的妻子体型正常，而且我在新座位上获得的空间与在旧座位上获得的空间大致相同。

So far, so good. The wife of the guy who swapped with me is normal size, and I’ve got about the same amount of room in my new seat as in my old.

但现在乘务员出现了。她告诉类固醇男，不，他不能关掉其他乘客的灯。乘客可以决定是否打开灯。我不知道她为什么这样做，但类固醇男显然很不高兴。

But now the flight attendant shows up. She tells Steroid Man that no, he can’t turn off the light of a fellow passenger. The passenger gets to decide whether to turn the light on or not. I have no idea why she did this, but Steroid Man is visibly upset.

我什么也没说，只是看着我的书，等待飞行结束。我想我应该让类固醇男先离开；没有必要和他互动，让他更加恼火。

I say nothing and just read my book, waiting for the flight to end. I figure I’ll let Steroid Man get off first; no reason to interact with him and aggravate him further.

于是他下了飞机，我跟着他。他走了大约一英里半一小时，双腿都弯了起来。我真的为这个人感到难过。

So he gets off the plane, and I follow him. He’s walking about a mile and a half an hour, legs all bowed up. I actually feel bad for the guy.

好吧，我要去联系一个联系人，因此我快步从他身边走过。

Well, I have a connection to make, so I walk briskly by him.

而他却奇迹般地加快了速度。

And he, miraculously, speeds up.

我放慢速度，他也放慢速度。我加速，他也加速。

I slow down, he slows down. I speed up, he speeds up.

真的吗？我是说真的吗？他在干什么？等我进浴室然后袭击我？

Really? I mean, really? What is he doing, waiting for me to go into a bathroom so he can assault me?

我们经过了几个警察，我觉得自己受够了。我调转车头，告诉他们发生了什么事，并寻求帮助。

We pass a couple of cops, and I decide I’ve had enough. I do a U-turn, tell them what’s going on, and ask for help.

类固醇男子走了过去，警察告诉我，他们已经把他列为某种危险分子。他脾气非常暴躁。他们决定送我到转机登机口。

Steroid Man walks on, and the cops tell me that they had already singled him out as a risk of some kind. A really angry guy. They decide to walk me to my connecting gate.

所以我在这里，在盐湖城各大门之间受到警察护送。

So here I am, getting a police escort between gates at Salt Lake City.

我们到达了航站楼的第一个选择点；我需要在这里转身才能到达下一班航班的候机大厅。类固醇男在书店等着我。我转身，他放下杂志，开始跟着我们。一名警察从后面出来，抓住了他（他必须把手放在那个家伙身上才能引起他的注意），然后他们聊了起来。我继续向登机口走去，仍然陪着我的警察让航班管理员提前把我安排在了飞机上。我很困惑（也很饿；我本来想去吃点东西），但警察说类固醇男真的很生气，我应该上飞机，他们会让他坐飞机去雅基马，而不是我要去的地方。整个事情都会结束。

We get to the first choice point in the terminal; I need to turn here to get onto the concourse where my next flight will be. And there is Steroid Man, waiting for me in a bookshop. I turn, he puts his magazine down, and starts following us. One of the cops detaches, grabs him (he has to actually put his hands on the guy to get his attention), and they have a chat. I soldier on to the gate, where the cop still accompanying me has the person handling the flight put me on my plane early. I’m confused (and hungry; I was hoping to grab some food), but the cop says that Steroid Man is really mad and I should just get on my flight and they’ll put him on his flight to Yakima, not where I’m going at all. The whole thing will be over.

事实就是这样。

And so it is.

真事。但这确实没让我对航空旅行感觉好一点。

True story. But it sure didn’t make me feel any better about air travel.

但我想，今天会有所不同。直飞航班，从尤金飞往伯班克。离玫瑰碗最近的机场。航班上有 12 名乘客：我和我的家人、我的牧师和他的家人，以及一位商业同事和他的家人。这位同事大卫·埃瑟林顿 (David Etherington) 和我共同创办了一个研究实验室和我三家初创公司中的两家。1993 年，我们一起搬到尤金创办了研究实验室，大卫的大儿子伊恩 (Ian) 于次年出生，从我们记事起，他就一直是飞机迷。

But today was going to be different, I figured. Direct flight, Eugene to Burbank. Closest airport to the Rose Bowl. Twelve people on the flight: Me and my family, my pastor and his family, and a business colleague and his family. The colleague, David Etherington, had cofounded a research lab and two of my three startups with me. We had moved to Eugene together in 1993 to start the research lab, and David’s oldest son, Ian, had been born the next year and been an airplane buff for as long as any of us could remember.

这架飞机是一架湾流 G550。伊恩告诉我们，它最多可容纳 19 名乘客，但如果有床铺，则最多只能容纳 8 名乘客。我们乘坐的那架飞机有整整 12 个座位，正好适合我们 12 个人。至少在我看来，飞机内部豪华得令人难以置信。但肯定还有更好的私人飞机，甚至波音 747。哎呀，甚至还有 Aerion AS2，计划在几年后问世，能够以 1.5 马赫的速度搭载 12 名乘客。

The plane was a Gulfstream G550. Ian told us it could hold up to 19 passengers, although only eight if they had beds. Our particular plane had an even dozen seats, just right for the twelve of us. It was unbelievably luxurious on the inside, at least to my eye. But still nicer private aircraft certainly existed, all the way up to a Boeing 747. Heck, there’s even the Aerion AS2, scheduled to come out in a couple of years and capable of carrying twelve passengers at Mach 1.5.

我和家人原定十点从尤金机场出发。但我们却要在十点到达机场，这真是太奇怪了。

My family and I were slated to leave at ten from the Eugene airport. It was bizarre that we had to get to the airport at, well, at ten.

搭乘十点钟的航班。

For a flight at ten.

那里没有安保措施。如果我们愿意，我们可以带狗来，它们会和我们一起在小屋里跑来跑去。

There would be no security. We could bring our dogs if we wanted to, and they would get to run around the cabin with us.

机场离我们住的地方有半小时车程，所以我们必须在 9:30 出发。我想我们甚至可能在 10 点出发，而且会迟到。

The airport was half an hour’s drive from our place, so we had to leave at 9:30. I guess we probably could even have left at ten and been late.

但我们就是做不到。我们 8:30 出发，部分原因是我们通常会在 8:30 出发赶 ​​10 点的航班，主要原因是我们迫不及待地想出发。狗狗们（它们实际上没能出发，这让它们很失望）会一直待着，直到中午看房人劳里到来。劳里知道我们要去 FCOP，但不知道为什么。

But we just couldn’t do it. We left at 8:30 partly because that’s when we would normally leave for a ten o’clock flight, and mostly because we couldn’t wait to get started. The dogs (who did not actually get to go, much to their disappointment) would be fine until Laurie, the house sitter, arrived around noon. Laurie knew we were going to FCOP but had no idea quite why.

我们提前一小时到达尤金机场，等待湾流飞机降落。尤金天气阴沉，但我们觉得一切都晴朗。

We arrived at the Eugene airport an hour before flight time, and cooled our heels while we waited for the Gulfstream to show up. Eugene was predictably overcast, but it all seemed sunny to us.

刘

Liu

2021 年 7 月 9 日，距离 FCOP 还有一天。上午 9:00

July 9, 2021, one day to FCOP. 9:00 AM

我们到达 Factor Man 家时，已经快九点了，家位于尤金西南。房子很朴素，但景色令人惊叹。长长的碎石路似乎是和邻居共用的；我们最初在几百米外的岔路口走错了路。纠正错误后，我们很快就发现自己来到了一所房子，与北京晚上发来的照片相符。

It was just before nine when we arrived at Factor Man’s home, southwest of Eugene. It was a modest house with a stunning view. The long gravel drive appeared to be shared with a neighbor; we had initially gone the wrong way at the fork a few hundred meters back. After correcting for the error, we shortly found ourselves at a house matching the picture Beijing had sent over during the night.

那天阴云密布，卫星无法确定“人质”是否还在家里。在那里找到他无疑是我们的首选；在偏远的乡村地区行动比在机场更简单有效。

The day was overcast, and the satellite above had not been able to determine if Factor Man were still at home. Finding him there was certainly our first choice; it would be simpler to act effectively at a remote country location than at the airport.

两只狗在屋内冲我们狂吠。从狗引起的骚动和没有回应来看，显然房子里是空的。闯入很可能需要杀死狗，这显然会提醒下一位访客我们的存在。我们决定继续前往半小时车程外的机场。我们会在 Factor Man 飞往帕萨迪纳的航班起飞前到达那里，但不会提前太多。

Two dogs barked at us from inside the home. Given the commotion the dogs were causing and the lack of response, it was clear that the house was empty. Breaking in would likely necessitate killing the dogs, which would obviously alert the next visitor to our presence. We decided to simply press on to the airport, half an hour away. We would get there before Factor Man’s flight was scheduled to depart for Pasadena, but not by much.

机场不大，但通用航空和客运航站楼仍然位于不同的地方。当我们找到通用航空航站楼时，已经是 9:45 了。一架湾流 V 型飞机停在停机坪上。大约有十几个人正在爬上台阶准备登机。李先生让车子空转，我则下了车。

The airport was small, but general aviation and the passenger terminal were still in separate locations. By the time we found the general aviation terminal, it was 9:45. A Gulfstream V was parked on the tarmac. A crowd of about a dozen people was climbing the steps to board. Li allowed the car to idle while I stepped out.

我一边拔出格洛克手枪，一边向飞机跑去。乘客们已经鱼贯通过登机门。我看到了 Factor Man，他排在第二位，远远超出了小手枪的有效射程。我冲上前，他也向前走，在我到达之前他就登上了飞机。我迟到了片刻。

I drew the Glock while running toward the aircraft. The passengers were already filing through the boarding door. I could see Factor Man, second in line and well beyond the effective range of the small pistol. I rushed forward, he walked forward, and he boarded the plane before I could arrive. I was too late by moments.

楼梯上还有六名乘客。我本可以射杀其中一名，但我觉得这没什么用。当局会收到警报，我很难逃脱他们的追捕，而且我怀疑听到枪声的警员会决定从飞机上走下来。

There were still half a dozen passengers on the steps. I could have shot one of them, but I couldn’t see how that would help. The authorities would have been alerted, I would be unlikely to escape their pursuit, and I doubted that Factor Man, hearing the shot, would have decided to graciously reemerge from the aircraft.

我回到了李家。我们把车停在机场的商业区，把格洛克手枪留在车里，走进航站楼，试图买回洛杉矶的机票。不出所料，所有航班的每个舱位都满员了。我们住进了一家酒店，试着睡一觉，为开车回南边做准备。

I returned to Li. We parked the car at the commercial portion of the airport and left the Glocks in it as we went into the terminal to attempt to buy tickets back to Los Angeles. Not surprisingly, all of the flights were full in every class of travel. We checked into a hotel and attempted to get some sleep in preparation for the drive back south.

三次机会中，有一次已经错失。

One of the three chances was gone.

二十五

25

哈德森

Hudson

2021 年 7 月 9 日，距离 FCOP 还有一天。上午 9:22

July 9, 2021, one day to FCOP. 9:22 AM

我哈金走上前来时，我正喝着第五杯咖啡。“哈德森先生，如果你要帮助我们，现在是时候了。我们无法保卫 10,000 架民航航班。”

I was on my fifth cup of coffee as Harkin came up. “If you’re going to help us, Mr. Hudson, the time is now. We can’t defend 10,000 civilian flights.”

早上九点刚过，我的手机就响了。

It was just after nine in the morning, and my cell phone rang.

电话那头是凯伦·迈尔斯 (Karen Myers)，她是负责追踪芬恩联系人的特工之一。

Karen Myers, one of the agents running down Finn’s contacts, was on the other end.

“我们认为我们找到他了，”她告诉我。“芬恩的两笔投资都是同一个人创办的公司。我们通过正常途径，通过纳税申报表找到了其中一家。另一家在其网站上将芬恩列为投资者。”

“We think we found him,” she told me. “Two of Finn’s investments are with companies founded by the same guy. We found one the normal way, through tax returns. The other lists Finn as an investor on its web site.”

“是谁？”我问。

“Who is it?” I asked.

“俄勒冈州的一个人。尤金。”

“Some guy in Oregon. Eugene.”

“还要别的吗？”

“Anything else?”

“我们拍到了一张照片。鼻子没错。我想这就是他，约翰。”

“We got a picture. The nose is right. I think this is him, John.”

“把照片发给我。把你的名字、个人资料，以及任何你有的东西发给我。”

“Send me the picture. Send me a name, profile, anything you’ve got.”

“当然可以。两分钟。”

“Sure thing. Two minutes.”

我挂了电话，看了看哈金。听着我的话，他耐心地等待着。这样做似乎对他来说并不是一件自然而然的事情。“我想，”我告诉他，“你只需要防守一个。”

I hung up and looked at Harkin. Listening to my side of things, he was waiting patiently. Doing so did not appear to be something that came naturally to him. “I think,” I told him, “that you’ll only need to defend one.”

我们向联邦航空管理局核实了情况。Factor Man 计划乘坐私人飞机从尤金飞往伯班克，上午 10 点起飞。Harkin 在了解详细信息后迅速记下了一些信息。然后他拿起另一部电话。他没有拨号，只是等了一会儿。

We checked with the FAA. Factor Man was scheduled to take a private jet from Eugene to Burbank, leaving at 10 AM. Harkin scribbled quickly as he got details. Then he picked up another phone. He didn’t dial, just waited for a moment.

“我是唐·哈金。我需要四架战斗机从克拉马斯瀑布起飞。他们将护送一架湾流 550 型飞机从尤金回声-制服-高尔夫机场向南飞往伯班克布拉沃-制服-罗密欧机场。预计起飞时间为 17:00 祖鲁。机尾编号 11 月 3565 维克托。”他停顿了一下。

“This is Don Harkin. I need four fighters scrambled out of Klamath Falls. They are to escort a Gulfstream 550 traveling southbound from Eugene Echo-Uniform-Golf to Burbank Bravo-Uniform-Romeo. Estimated departure 1700 Zulu. Tail number November 3565 Victor.” He paused.

“我的权威。查理 7 太棒了 5。威胁是一架来自太平洋的中国歼-20。接触后立即交战。”他再次停顿了一下。

“My authority. Charlie 7 bravo bravo 5. The threat is a Chinese J-20 inbound from the Pacific. Engage upon contact.” He paused again.

“并从爱德华兹派出几架 F-35 战机加入他们进入加利福尼亚的行列。”

“And send a couple of F-35’s out of Edwards to join them as they cross into California.”

他挂断了电话。然后他又拿起另一部电话，让接电话的人让俄勒冈州尤金市的控制塔给他回电话。

He hung up. Then back to the other phone, where he asked whoever answered to have the Eugene, Oregon control tower call him back.

当时是 9:32。哈金告诉我，驻扎在克拉马斯瀑布的美国 F-15 战机将在 15 分钟内起飞，再飞行 9 分钟，就能完成从克拉马斯瀑布到尤金的 135 海里的航程。以 1.2 马赫的速度飞行，他们应该会在搭载 Factor Man 的飞机起飞之前到达那里。

It was 9:32. Harkin told me that the American F-15’s based at Klamath Falls would be airborne in fifteen minutes, and it would take them nine more to make the 135 nautical mile flight from Klamath Falls to Eugene. Traveling at Mach 1.2, they should get there before the plane carrying Factor Man even took off.

电话铃响了，哈金接了起来。“唐·哈金。”他听了一会儿，然后按下按钮，将电话转到免提模式。

The phone rang, and Harkin picked it up. “Don Harkin.” He listened for a moment and pushed a button that put the call on speaker.

“早上好，马西先生。我是唐纳德·哈金将军，爱德华兹空军测试中心的指挥官。我相信你今天早上有一架飞往伯班克的航班。机尾编号 11 月 3565 维克多。”

“Good morning, Mr. Massey. I’m General Donald Harkin, commander of the Air Force Test Center at Edwards. You have a flight heading down to Burbank this morning, I believe. Tail number November 3565 Victor.”

“是的，先生。我们可以为您做些什么？”

“Yes, sir. What can we do for you?”

“当权者决定为那架飞机提供护航，我已经安排了四架 F-15 从 K 瀑布飞往你那里。他们应该会在 65 Victor 起飞前到达那里，但如果不能，你能让他们在地面上停留一会儿吗？”

“The powers that be have decided to give that plane an escort, and I’ve got four F-15s headed your way from K Falls. They should get there before 65 Victor departs, but if not, could you please hold them on the ground for a little bit?”

“当然。没问题。有什么具体我需要知道的吗？”

“Absolutely. Not a problem. Anything specific I should know?”

“F-15 战机将很快通过级联进近进行联络。请让湾流飞机关闭其应答器并禁用其 ADS-B 中包含的任何 GPS 报告。”

“The F-15’s will be in touch via Cascade Approach shortly. Please also have the Gulfstream turn off its transponder and disable any GPS reporting they’re including in their ADS-B.”

“打扰一下？”

“Excuse me?”

“您听见我说的话了，马西先生。除了通常的无线电通话外，没有关于该飞机的位置报告。我们的人员将一直陪同他到伯班克。”

“You heard me, Mr. Massey. No position reporting for that aircraft other than the usual radio chatter. Our folks will stay with him all the way to Burbank.”

“我明白。但是，那架飞机关闭应答器是违反联邦航空条例的。”

“I understand. For that aircraft to disable its transponder is a violation of the Federal Aviation Regulations, though.”

“今天不行，马西先生。今天不行。”他挂了电话。

“Not today it isn’t, Mr. Massey. Not today.” He hung up.

哈金向我解释了这一点。飞机需要付出很大努力才能向外界通报自己的位置，这并不令人意外。时速超过 500 英里时，一般应避免发生碰撞。

Harkin explained it to me. Aircraft, not surprisingly, work quite hard to tell the rest of the world where they are. Collisions at speeds in excess of 500 miles an hour are generally to be avoided.

但在这个特殊情况下，如果“因子人”的飞行告诉了全世界它的位置，那么中国战机也会知道。尽管中国飞机即使没有相关传输也能找到“因子人”，但这样做需要歼-20 发射雷达或其他信号。任何类似的东西都会让美国飞机成为目标。

But in this particular case, if Factor Man’s flight told the world where it was, it would be telling the Chinese fighter as well. While the Chinese plane could still locate Factor Man even without the transmissions in question, doing so would involve a radar or other signal being emitted by the J-20. Anything along those lines would give the American aircraft a target.

“那么告诉我吧，哈德森探员。我猜我们刚刚成功地用一种国际事件换来了另一种国际事件。但当飞机到达洛杉矶时，会发生什么呢？”

“So tell me, Agent Hudson. My guess is that we just succeeded in trading an international incident of one kind for an international incident of another kind. But when the aircraft gets to Los Angeles, what then?”

我问他是什么意思。

I asked what he meant.

“FCOP 是明天晚上，对吧？在此期间 Factor Man 的情况怎么样了？”

“FCOP is tomorrow evening, right? What happens to Factor Man in the meantime?”

“我们有选择吗？”

“We have choices?”

“当然。我们可以先让他降落在爱德华兹。让他留在这里，明天亲自带他去 FCOP。或者你可以让他按计划飞往伯班克。但如何保护他不受伤害就由你决定了。”

“Absolutely. We can land him at Edwards, for a start. Keep him here and bring him to FCOP ourselves tomorrow. Or you can let him fly to Burbank as planned. But how you protect him from there would be up to you.”

我考虑了一下。我主要认为，这个决定应该由比我高三级的人来做。但我怀疑，考虑到时间限制，我只能这么做。

I considered. Mostly, I thought, this decision should be made by someone about three levels above me. But I suspected that, given the time constraints, I was stuck with it.

我最终决定让 Factor Man 降落在伯班克，原因有二。首先，最好由 FBI 来处理他，而不是将责任交给空军。对我们来说，这比对他们来说更像一次任务。其次，如果中国人有这么好的计划在洛杉矶袭击他，他们就不会直接在他们唯一的航空母舰甲板上打个洞了。

I eventually decided to let Factor Man land at Burbank for two reasons. First, better that the FBI take care of him than handing the responsibility to the Air Force. This was a much more typical mission for us than for them. And second, if the Chinese had such a good plan for attacking him in LA, they wouldn’t have just made a hole in the deck of their one and only aircraft carrier.

“让他按计划在伯班克降落。我会派一队人在那里照顾他。”

“Let him land in Burbank as planned. I’ll have a team there to look after him.”

哈金拿起电话，他不需要再拨一次。“我是哈金。请通知护航飞机，目的地由湾流飞行员决定。他们只是在必要时提供保护和协助。”

Harkin picked up the phone he didn’t have to dial again. “This is Harkin. Please let the escorting aircraft know that the destination is at the discretion of the Gulfstream pilot. They are simply to protect and assist as needed.”

他挂了电话。这家伙不擅长社交礼仪。

He hung up. Not big on social pleasantries, this guy.

因子人

Factor Man

2021 年 7 月 9 日，距离 FCOP 还有一天。上午 9:52

July 9, 2021, one day to FCOP. 9:52 AM

我们十二个人有两名乘务员。当我们滑行到跑道时，有人用真正的玻璃杯给我们提供我们喜欢的饮料。我们吃到了美味的开胃小菜。不用问他们就告诉我我的饮料不含麸质。

There were two flight attendants for the twelve of us. While we taxied out to the runway, we were given drinks of our choice in real glasses. We were served canapés that were delicious. I was told without having to ask that mine were gluten-free.

飞行员登场了。

The pilot came on.

“早上好，女士们，先生们。欢迎登机。飞机起飞后，飞往洛杉矶的航程应该会超过两个小时。我们的航线是直接飞越沙斯塔山，然后沿着加州中央谷地飞往洛杉矶。我们应该会在中午左右降落在伯班克。

“Good morning, ladies and gentlemen. Welcome aboard. Once we’re airborne, the flight down to LA should take us a little more than two hours. Our route of flight has us going directly over Mount Shasta and then following the California Central Valley down to Los Angeles. We should be landing at Burbank around noon.

“今天早上我们确实遇到了一些不寻常的事情，希望对你来说是个好消息。我听说尤金会有护航队护送我们到达目的地。克拉马斯瀑布空军联队的四架 F-15 战机。他们应该很快就要到了，尤金的空中交通管制员要求我们推迟起飞时间，直到他们到达。应该不会超过几分钟。”

“We do have something a little unusual this morning, hopefully a treat for you. I’ve been told that we’re going to have an escort from Eugene down to our destination. Four F-15’s from the Air Force wing in Klamath Falls. They should be arriving here momentarily, and the Eugene air traffic controllers have asked us to delay our departure until they’re here. Shouldn’t be more than a couple of minutes.”

F-15 负责护航。不知为何，我没想到飞入 FCOP 的其他飞机都得到了类似的待遇。

F-15’s as an escort. Somehow I didn’t think that all the other planes flying into FCOP were getting similar treatment.

我认为，骗局已经败露了。

The jig, I figured, was up.

* * *

* * *

几分钟后，我们确实起飞了，向北飞去，然后急转弯向南飞去。早晨的雾气已经散去，我们爬升时，我看到了我们家的壮丽景色。不久，我们两边各出现了两架战斗机，取代了那副景象。

We did indeed take off a few minutes later, departing to the north and then doing a sweeping turn back southbound. The morning fog had cleared, and I got a great view of our house as we climbed out. That view was shortly replaced by a pair of fighters showing up on each side of us.

F-15 比我们的小，但差距不大。它们是单座战机，距离我们足够近，我们可以辨认出四名飞行员的面容。三男一女。伊恩看到他们离我们这么近，欣喜若狂。

The F-15’s were smaller than we were, although not by much. They were single seaters, close enough that we could make out the features of each of the four pilots. Three men and one woman. Ian was beside himself with glee at seeing them so close.

然而对于我来说，它们却带来了一些问题。

For me, however, they posed something of a problem.

我的计划是，在洛杉矶地区度过一个随意而又相当低调的日子；毕竟，这可能是我很长一段时间内最后一个正常的日子。但如果政府出于某种原因认为我们需要保护，那么我们在当地可能也需要保护。我想政府也会在那里照顾我们，但我想我保持公开身份可能会有所帮助。

My plan had been to spend a random and fairly low-key day in the LA area; it was, after all, likely to be my last normal day for quite a while. But if the government thought for some reason that we needed protection, we would presumably need it on the ground as well. I figured that the government would be looking after us there also, but suspected I could probably help by staying public.

于是我走到女儿身边，她一脸期待地看着手机。“嘿，”我开口道。

So I walked over to my daughter, her face predictably in her phone. “Hey,” I began.

“嘿。”脸仍然对着手机。

“Hey.” Face still in phone.

“我在想。我们中午左右就能到洛杉矶，对吧？我们去迪士尼乐园玩一天怎么样？”

“I was thinking. We’re going to get to LA around noon, right? How about if we spend the day at Disneyland?”

她把脸从手机上移开。23 岁的她仍然是世界上最狂热的迪士尼粉丝之一。“是的！”不知怎的，她把这个词变成了两个音节。

Face out of phone. At twenty-three, she’s still one of the biggest Disney fans on the planet. “Yes!” Somehow she turned the word into two syllables.

于是我问大家：“Rachel 和我觉得我们今天下午应该去迪士尼乐园。谁一起去？”

So I asked the group. “Rachel and I think we should go to Disneyland this afternoon. Who’s in?”

几乎所有人都到齐了，我问船长是否可以将我们的目的地改为奥兰治县。他告诉我，今天洛杉矶盆地比平时繁忙一些，但他会看看能不能帮上忙。

Pretty much everyone was in, and I asked the captain if he could change our destination to Orange County. He told me that the LA Basin was a bit busier than usual today, but he’d see what he could do.

乘坐私人飞机确实有其好处。

Flying by private jet definitely has its virtues.

就在这一切发生的时候，又有两架飞机出现了。单座、单引擎，比 F-15 略矮一些。

As all of this was going on, two more planes showed up. Single seat, single engine, a little bit stubbier than the F-15’s.

伊恩宣布，它们是 F-35，第五代隐形战斗机，可能驻扎在南加州的爱德华兹。我们都透过窗户目瞪口呆地看着。

Ian announced that they were F-35s, a fifth-generation stealth fighter, probably based at Edwards in Southern California. We all gawked through the windows.

每个人的行为都相当正常。我的孩子们已经完成了社交媒体的基本功能，放下手机，在飞机上四处闲逛，试图表现得若无其事，同时在脑海里尽可能多地思考他们认为这将是一生难得的经历。

Everyone was behaving fairly predictably. My kids, social media necessities completed, had put down their phones and were poking around the plane, trying to look casual while they embedded in their brains as many aspects as possible of what they assumed would be a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

伊恩全神贯注地凝视着窗外，我想象着如果物理上可行的话，他就会重新出现在某架战斗机的驾驶舱里。

Ian was staring so intently out the windows that I imagined he would simply have rematerialized in one of the fighters’ cockpits, had that been physically possible.

我的牧师和他的家人很放松，享受着这段旅程。玩得很开心。伊恩的父母看起来全神贯注，也想沉浸在其中，但没有我的牧师一家玩得那么开心。我觉得事情对他们来说有点太奇怪了。

My pastor and his family were simply relaxed, enjoying the ride. Having fun. Ian’s parents looked totally engaged, also trying to soak things up but not having quite as much fun as my pastor’s family. I think things were just a little too weird for them.

丹尼斯和我静静地坐着，手牵着手。

Denise and I were sitting quietly, holding hands.

然后发生了一件奇怪的事情。四架飞机（F-35 和两架 F-15）脱离了我们的视线，飞到了我们右边的某个地方。它们的尾翼亮了起来，我不需要伊恩告诉我它们正在开着加力燃烧器飞行。无论它们要去哪里，它们都飞得很快。更奇怪的是，其中两架发射了导弹。

And then something odd happened. Four of the planes – the F-35’s and two of the F-15’s – broke away, flying off to our right somewhere. Their tails lit up, and I didn’t need Ian to tell me that they were flying on afterburners. Wherever they were going, they were going in a hurry. And stranger still, two of them fired missiles.

好吧，废话。

Well, crap.

当战士出现时，我并不担心。这意味着政府知道我是谁，这有点不幸，但这也意味着他们站在我这边，这显然是幸运的。无论如何，一直隐瞒我的身份到 FCOP 一直都是一个不太可能的事情。

I hadn’t worried when the fighters showed up. It meant the government knew who I was, which was sort of unfortunate, but it also meant that they were on my side, which was clearly fortunate. Concealing my identity all the way to FCOP had always been a long shot anyway.

所以战士本身并没有困扰我。但他们似乎被需要，这让我很困扰。这意味着除了政府之外还有人不仅找到了我，还试图杀死我。

So the fighters themselves hadn’t bothered me. But it bothered me a lot that they seemed to be needed. That meant that someone other than the government had not only found me, but actually tried to kill me.

这可能是中国人干的。谷歌还不够愤怒，如果我死了，他们损失惨重。尽管苹果可能想把这项技术留给自己，希望政府也能这么做，但我看不出他们这么做。

It was presumably the Chinese. Google wasn’t angry enough, and they had a lot to lose if I died. Much as Apple might want to keep the technology to itself, hoping the government would do the same, I couldn’t see them doing this.

但肯定是有人。我凝视着窗外，想到我危及了与我同机的 11 名乘客的生命。一切突然变得比几分钟前更加真实。我很高兴我们决定留在公众视野中，去迪士尼乐园。

But it was certainly someone. I stared out the window and thought about the fact that I had jeopardized the lives of the eleven wonderful people on the flight with me. Everything was suddenly much more real than it had been even just a few minutes ago. I was glad we had decided to stay in the public eye and go to Disneyland.

在我试图理清思绪时，丹妮丝走了过来，把手放在我的肩膀上。她也明白了。“如果再给你一次机会，”她轻声问我，“你会选择不同的做法吗？”

As I was trying to sort it all out in my mind, Denise came over and put her hand on my shoulder. She had figured it out, too. “If you had it to do over again,” she asked me quietly, “Would you do it any differently?”

三十年的婚姻生活会改变这一切。“可能不会，”我回答道。

Three decades of marriage will do that. “Probably not,” I answered.

她笑了。“原来如此。”

She smiled. “So there you go.”

随着导弹在远处爆炸，导弹尾迹也消失了，但丹尼斯和我仍然保持原样，不知何故，我们和其他十个人一起在飞机上独自飞行。

The missile contrails vanished as the missiles themselves exploded in the distance, but Denise and I remained as we were, somehow alone on the flight with ten other people.

哈德森

Hudson

2021 年 7 月 9 日，距离 FCOP 还有一天。上午 10:37

July 9, 2021, one day to FCOP. 10:37 AM

迪士尼乐园？该死的迪士尼乐园？

Disneyland? Freakin’ Disneyland?

事实上，这可能是个好消息。目前前往伯班克的 25 名特工团队将在警报声中迅速赶往奥兰治县的约翰·韦恩机场。他们会准时到达。

In reality, it was probably pretty good news. The 25-agent team currently heading to Burbank would race, sirens blazing, to John Wayne Airport in Orange County. They would arrive in time.

目的地的改变将使其他计划跟踪 Factor Man 并前往约翰·韦恩机场接他的人变得困难。首先，他们需要了解计划的变更。即使他们知道了，他们自己也很难更换机场。谷歌地图显示，目前两地之间 53 英里的路程需要近两个小时，而且中国间谍不太可能有警报器。

The destination change would make it difficult for anyone else planning on tracking Factor Man to pick him up at John Wayne. For a start, they’d need to learn of the change in plans. And even if they did, they would be hard pressed to switch airports themselves. Google Maps indicated that it currently would take almost two hours to drive the 53 miles between the two locations, and Chinese spies were unlikely to have sirens.

在迪士尼乐园监视某人是小菜一碟。到处都是人，但密度通常足够小，因此很容易监视某人。

Monitoring someone at Disneyland would be child’s play. People everywhere, but the density generally small enough that it was easy to keep someone in sight.

当所有事情都解决的时候，我还在爱德华兹。我指示前往伯班克的特工掉头前往奥兰治县，并让他们都知道他们需要抓紧时间，因为他们必须在 11:45 之前到达那里。除了一对开车向南前往伯班克的特工，其他人都赶到了，他们离得有点远。我告诉他们只需前往迪斯尼乐园等待指示即可。我取消了 Factor Man 乘坐的飞机的主人在奥兰治县机场提供的两辆车，并用我们自己的两辆车代替。我们显然无法确保迪斯尼乐园成为整个拍摄地，但至少我们可以确保这些车是我们的。

I was still at Edwards as all of this got worked out. I instructed the agents heading to Burbank to turn around and go to Orange County, and let them all know they’d need to hustle because they had to be there by 11:45. Everyone would make it except one pair of agents who had been driving south to Burbank and were just a little too far out. I told them to simply head to Disneyland and await instructions. I canceled the two cars being provided at Orange County airport by the owner of the jet Factor Man was traveling on, and replaced them with two of our own vehicles. We obviously couldn’t secure Disneyland as a location in its entirety, but we could make sure that the cars, at least, were ours.

然后哈金将军的电话响了。他不需要拨打的那部电话。他听了一会儿，说：“等一下。”他指着一张桌子后面的一名穿制服的军官，然后指着我。

And then General Harkin’s phone rang. The one he didn’t need to dial. He listened for a minute and said, “Wait one.” He pointed to a uniformed officer behind one of the desks, and then pointed to me.

警官走到我面前。“对不起，先生，”他说。“我们需要你清理这个房间。”

The officer came up to me. “I’m sorry, sir,” he said. “We need you to clear this room.”

“打扰一下？”

“Excuse me?”

“仅限军人，先生。很抱歉。”他用手按着我的肘部，将我推开。

“Military personnel only, sir. My apologies.” His hand was on my elbow, pressuring me out.

我们一离开控制室，他就指着几把椅子，再次道了歉，然后又走了进去。我拿出手机。他关上门时，我听到了欢呼声。

As soon as we left the control room, he pointed out some chairs, apologized again, and headed back in. I took out my cell phone. As the door closed behind him, I heard cheers.

伯克特

Burkett

2021 年 7 月 9 日，距离 FCOP 还有一天。太平洋时间上午 11:18

July 9, 2021, one day to FCOP. 11:18 AM Pacific time

我的一天有一个非常好的开始。

My day was off to a truly excellent start.

首先，我发表了一篇名为《赚 2000 亿美元，别人会发财》的文章，震惊了全世界。这篇文章描述了 Brian Finn 对 Factor Man 的投资，以及他作为 Factor Man 从苹果获得的 5% 报酬的所有者，将从这项努力中获利 100 亿美元的事实。这可是 10 亿美元啊。Finn 一下子就登上了福布斯全球富豪榜第 100 名左右。

First, I had scooped the world with an article Make $200 Billion and It’s a Safe Bet Someone Else Will Get Rich. That described both Brian Finn’s investment in Factor Man and the fact that he, as owner of 5% of Factor Man’s payment from Apple, would make $10B on the effort. That’s billion with a B. Finn was suddenly going to be somewhere around 100th on the Forbes list of the world’s richest folks.

与此同时，杰西·麦克默里将获得 4 亿美元的门票销售和转播权收入，减去她举办此次活动的费用。合理的猜测是 200 万美元用于场地，1500 万美元用于餐饮，也许还有 500 万美元用于飞机旅行。但无论结果如何，佩珀·波茨都将保留她必须使用的 4 亿美元中的绝大部分。

Jess MacMurray, meanwhile, would get the $400 million in revenue from ticket sales and broadcast rights, less whatever it cost her to put on the event. A reasonable guess was $2 million for the venue, $15 million for catering, and maybe $5 million for jet travel. But however it came out, Pepper Potts was going to be keeping the vast majority of the $400 million she had to work with.

当然，全世界最感兴趣的还是布莱恩·芬恩的参与。他拒绝了所有的采访请求，据说他自己正在前往帕萨迪纳的路上。由于芬恩没空，采访请求就转向了我，我接受了其中几个。

Of course, the world had mostly been interested in Brian Finn’s involvement. He had declined all of the interview requests and was reportedly en route to Pasadena himself. With Finn unavailable, the interview requests had turned to me, and I had accepted a few of them.

问题总是一样。我怎么知道芬恩参与了？他来找我，我说。我是否认为芬恩就是 Factor Man？不，我并不这么认为。我是否认为芬恩知道 Factor Man 是谁？可能不知道，但我不确定。我是否知道 Factor Man 是谁？

The questions were always the same. How did I learn of Finn’s involvement? He came to me, I said. Did I think Finn was Factor Man? No, I did not. Did I think Finn knew who Factor Man was? Probably not, but I wasn’t sure. Did I know who Factor Man was?

这有点难。我尽量掩饰地笑了笑，简单地说，如果我知道，我无意破坏那个家伙明天的派对。当然，这只会让这场狂欢变得更糟。

That was a bit harder. I smiled as evasively as I could, and said simply that if I did know, I had no intention of ruining the guy’s party tomorrow. Of course, that just made the feeding frenzy worse.

我几乎第一次意识到，写新闻比成为新闻更让我开心。但二十四小时后，就没人关心我了，这个问题自然会迎刃而解。我可以重新做回自己曾经的顶尖调查记者，并且确信我会写出任何内容，都会有很多人阅读。

I decided, hardly for the first time, that I was happier writing about the news than being the news. But in twenty-four hours, no one would care about me any more and that problem would solve itself. I could go back to being the ace investigative journalist I had become, secure in the knowledge that a ton of people would be reading anything I cared to write.

但今天最棒的事情莫过于我和艾玛乘坐私人飞机前往加利福尼亚。这是一次非常浪漫的经历，我们甚至简短地谈到了推迟婚礼，把这次旅行作为蜜月旅行。事实证明，这非常复杂，但我们表现得就像度蜜月的人一样。

But far and away the best thing about today was that I was on a private jet heading to California with Emma. It was such an absurdly romantic experience that we had even spoken briefly about pushing up the wedding and making this trip the honeymoon. That had proven insurmountably complicated, but we were acting pretty much like honeymooners anyway.

当然，这种行为也有其极限，艾玛和我可能已经超过了这个极限。在飞行了大约一半的时间后，我们稍事休息，重新与外界联系。现在的情况与起飞时完全不同。

Of course, there are limits to how long you can act that way, and Emma and I had probably pushed them. About halfway through the flight, we took a break to reconnect with the outside world. And it was a different place than it had been when we took off.

路透社：美国战斗机似乎在加州中部空战中获胜

Reuters: U.S. fighters apparently win dogfight over central California

有报道称，美国空军此前称被击落的飞机是训练事故，但事实上是一架中国战机。地面上多方报告称，在飞机残骸上发现了中文文字。

Reports are coming in that the aircraft destroyed in what the U.S. Air Force had previously described as a training incident was in fact a Chinese fighter. Numerous parties on the ground are reporting finding pieces of wreckage carrying Chinese writing.

据信，被摧毁的战机是成都的歼-20，它是 F-35 的模仿者，其设计采用了中国在 2009 年网络安全漏洞期间从美国窃取的信息。

The jet that was destroyed is believed to have been a Chengdu J-20, an F-35 copycat designed using information that the Chinese stole from the United States during a cyber security breach in 2009.

据观察人士报道，一组四架战斗机在加州中部门登霍尔斯普林斯镇附近一个相对人烟稀少的地区拦截了一架速度极快的飞机，该镇位于圣何塞以东约 50 英里处。地面上的多方报告称，交战期间出现了音爆。

Observers have reported that a group of four fighter aircraft intercepted a single plane at extremely high speed over a relatively unpopulated area of central California near the town of Mendenhall Springs, some 50 miles east of San Jose. Multiple parties on the ground reported sonic booms as part of the engagement.

美国和中国政府均未对此事发表评论，这必将进一步加剧两国之间本已高度紧张的关系。目前尚无任何关于飞行员从被击落的飞机中弹射出来的报道，美国空军虽然证实了此事，但​​除了表示没有美国军人死亡或受伤外，没有提供任何细节。

Neither the American nor the Chinese government has commented on the incident, which is sure to raise the already high tensions between the two nations even further. There are no reports of any pilot ejecting from the aircraft that was shot down, and the Air Force, while confirming that the incident took place, has provided no details other than to state that no American servicemen were killed or injured.

因子人

Factor Man

2021 年 7 月 9 日，距离 FCOP 还有一天。上午 11:52

July 9, 2021, one day to FCOP. 11:52 AM

四架飞机返回时，飞行员说道：“女士们，先生们，我们的目的地已经改为奥兰治县，我们会安排交通工具把你们所有人送到迪士尼乐园。他们会为你们准备十二张 VIP 门票。”

The pilot came on as the four jets returned. “Ladies and gentlemen, we’ve been able to change our destination to Orange County, and transportation will be there to take all of you to Disneyland. They will have twelve VIP tickets for you.

“我希望你们能喜欢那里的游乐设施。只是没有这次那么好。

“I hope you enjoy the rides there. Just not quite as much as this one.

“与此同时，恐怕我们和你们一样，对我们的护卫人员的所作所为并不了解。对此深表歉意。”

“Meanwhile, I’m afraid we don’t know any more than you do about what our escorts have been up to. Sorry about that.”

我看着丹妮丝。“关于我们护送人员的情况？”永远不要用介词结尾。

I looked at Denise. “About that up to which our escorts have been?” Never end a sentence with a preposition.

她笑了，我的心情顿时好了一些，心里也暖和了一些。

She laughed, and my day got a little bit better. My heart got a little bit warmer.

* * *

* * *

战斗机一直跟着我们，直到我们落地。我的意思是字面意思：每侧机翼有三架战斗机在空中飞行，直到我们的起落架接触。当我们接触时，它们无法完全跟着我们，但似乎以每小时十到二十英里的速度拉开了距离。

The fighters stayed with us until we hit the ground. And I mean literally: three fighters off each wing, airborne, until our wheels touched. They couldn’t quite stay with us as we touched, but seemed to be pulling away at maybe ten or twenty miles an hour.

我们滑行到机场的一个私人区域。湾流轿车的车门打开，我们走下车，台阶折叠起来；两辆黑色加长豪华轿车正在等着我们。不出所料，我们决定让孩子们坐一辆，大人坐另一辆。我们出发去迪士尼乐园了。

We taxied to a private area of the airport. The steps folded out as the Gulfstream’s door opened and we climbed down; two black stretch limos were waiting for us. Not surprisingly, it was decided that the kids would ride in one and the adults in the other. Off to Disneyland we went.

我不知道另一辆车里发生了什么；不管情况如何，孩子就是孩子。虽然我们的孩子都二十多岁了，但我认为他们还不算太老。

I have no idea what transpired in the other car; kids somehow just keep being kids whatever the circumstances. Although all of ours were somewhere in their twenties, I didn’t think they were too old to do that.

然而，我们的车里肯定有一头大象。毫不奇怪，我们谈到了从尤金下来的路上我们得到的护送，但谈话仍然断断续续，相当尴尬。我的牧师蒂姆·约翰逊终于看着我问道：“你是 Factor Man，对吧？”

Our car, however, definitely had an elephant in the room. We talked, not surprisingly, about the escort we had received on the way down from Eugene, but the conversation still tended to be staccato and fairly awkward. Tim Johnson, my pastor, finally just looked at me and asked. “You’re Factor Man, aren’t you?”

我感觉到丹尼斯握住了我的手。

I felt Denise take my hand.

我回头一看。“是的。”

I looked back. “I am.”

“是的！”蒂姆惊呼道。“我就知道！我就知道！”

“Yes!” Tim exclaimed. “I knew it! I knew it!”

我爱这个男人。他把所有新闻都视为好消息。这都是上帝计划的一部分，不管蒂姆是否理解这个计划。他的热情是永恒的，而且具有感染力。

I love this man. He views all news as good news. It’s all part of God’s plan, whether Tim understands that plan or not. His exuberance is both permanent and infectious.

他的妻子艾米笑了。

Amy, his wife, smiled.

“我看见了，”蒂姆解释道。“去问艾米吧。几个月来我一直说我以为是你。”

“I did,” Tim explained. “Ask Amy. I’ve been saying for months that I thought it was you.”

“是的，”艾米证实道。

“He has,” Amy confirmed.

埃瑟林顿夫妇没有说话，只是微微一笑。我猜想他们可能也心存疑虑。

The Etheringtons said nothing, smiling slightly. I suspected that they might have had their suspicions as well.

“你想谈谈吗？”蒂姆问道。

“Do you want to talk about it?” Tim asked.

我笑了笑，“也许明天吧。”

I smiled. “Maybe tomorrow.”

大象离开了房间。接下来的车程就比较正常了。是的，我们谈到了我们乘坐私人飞机的事实，还有六架战斗机为我们提供掩护。但我们也只是谈论了朋友之间经常讨论的废话。

And the elephant left the room. The rest of the drive was somewhat more normal. Yes, we talked about the fact that we had gotten to fly in a private jet, and that six fighters had given us cover. But we also just talked about the usual nonsense that friends discuss.

不寻常的是，这一切都与世隔绝。我们起床，飞往奥兰治县，坐上一辆私人豪华轿车前往迪士尼乐园，从来没有排队。没有排队买票，没有排队安检，也没有排队做其他事情。我们甚至没有看到有人排队。这太不真实了。

What wasn’t normal was the insulation of it all. We had gotten up, flown to Orange County, and gotten in a private limo headed to Disneyland without ever waiting in a line. No line for tickets, or for security, or for anything else. We hadn’t even seen a line. It was surreal.

我一直很羡慕有钱人和名人。他们有私人电影放映厅。有私人汽车和私人司机。一切都是私人的。

I’ve always envied the rich and famous. Private showings of movies. Private cars with private drivers. Private everything.

我知道我有点厌世；丹妮丝认为我疯了，竟然想如此与世隔绝。孩子们还小的时候，我下班回家，很高兴离最近的邻居只有四分之一英里。很多天，丹妮丝会整天呆在家里，很怀念能走过马路和别人聊天的时光。

I know that I’m a bit of a misanthrope; Denise thought I was crazy to want to be so isolated. When the kids were little, I would come home from work and be delighted to be a quarter mile from the nearest neighbor. Many days, Denise would be stuck at home all day, and would miss the times when she could just walk across the street and have a conversation.

在乘坐豪华轿车的途中，我意识到她一直说的都是对的。其他人让生活变得有价值。虽然我并不期待迪士尼乐园的排队，但我意识到如果没有排队，它就不可能是（甚至不能声称是）地球上最快乐的地方。

I realized during our limo ride how right she had always been. Other people are what make life worth living. While I wasn’t looking forward to the lines at Disneyland, I realized that it couldn’t be (or even claim to be) the happiest place on earth without them.

但结果却是，我们两全其美。迪士尼乐园有所谓的“VIP 通行证”。您可以得到一名导游（实际上，我们有两名导游），而且不用排到所有队伍的最前面，而是排到大约等待五分钟的地方。（这就像一张永久性的多次乘坐快速通行证，如果您知道那是什么的话。）

As it turned out, however, we got the best of both worlds. Disneyland has what are called “VIP passes.” You get a tour guide (actually, we got two tour guides), and get to go not to the front of all the lines, but to about the wait-for-five-minutes point. (It’s like a permanent multi-ride FastPass, if you know what those are.)

太棒了。我觉得这将是我一生中最后一天的匿名生活，但这是度过这一天的绝佳方式。我们一直待到午夜烟花表演结束，这时我们发现我们已经入住了各自的酒店（所有酒店都不同），豪华轿车司机有钥匙。第三辆车奇迹般地出现了，因为有三家不同的酒店，我们需要三辆不同的车。杰西·麦克默里的工作非常出色。再一次，我们不用排队。

It was awesome. A great way to spend what I figured would be the last day of anonymity I would ever have. We stayed until the fireworks at midnight, at which point we found that we had already been checked into our hotels (all different) and the limo drivers had the keys. A third car appeared sort of miraculously, since with three separate hotels, we’d need three separate cars. Jess MacMurray was exceptionally good at her job. Once again, there would be no lines.

唯一可能让我分心的事情是下午我收到的威廉·伯克特（William Burkett）发来的一条短信。

The only thing that might be called a distraction was a text from William Burkett that I got in the middle of the afternoon.

WB ：被摧毁的中国战机是你吗？

WB: Chinese jet that was destroyed – you?

FM ：我在迪士尼乐园

FM: I’m at Disneyland

WB ：所以呢？

WB: So?

FM ：完全不予公开？

FM: Totally off the record?

WB ：当然了

WB: Sure

FM ：思考

FM: Thinking

我不知道该如何回答。最后，我决定回避这个问题。

I had no idea how to respond. Finally, I just decided to duck the question.

FM ：我在迪士尼乐园

FM: I’m at Disneyland

我把手机收起来了。

And I put my cell phone away.

似乎每个人都知道我是谁。蒂姆和艾米知道。埃瑟林顿夫妇知道。威尔伯知道。空军也知道。我怀疑我的飞机是他们唯一保护的飞机，但如果他们在飞行前不知道，他们现在肯定知道了。所以政府知道。甚至中国人也知道。

It appeared that everyone simply knew who I was. Tim and Amy knew. The Etheringtons knew. Wilbur knew. The Air Force knew. I suspected mine was the only plane they protected, but if they didn’t know before the flight, they certainly knew now. So the government knew. Even the Chinese knew.

伟大的。

Great.

再过二十四小时。然后每个人都应该知道。我所需要做的就是在那之前不要扰乱政府显然想要照顾我的愿望。

Twenty-four more hours. And then everyone was supposed to know. All I needed to do was not mess up the government’s apparent desire to look after me until that happened.

我觉得很奇怪，政府显然知道中国人到底发生了什么，但他们却没有告诉任何人。为什么？我怀疑他们试图避免公众对中国人的所作所为表示强烈抗议；这只会让紧张局势日后更难缓和。考虑到中国人对封闭社会的依赖程度，无论如何，他们都会遇到很多麻烦，而我们增加这些困难可能不符合任何人的真正利益。

It struck me as odd that the government obviously knew exactly what had transpired with the Chinese, but they weren’t telling anyone. Why? I suspected that they were trying to avoid a public outcry against what the Chinese had done; that would make it only harder to ratchet tensions back down again later. Given how dependent the Chinese were on the closed nature of their society, they were about to have a whole lot of trouble in any case, and our adding to those difficulties probably wasn’t in anyone’s real interests.

太空山正在等待。

Space Mountain awaited.

刘

Liu

2021 年 7 月 9 日，距离 FCOP 还有一天。上午 9:52

July 9, 2021, one day to FCOP. 9:52 AM

李和我看着美国战斗机抵达，护送曼先生的飞机离开尤金。我们不仅错失了机会，而且辽宁号上的歼-20似乎也不太可能有更好的表现。考虑到风险，我相信无论如何都会有人尝试，飞行员很可能会英勇地牺牲在加州上空。

Li and I watched the American fighters arrive and escort Factor Man’s flight out of Eugene. Not only had our chance escaped us, but it seemed unlikely that the J-20 on the Liaoning would fare any better. Given the stakes, I was confident that the attempt would be made in any case, with the pilot likely dying a hero’s death in the skies over California.

我们住进了当地一家毫无特色的酒店，睡了六个小时，然后开车返回南加州。醒来后，我们得知中国飞行员确实遭遇了预料中的命运。第二次机会已经消失。

We checked into a featureless local hotel and slept for six hours before beginning the drive back to Southern California. On waking, we learned that the Chinese pilot had indeed suffered the anticipated fate. The second chance was gone.

我们离开尤金时，美国人正纷纷辞职，但由于这个镇很小，因此我们向南行驶时，路上车辆很少。

We left Eugene as the Americans were leaving their jobs, but the town was small enough that there was little traffic as we headed south.

* * *

* * *

我和李时不时地轮流开车，开车比我们去的时候悠闲多了。早上六点刚过，我们就回到了洛杉矶的酒店，一路上我们俩都偶尔打了个瞌睡，至少得到了部分休息。

Li and I exchanged driving responsibilities intermittently, and drove far more leisurely than we had in the opposite direction. We returned to our Los Angeles hotel shortly after six in the morning, each having dozed occasionally on the drive down and at least partially rested.

我们有足够的时间。我们回顾了 FCOP 本身的计划，然后回到房间，中午再次会面，然后开车前往玫瑰碗。活动本身计划于六点开始，预计交通状况不会比美式足球比赛或类似活动之前更糟糕。

We had plenty of time. We reviewed our plans for FCOP itself and retired to our rooms, to meet again at noon and drive to the Rose Bowl. The event itself was scheduled to begin at six, and traffic was projected to be no worse than it was prior to an American football game or similar event.

二十六

26

哈德森

Hudson

2021年7月10日上午6点30分，FCOP当天

July 10, 2021. 6:30 AM, the day of FCOP

我FCOP 当天，我按时醒来，为注定忙碌而漫长的一天做好准备。

I woke at the usual time on the day of FCOP, and prepared for what would surely be an eventful – and long – day.

我向调查局报到。特工曼和他的家人住在酒店里。他们的房间受到监控，他们仍然睡得很香。他们被安排在相邻的房间，有特工监视着电梯和楼梯。其他特工很早就开始了工作，他们假扮成从事各种普通工程任务的工作人员。没有人动弹。

I checked in with the bureau. Factor Man and his family were in their hotel. Their rooms were monitored, and they were all still sleeping soundly. They had been booked into adjacent rooms, with agents watching the elevators and the stairs. Other agents began early, posing as staff on various mundane engineering tasks. No one was stirring.

我向 CNN 查询了情况。关于在爱德华兹机场引起欢呼的事件，没有任何实质性的报道。一些新闻机构报道称，中国人指责一名流氓飞行员；其他人意识到这没有道理，因为流氓飞行员根本不具备飞往加利福尼亚所需的燃料。两国之间的紧张局势仍然很高，但似乎没有立即升级的危险。

I checked in with CNN. There was nothing of substance to report on the incident that had generated the cheering at Edwards. Some news agencies were reporting that the Chinese were blaming a rogue pilot; others were realizing that didn’t make sense because a rogue pilot wouldn’t have anything like the fuel needed to get to California. Tensions between the two countries remained high but did not seem in immediate danger of escalating.

我向当地 ASAC 报了名。他已经醒了，但没有什么新消息要汇报。我们商定我将在八点后不久离开酒店前往玫瑰碗球场。我有时间吃顿快餐。

I checked in with the local ASAC. He was awake but had nothing new to report. We agreed that I would leave the hotel shortly after eight and head to the Rose Bowl. I had time for a quick breakfast.

酒店餐厅和洛杉矶的交通都和我到达加州以来的每一天差不多，也就是说，比任何合理的解释都要慢。我在十一点前不久到达玫瑰碗，比大多数其他与会者都早到了，把车停在了对普通人开放的最近的一个停车位上。场地本身将在中午开放。

Both the hotel restaurant and the Los Angeles traffic were pretty much the same as they had been every day since I arrived in California, which is to say slower than any reasonable explanation warranted. I arrived at the Rose Bowl shortly before eleven and, getting there far before most of the other attendees, parked in one of the closest of the spots open to mere mortals. The venue itself would open at noon.

安保工作已委托给 FBI、帕萨迪纳警方和 TSA 联合负责。没有哪个组织具备足够的能力来处理所有这些事情。每个入口都安装了全身扫描仪。所有个人物品都必须装进一夸脱的密封袋中；任何更大的物品都可以通过安检，但不允许带入体育场本身。任何大于 iPad 的电子设备都不允许带入。安保人员总共约有三千人。

Security had been delegated to a combination of the FBI, the Pasadena police, and TSA. No single organization was appropriately equipped to deal with all of it. Full body scanners had been installed at every entrance. All your personal possessions had to fit into a one-quart Ziploc; anything larger could be checked with security but would not be allowed into the stadium itself. No electronics were permitted larger than an iPad. The security staff numbered about three thousand, all told.

总统和第一夫人可以得到安检通行证。但只有他们才能得到通行证。就是这样。

The president and first lady would get a pass on the security. But they were the only ones who would. Period.

场馆内部一切如预期。除了通常的体育场座位外，球场上还摆放了数千把椅子。它们与舞台相隔约三十英尺，舞台将是一切的中心。

Inside, things were as expected. In addition to the usual stadium seating, thousands of chairs had been arranged on the field. They were separated by about thirty feet from the stage that would be the center of it all.

体育场后方摆放着数百个便携式麦克风。Factor Man 要求这些麦克风可用于活动本身，他认为这相当于一场新闻发布会，但决定等到观众入座后才会分发麦克风。

Hundreds of portable microphones were lined up around the back of the stadium. Factor Man had requested their availability for the event itself, which he viewed as a press conference of sorts, but it had been decided that the mics would be distributed only after the crowd had settled in.

伯克特

Burkett

FCOP 当天早上 8:00

8:00 AM, the day of FCOP

艾玛和我大约在纽约时间早上八点、十一点醒来。我们继续在床上享受蜜月之旅，直到十一点，这时我们叫了客房服务。

Emma and I woke around eight, 11 AM New York time. We stayed in bed, continuing the honeymoon experience, until eleven, at which point we ordered room service.

前一天晚上，司机把我们送到了比弗利威尔希尔酒店，司机告诉我们，我们去玫瑰碗的车会在一点半来接我们。如果你是老电影迷，威尔希尔酒店就是艾克塞尔·弗利在《比弗利山警探》中订的房间。

The packet we had gotten the previous night from the driver who brought us to the Beverly Wilshire Hotel indicated that our ride to the Rose Bowl would meet us at one-thirty. If you’re a fan of old movies, the Wilshire is the hotel where Axel Foley gets a room in Beverly Hills Cop.

包裹里还装着房间钥匙，免得我们不得不亲自入住酒店。经过一番艰难的努力，我们才设法将过夜行李拖到我们的房间。幸好我们没有费心打包睡衣。

The packet had also contained room keys, lest we suffer the indignity of actually having to check into the hotel ourselves. It was only after a difficult struggle that we managed to haul our overnight bags up to our room without assistance. Good thing that we hadn’t bothered to pack pajamas.

我可以习惯这个。

I could get used to this.

我们大约在四点一刻到达玫瑰碗，行驶了 24 英里，花了两个多小时。司机说，对于大型活动来说，这很正常，我不明白为什么有人会住在这里。

We got to the Rose Bowl at about a quarter to four, taking a bit over two hours to travel 24 miles. The driver said it was pretty normal for a big event, and it was a mystery to me why anyone would live here.

安检就像机场一样，你甚至不允许携带随身物品。这对富人和名人来说并不好，他们显然觉得如果没有足够大的手提包来装下整套高尔夫球杆，他们根本无法生存。守卫入口的人很有礼貌，但非常不灵活。你会得到一个透明的小塑料袋，他们会告诉你，只要能装下任何东西，你就可以带任何东西进去。如果你把钱包放在包里，那就没问题，但钱包会被打开并被手拿检查。

Security was like an airport where you weren’t even allowed a carry-on. This did not go over well with the rich and famous, who apparently felt that they were simply unable to exist without handbags big enough to hold a complete set of golf clubs. The folks manning the entrances were polite but utterly inflexible. You got a clear little plastic bag and were told you could bring in whatever you wanted as long as it fit. If you put a purse in the bag, that was fine, but the purse would be opened and searched by hand.

我很好奇总统会如何处理这个装有核发射密码的“足球”，据说它大约有一个大公文包那么大，重约 45 磅。我猜他们对他宽容了一些。

I wondered what the president did with the “football” containing the nuclear launch codes, which is supposedly about the size of a large attaché case and weighs about 45 pounds. My guess is that they cut him some slack.

我们一通过安检就有食物。

Once we got through security, there was food.

到处。

Everywhere.

这里不仅有随处可见的美食，而且还具备两种我从未在任何类型的体育赛事中体验过的特质。

Not only was the food omnipresent, it had two qualities I have never experienced at a sporting event of any kind.

首先，它是免费的。甚至连酒水也是免费的。每个人都会得到两张与入场券挂钩的饮料券（不要把未使用的饮料券送给你快喝醉的朋友！）。我从不喝苏格兰威士忌，但这些酒瓶看起来很旧。玛格丽特酒很棒。艾玛喝了几杯葡萄酒，说味道棒极了。

First, it was free. Even the alcohol was free. Everyone got two drink tickets that were tied to their admissions (no giving unused tickets to your nearly drunk friends!). I never drink Scotch, but the bottles looked old. The margaritas were excellent. Emma had a couple glasses of wine and said it was phenomenal.

其次，更令人惊讶的是，食物和饮料一样好。实际上，非常好。真是太棒了。巨大的桌子上堆满了螃蟹和虾。迷你乳蛋饼。生菜杯。贝奈特饼里有某种加勒比海鲜馅料。

Second, and even more surprising, the food was as good as the drinks were. Beyond good, actually. It was fantastic. Giant tables piled with crab and shrimp. Mini quiches. Lettuce cups. Beignets with some kind of Caribbean seafood stuffing.

如果你还想吃更多，这里还有常见的竞技场食物。披萨。热披萨。热狗由希伯来国家公司制作，外面烤得焦焦的，就像它们应该的那样。还有堆满熏牛肉的鲁宾三明治。意大利香肠和龙虾卷。还有纯素和素食选择，我对此完全不感兴趣。

If you wanted more, there was the usual arena food as well. Pizza. Hot pizza. The dogs were made by Hebrew National, and they were charred on the outside like they’re supposed to be. There were Reubens, piled high with pastrami. Italian sausages and lobster rolls. There were vegan and vegetarian selections as well, in which I had absolutely no interest.

还有甜点。巨大的冰淇淋吧，你可以用你能想到的所有口味的冰淇淋（以及你可能想不到的许多口味）制作自己的圣代。所有你能想到的配料。整张桌子都是巧克力火锅，巧克力是我吃过的最好的。我吃了很多。

And dessert. Giant ice cream bars where you made your own sundae with every flavor of ice cream you could think of (and many you probably couldn’t think of). Every topping imaginable. Whole tables devoted to chocolate fondue, and the chocolate was the best I’ve ever had. And I’ve had a lot.

喝完饮料券后，还有很多其他饮料。当然是软饮料。各种鲜榨果汁。咖啡也很棒。浓缩咖啡也很棒。还有拿铁。我需要停止喝它们。

Once your drink tickets were gone, there were plenty of other beverages. Soft drinks, of course. A wide variety of freshly squeezed juices. And the coffee was awesome. As was the espresso. And the lattes. I needed to stop drinking them.

杰西·麦克默里 (Jess MacMurray) 知道如何举办派对。

Jess MacMurray knew how to throw a party.
